original: hṛtpadme nābhipadme ca mukhapadme tathaiva ca // //
analyzed: hṛd padme nābhi padme ca mukha padme tathā eva ca
translated: In the lotus of the heart, in the lotus of the navel, and likewise in the lotus of the face,

original: vasate paramātmā vai yadi śaknoṣi veditum /🔽navadvārāṇi saṅghaṭṭa navanāḍīrnirodhayet // //
analyzed: vasate paramātmā vai yadi śaknoṣi veditum  nava dvārāṇi saṅghaṭṭa nava nāḍīḥ nirodhayet
translated: The supreme Self resides, if you are able to know it.🔽One should close the nine doors and the nine channels,

original: saṃhṛtya navavāyūṃśca hṛtpadme tān praveśayet /
analyzed: saṃhṛtya nava vāyūn ca hṛd padme tān praveśayet
translated: Having withdrawn the nine winds, one should introduce them into the lotus of the heart.

original: tasya padmasya vai nālaṃ piṅgalānāḍirucyate // //
analyzed: tasya padmasya vai nālam piṅgalānāḍiḥ ucyate  /
translated: The stalk of that lotus is said to be the channel named Pingala,

original: tayā proktāstrayaḥ paścāt sūtre maṇigaṇā iva /
analyzed: tayā proktāḥ trayaḥ paścāt sūtre maṇi gaṇāḥ iva
translated: By which three are mentioned later, like a string of jewels.

original: pradhānānāḍayastrisrastālabdhvā vedayet puram // //
analyzed: pradhānā nāḍayaḥ trisraḥ tāḥ ālabdhvā vedayet puram
translated: Having obtained the three principal channels, one should know the city.

original: tāsāṃ mukhyā tu vai hyekā tāṃ jñātvā jñāyaṃse param /
analyzed: tāsām mukhyā tu vai hi ekā tām jñātvā param
translated: Among them, the principal one is indeed the one, knowing which one knows the supreme.

original: tasyā madhye sthitaṃ jñeyaṃ sarvakāraṇamavyayam // //
analyzed: tasyāḥ madhye sthitam jñeyam sarva kāraṇam avyayam
translated: In the middle of that, one should know the imperishable cause of all.

original: yaṃ viditvā mahāsena uktāntriṃ kartu marhasi /
analyzed: yam viditvā mahāsenaḥ ukta antrim kartu m arhasi
translated: Knowing whom, O Mahasena, you are worthy to perform the sacrifice mentioned in the scriptures.

original: daśamadvāramāśritya daśamānāḍikā / ha // //
analyzed: daśama dvāram āśritya daśamā nāḍikā ha
translated: Relying on the tenth door, the tenth channel,

original: daśamaṃ pavanaṃ labdhvā viṣuvat grahaṇaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: daśamam pavanam labdhvā viṣuvant grahaṇam bhavet
translated: Having obtained the tenth wind, there will be the attainment of the equinox.

original: ākāśaṃ grāhayet tasya granthi bhedaiḥ śanaiḥ śanaiḥ // //
analyzed: ākāśam grāhayet tasya granthi bhedaiḥ śanais śanais
translated: One should grasp the space of that gradually by the divisions of the knots.

original: p / kṛtvā vai brahmasandhānaṃ samyag jñātvā parāṃ gatim /
analyzed: kṛtvā vai brahma sandhānam samyak jñātvā parām gatim
translated: Having united with Brahman, having perfectly known the supreme goal,

original: pare sthāne layaṃ kṛtvā niṣkampaḥ susamāhitaḥ // //🔽praṇave saṃharedātmā grāhyaṃ niśśeṣamārutam /
analyzed: pare sthāne layam kṛtvā niṣkampaḥ su samāhitaḥ  praṇave saṃharet ātmā grāhyam niśśeṣa mārutam
translated: Having dissolved into the supreme place, unshakable, well concentrated,🔽One should withdraw the self into the Pranava, the entire object, the entire wind.

original: praṇavaṃ tu samuccārya tālvoṣṭhapuṭaśobhitam // //
analyzed: praṇavam tu samuccārya tālu oṣṭha puṭa śobhitam
translated: Having uttered the Pranava, adorned with the cavity of the palate and lips,

original: kalpāyurapi tatraivamākramatyanu saṃśayaḥ /🔽karaṇānyapraśeṣāṇi granthi dvārāṇi sarvaśaḥ // //
analyzed: kalpa āyuḥ api tatra evam ākramati anu saṃśayaḥ  karaṇāni apraśeṣāṇi granthi dvārāṇi sarvaśas
translated: Even one with a lifespan of a Kalpa, having thus entered, there is no doubt.🔽All the remaining sense organs, all the knots and openings,

original: nāḍayaḥ pavanāt sarvā viditvā sarvamucyate /
analyzed: nāḍayaḥ pavanāt sarvāḥ viditvā sarvam ucyate
translated: All the channels, having known them from the wind, everything is said.

original: yāvacca jñāyate vatsa tāvad brahmalayī bhavet // //
analyzed: yāvat ca jñāyate vatsa tāvat brahma layī bhavet  /
translated: And as long as it is known, O child, for that long there would be dissolution into Brahman.

original: taṃ viditvā mahāsena utkrānti kartu marhasi // //
analyzed: tam viditvā mahāsenaḥ utkrānti kartu m arhasi  /
translated: Having known that, O Mahasena, you should perform the Utkirana (withdrawal).

original: kasmin sthāne sthito brahmā kena dvāreṇa siddhyati /
analyzed: kasmin sthāne sthitaḥ brahmā kena dvāreṇa siddhi ati
translated: In which place does Brahman reside? By which door does he succeed?

original: etat sarvaṃ samācakṣva yadi tuṣṭosi me prabho // //
analyzed: etat sarvam samācakṣva yadi tuṣṭaḥ asi me prabho
translated: Tell all this if you are pleased with me, O Lord.

original: p / brahmā brahme laye kuryād bhūtād bhūteṣu valayam /
analyzed: b brahmā brahme laye kuryāt bhūtāt bhūteṣu valayam
translated: Brahman should dissolve into Brahman, the element into the elements.

original: anyathā naiva siddhyanti kalpakoṭi śatairapi // //
analyzed: anyathā na eva siddhyanti
translated: Otherwise, they do not succeed even in hundreds of millions of Kalpas.

original: bhūtāṃstyaktvā tu vai deva kena dvāreṇa siddhyati /
analyzed: bhūtān tyaktvā tu vai deva kena dvāreṇa siddhi ati
translated: Having abandoned the elements, O God, by which door does one succeed?

original: etan me saṃśayaṃ sarvaṃ vaktumarhasya śeṣataḥ // //
analyzed: etat me saṃśayam sarvam vaktum arhasya śeṣatas
translated: Please explain to me all this in detail.

original: guhyāti guhyaṃ guhyaṃ ca atiguhyaṃ ṣaḍānana /
analyzed: guhya ati guhyam guhyam ca ati guhyam ṣaḍānana
translated: O Six-faced One, the secret, the great secret, and the secret of secrets,

original: yattvayā veditaṃ praśnaṃ tat sarvaṃ kathayāmite // //🔽vyoma madhye sthitā sūryaḥ sūryamadhye sthitaḥ saśī /
analyzed: yat tvayā veditam praśnam tat sarvam kathayāmi te  vyoma madhye sthitā sūryaḥ sūrya madhye sthitaḥ saśī
translated: I shall tell you all that you have asked about.🔽The sun is situated in the middle of space, and the moon is situated in the middle of the sun.

original: śaśi madhye sthitaṃ tejastejomadhye sthitaṃ param // //
analyzed: madhye sthitam tejaḥ tejaḥ madhye sthitam param
translated: The light is situated in the middle of the moon, and the supreme is situated in the middle of the light.

original: ṛju snigdhaṃ ca vimalaṃ vidyullekhe vadussaham /
analyzed: ṛju snigdham ca vimalam vidyut lekhe vadussaham
translated: Straight, smooth, and pure, like the flash of lightning,

original: hṛtpa / sūryaṃ śaśi hṛtāsanam /
translated: The sun is in the heart, and the moon is in the seat of the heart.

original: teṣāṃ madhye paraṃ tejo ye nedaṃ pratitiṣṭhitam // //
analyzed: teṣām madhye param tejaḥ ye na idam pratitiṣṭhitam
translated: In the middle of them is the supreme light, which is not established in this.

original: p / mahattejāṃsi yaccittaṃ pratyakṣaṃ yasya ṣaṇmukha /
analyzed: mahat tejāṃsi yat cittam pratyakṣam yasya ṣaṇmukha
translated: O Six-faced One, the mind of one who has directly perceived the great lights,

original: brahmadvārasya vai pṛṣṭhe dhūmroyaṃ sarvataḥ sthitaḥ // //
analyzed: brahmadvārasya vai pṛṣṭhe dhūmraḥ yam sarvatas sthitaḥ  /
translated: Behind the door of Brahman, this smoke is situated everywhere.

original: hṛdisthaṃ gaganasthaṃ ca ubhāvekatra cintayet /
analyzed: hṛdistham gagana stham ca ubhau ekatra cintayet
translated: One should contemplate the one situated in the heart and the one situated in the sky as one.

original: anyathā naiva siddhyanti yuktihīnāḥ śikhidhvaja // //
analyzed: anyathā nā eva siddhyanti yukti hīnāḥ śikhidhvaja
translated: Otherwise, they are not accomplished, O Peacock-bannered One, without reason.

original: yanmayoktaṃ paraṃbrahma hṛdyākāśe vyavasthitam /
analyzed: yat mayā uktam paraṃ brahma hṛdi ākāśe vyavasthitam
translated: The supreme Brahman, which I have said is situated in the sky of the heart,

original: sā śaktiḥ sa śivaṃ jñānaṃ jñeyaṃ cākṣaramavyayam // //
analyzed: sā śaktiḥ sa śivam jñānam jñeyam ca akṣaram avyayam
translated: That is the power, that is the auspicious knowledge, and the imperishable and immutable object of knowledge.

original: etat te brahmasandhānaṃ brahmadvāreṇa yo bhavet /
analyzed: etat te brahma sandhānam brahmadvāreṇa yaḥ bhavet
translated: This is the union with Brahman, which occurs through the door of Brahman.

original: sa muktaḥ sarvaduḥkhebhyaḥ sadyo brahmaṇi kalpayan // //
analyzed: sa muktaḥ sarva duḥkhebhyaḥ sadyas brahmaṇi kalpayan
translated: He who is liberated from all sorrows, instantly conceiving Brahman,

original: utkrānti kāle tasyedaṃ viditaṃ brahmaṇo layam /
analyzed: utkrānti kāle tasya idam viditam brahmaṇaḥ layam
translated: At the time of departure, knowing this, the dissolution of Brahman,

original: sa vai līno pare vatsa ityājñā pārameśvarī // //
analyzed: sa vai pare vatsaḥ iti ājñā pārameśvarī
translated: He is merged in the supreme, O child, this is the command of the Supreme Lord.

original: brahmanāḍiṃ brahmavāyuṃ brahma / labhet /
analyzed: brahma nāḍim brahma vāyum brahma
translated: One should attain the Brahman-tube, the Brahman-wind, and the Brahman.

original: brahmaṇaṃ tu samantavyaṃ brahmākṣara la / // //
analyzed: tu
translated: But Brahman should be contemplated, the syllable of Brahman is...

original: p / praṇavaṃ hṛtsthitaṃ padmaṃ praṇavaṃ vyomni saṃsti / m /
analyzed: praṇavam hṛd sthitam padmam praṇavam vyomni
translated: The lotus situated in the heart is the Praṇava, the Praṇava is situated in the sky.

original: kālāgni rudraparyantaṃ yāvadbrahmāṇḍagocaram // //
translated: Up to the end of the Rudra of the fire of time, as far as the sphere of the universe,

original: sarvaṃ dṛṣṭaṃ pareṇedaṃ praṇaveṇa śikhidhvaja /
analyzed: sarvam dṛṣṭam pareṇa idam praṇaveṇa śikhidhvaja
translated: All this is seen by the supreme Praṇava, O Śikhidhvaja.

original: vāṅmayaṃ sakalaṃ yaśca trailokyaṃ sa carācaram // //
analyzed: vāc mayam sakalam yaḥ ca trailokyam sa carācaram
translated: And he who is the entire verbal world, and the three worlds with the moving and unmoving,

original: brahmādi stambha paryantaṃ sarvaṃ praṇavasambhavam /
analyzed: brahma ādi stambha paryantam sarvam praṇava sambhavam
translated: Everything from Brahman down to a pillar, all is born from the Praṇava.

original: tasmin neva layaṃ kuryāt te caiva brahmavādinaḥ // //
analyzed: tasmin na iva layam kuryāt te ca eva brahma vādinaḥ
translated: In that alone one should effect dissolution, and they are the expounders of Brahman.

original: sa eva paramaṃ sthānaṃ sa eva paramākṣaram /
analyzed: saḥ eva paramam sthānam saḥ eva parama akṣaram
translated: He alone is the supreme abode, he alone is the supreme syllable.

original: tryakṣaraṃ ca tridhā bhinnaṃ tristhānaṃ triguṇātmakam // //
analyzed: tri akṣaram ca tridhā bhinnam tri sthānam triguṇa ātmakam
translated: And the three syllables are divided into three, the three abodes are of the nature of the three qualities.

original: tridevāgni trayaṃ caiva tridevaṃ paramaṃ smṛtam /
analyzed: tri deva agni trayam ca eva tri devam paramam smṛtam
translated: The three deities, the three fires, and the three deities are remembered as supreme.

original: pañcamūrti dharaṃ devaṃ śivaṃ paramakāraṇam // //
analyzed: pañca mūrti dharam devam śivam parama kāraṇam
translated: The god who bears the five forms, Shiva, the supreme cause,

original: devadānava / ddhānāṃ gandharvoragarakṣasām // //
analyzed: deva dānava iddhānām gandharva uraga rakṣasām
translated: The god who is the source of origin and dissolution of all beings, including gods, demons, men, gandharvas, serpents, and rakshasas,

original: sarveṣāṃ praṇavaṃ yoni layaṃ tatraiva ṣa / /
analyzed: sarveṣām praṇavam layam tatra eva
translated: The one in whom all these merge,

original: p / brahmāviṣṇuśca rudraśca īśvaraḥ śiva eva ca // //
analyzed: a brahmā viṣṇuḥ ca rudraḥ ca īśvaraḥ śivaḥ eva ca  /
translated: Brahma, Vishnu, Rudra, Ishvara, and Shiva,

original: praṇaveṇa tu vai siddhāḥ sambhūtāḥ praṇavena tu /
analyzed: praṇaveṇa tu vai siddhāḥ sambhūtāḥ praṇavena tu
translated: All of them are accomplished by Pranava, born from Pranava.

original: akṣaraṃ cakṣaraṃ caiva sa nāmaṃ nāmavarjitam // //
analyzed: akṣaram ca akṣaram ca eva sa nāmam nāma varjitam
translated: The imperishable and perishable, with name and without name,

original: sa rūpaṃ rūparahitaṃ praṇavaṃ paripaṭhyate /🔽uccāryaṃ tu hyanuccāryaṃ svaramasvarameva ca // //
analyzed: sa rūpam rūpa rahitam praṇavam paripaṭhyate  uccāryam tu hi anuccāryam svaram asvaram eva ca
translated: The formless and formless, is recited as the supreme Pranava.🔽What is to be uttered and what is not to be uttered, the vowel and the non-vowel,

original: ghoṣaṃ caiva hyaghoṣaṃ ca praṇavaṃ paraśakti dhṛt /
analyzed: ghoṣam ca eva hi aghoṣam ca praṇavam para śakti dhṛt
translated: The voiced and the unvoiced, Pranava holds the supreme power.

original: sa mantraṃ ca hyamantraṃ ca grāhyamagrāhyameva ca // //
analyzed: sa mantram ca hi a mantram ca grāhyam a grāhyam eva ca
translated: The mantra and the non-mantra, what is to be grasped and what is not to be grasped,

original: grāhyagrāhaka bhedena praṇavaṃ sarvataḥ sthitam /
analyzed: grāhya grāhaka bhedena praṇavam sarvatas sthitam
translated: Pranava is present everywhere, by the distinction of the graspable and the grasper.

original: praṇavaṃ yo na jānāti viśvasyā yatanaṃ param // //
analyzed: praṇavam yaḥ na jānāti viśvasya yatanam param
translated: For one who does not know Pranava, the supreme abode of the universe,

original: tasya mokṣaḥ kuto vatsa kalpakoṭi śatairapi //
analyzed: tasya mokṣaḥ kutas vatsa kalpa koṭi śataiḥ api
translated: O child, how can there be liberation for him, even in hundreds of crores of kalpas?

original: adyāpi saṃ /
analyzed: adya api sam
translated: Even today, he is not liberated.

original: va hṛdaye vartate mahān /
analyzed: va hṛdaye vartate mahān
translated: resides in the heart.

original: p / kasmin sthāne sthito brahmā tat samācakṣva me prabho //
analyzed: kasmin sthāne sthitaḥ brahmā tat samācakṣva me prabho
translated: In which place does Brahma reside? Please tell me that, O Lord.

original: śrī īśvara uvāca
analyzed: śrī īśvaraḥ uvāca
translated: The Lord said:

original: sarvatrāvasthito brahmā prāṇināṃ dehadhārakaḥ /
analyzed: sarvatra avasthitaḥ brahmā prāṇinām deha dhārakaḥ
translated: Brahma, the supporter of the bodies of living beings, is present everywhere.

original: viśeṣataḥ punarvatsa triṣu sthāneṣu saṃsthitaḥ // //
analyzed: viśeṣataḥ punar vatsa triṣu sthāneṣu saṃsthitaḥ
translated: But, O child, he is especially present in three places.

original: hṛtpadme nābhipadme tu mukhapadme tathaiva ca /
analyzed: hṛd padme nābhi padme tu mukha padme tathā eva ca
translated: In the lotus of the heart, in the lotus of the navel, and likewise in the lotus of the face.

original: sa pratyakṣaṃ dṛśyate vai vikārāvasthitaḥ prabhuḥ // //
analyzed: sa pratyakṣam dṛśyate vai vikāra avasthitaḥ prabhuḥ
translated: That Lord, abiding in the state of modifications, is seen directly.

original: hasate rudate caiva nṛtyate gāyate tathā /
analyzed: hasate rudate ca eva nṛtyate gāyate tathā
translated: He laughs, weeps, dances, and sings.

original: bhuñjate jighrate caiva śṛṇu vakṣyāmi hetutaḥ // //🔽unmeṣe ca nimeṣe ca viṣāde caiva harṣite /
analyzed: bhuñjate jighrate ca eva śṛṇu vakṣyāmi hetutaḥ  unmeṣe ca nimeṣe ca viṣāde ca eva harṣite
translated: He eats, smells, and hears. Listen, I will tell the reason.🔽In opening and closing the eyes, in sorrow and joy,

original: sukhaduḥkhānyasau vetti śītoṣṇasparśanāni ca // //
analyzed: sukha duḥkhāni asau vetti śīta uṣṇa sparśanāni ca
translated: he experiences happiness and sorrow, and the sensations of cold and heat.

original: kṣuṭtṛṣṇā maithunaṃ nidrā prabodhaṃ jāgratā sthitam /
analyzed: kṣuṣ tṛṣṇā maithunam nidrā prabodham jāgratā sthitam
translated: Yawning, thirst, sexual desire, sleep, awakening, and remaining awake -

original: ete pratyakṣato yasya dṛśyante vai ṣaḍānana // //
analyzed: ete pratyakṣatas yasya dṛśyante vai ṣaḍānana
translated: these are seen directly by him, O Six-faced One.

original: nānyadīpaṃ svarūpeṇa paramātmā ca labhyate // //
analyzed: na anya dīpam sva rūpeṇa paramātmā ca labhyate
translated: The Supreme Self is not attained by any other light or form.

original: p / vismayo me mahādeva adyāpi na nivartate /
analyzed: vismayaḥ me mahādeva adya api na nivartate
translated: O Mahadeva, my wonder still does not cease.

original: tristhānāvasthitaṃ devaṃ śrotumicchāmi vai prabho // //
analyzed: tri sthāna avasthitam devam śrotum icchāmi vai prabho
translated: I wish to hear about the God who resides in the three places, O Lord.

original: tuṣṭohamadyate putra yat tvayā pṛcchyate hyaham /
analyzed: tuṣṭā uham adyate putra yat tvayā pṛcchyate hi aham
translated: I am pleased today, O son, that you are asking me.

original: tristhānāvasthitaṃ brahma tacchṛṇuṣva yathākramam // //
analyzed: tri sthāna avasthitam brahma tat śṛṇuṣva yathākramam
translated: Listen to that Brahman which resides in the three places, in due order.

original: hṛtpadme vasate nityaṃ sthirā bhāvena vai guha /
analyzed: hṛd padme vasate nityam sthirā bhāvena vai guha
translated: O Guha, he always resides in the lotus of the heart with a stable state of being.

original: mukhapadme nābhipadme gatāgatiṃ karoti saḥ // //
analyzed: mukha padme nābhi padme gatāgatim karoti saḥ
translated: In the lotus of the face and the lotus of the navel, he performs coming and going.

original: hṛtpadmasya tu pattrāṇi nāḍayastāḥ prakīrtitāḥ /
analyzed: hṛd padmasya tu pattrāṇi nāḍayaḥ tāḥ prakīrtitāḥ
translated: The petals of the lotus of the heart are proclaimed to be the channels.

original: praṇādyā vāyavaḥ sarve vahante teṣu nāḍiṣu // //
analyzed: praṇādyāḥ vāyavaḥ sarve vahante teṣu nāḍiṣu
translated: All the winds beginning with Praņa flow in those channels.

original: nāḍayo vai daśa proktāḥ pavanāni tu vai daśa /
analyzed: nāḍayaḥ vai daśa proktāḥ pavanāni tu vai daśa
translated: The channels are said to be ten, and the winds are also ten.

original: pradhānā piṅgalā śūnya sṛjate pahare tu saḥ // //🔽nāḍi cakrasya sarvasya nābhibhuvyavasthitam /
analyzed: sṛjate tu saḥ  / cakrasya sarvasya nābhi bhuvi avasthitam
translated: The principal one is Piṅgalā, and he creates in the first watch.🔽The navel is situated in the middle of the entire wheel of channels.

original: p / nāḍi cakrasya vai tad vat piṅgalā madhyatodbhavā // //
analyzed: cakrasya vai tat vat piṅgalā madhyatā udbhavā
translated: Like that, Piṅgalā arises in the middle.

original: iḍā caiva suṣumṇā ca piṅgalā ca tṛtīyakā /
analyzed: iḍā ca eva suṣumṇā ca piṅgalā ca tṛtīyakā
translated: The third one is Iḍā, Suṣumnā, and Piṅgalā.

original: ekakāyaṃ ca sarvāsāṃ yukti bhede pṛthak pṛthak // //
analyzed: eka kāyam ca sarvāsām yukti bhede pṛthak pṛthak
translated: All of them are in one body, but their functions are different.

original: iḍā vahati vāmena tatra somo vyavasthitaḥ /
analyzed: iḍā vahati vāmena tatra somaḥ vyavasthitaḥ
translated: Iḍā flows on the left, and there Soma is situated.

original: suṣupiṅgalā dakṣiṇaputra tratra sūryo vyavasthitaḥ // //
analyzed: suṣupiṅgalāḥ dakṣiṇaputra tratra sūryaḥ vyavasthitaḥ  /
translated: The Sun is located in the right son, Suṣumṇā and Piṅgalā.

original: suṣumṇā madhya nāḍī tu tatra sarvaṃ sadā sthitam /
analyzed: suṣumṇā madhya nāḍī tu tatra sarvam sadā sthitam
translated: Suṣumnā is the central channel, where everything always abides.

original: iḍāmadhye sthitaṃ deva pitṛyāneti kathyate // //
analyzed: iḍā madhye sthitam deva pitṛ yāna iti kathyate
translated: O God, located in the middle of Iḍā, it is called the path of the ancestors.

original: piṅgalāvasthitaṃ putra devayāneti kathyate /
analyzed: piṅgala avasthitam putra devayānā iti kathyate
translated: O Son, located in Piṅgalā, it is called the path of the gods.

original: suṣumṇā madhyamānāḍī tatrasthaṃ mokṣamārgadaśa // //
analyzed: suṣumṇā madhyamā nāḍī tatrastham mokṣa mārga daśa
translated: Suṣumnā is the central channel, and what is located there is the path to liberation.

original: sarvārambheṇa yogīndro mokṣamārgapadāvahaḥ /
translated: The lord of yogis, by all undertakings, brings about the state of the path to liberation.

original: karṇikānta sthitaṃ devamavyaktaṃ rūpavarjitam // //
analyzed: sthitam devam avyaktam rūpa varjitam
translated: The unborn God, devoid of form, is located in the pericarp.

original: tadurthāvayava sarveyairvyāptā nāḍayodaśa /
analyzed: tad urtha avayava
translated: All the ten channels are pervaded by it.

original: p / tāsāṃ madhye tu vai hyekā suṣumṇā nāma śrūyate // //
analyzed: a tāsām madhye tu vai hi ekā suṣumṇā nāma śrūyate
translated: Among them, only one is known by the name Suṣumnā.

original: tayā proktāstrayaḥ padmāḥ sūtreṇa maṇayo yathā /
analyzed: tayā proktāḥ trayaḥ padmāḥ sūtreṇa maṇayaḥ yathā
translated: By it, the three lotuses are mentioned, like pearls on a thread.

original: tasyābhyantarasaṃlīnau prāṇāpānau vyavasthitau // //
analyzed: tasya abhyantara saṃlīnau prāṇa apānau vyavasthitau
translated: The exhalation and inhalation are situated therein, merged within it.

original: suṣumṇāmadhyasaṃsthau tu prāṇāpānau śikhidhvaja /
analyzed: suṣumṇā madhya saṃsthau tu prāṇa apānau śikhidhvaja
translated: O Peacock-bannered One, the exhalation and inhalation are located in the middle of Suṣumnā.

original: sṛṣṭipralayarūpeṇa sthitā vetau kumāraka // //
analyzed: sṛṣṭi pralaya rūpeṇa sthitāḥ vā etau kumāraka
translated: O Youth, these two abide in the form of creation and dissolution.

original: grathitau parayāśaktyā avyaktā mṛtayothayā /
analyzed: grathitau parayā aśaktyā avyaktāḥ
translated: Bound by the supreme power, they are unborn and undying.

original: ādhārādheya bhāvena parāpara vibhāgaśaḥ // //
analyzed: ādhāra ādheya bhāvena parāpara vibhāgaśaḥ
translated: By the relationship of support and supported, in the division of higher and lower,

original: sṛṣṭi pralaya rūpeṇa prāṇāpānau vyavasthitau /
analyzed: sṛṣṭi pralaya rūpeṇa prāṇa apānau vyavasthitau
translated: The exhalation and inhalation are established in the form of creation and dissolution.

original: tayormadhye sthitaṃ brahma anyaktaṃ rūpavarjitam // //
analyzed: tayoḥ madhye sthitam brahma anyaktam rūpa varjitam
translated: In the middle of them, Brahman abides, other than that, devoid of form.

original: grasate sṛjate caiva sarvaṃ viśvaṃ carācaram /🔽nābhipadmasya vai pṛṣṭe hṛtpadmaṃ tu adho mukham // //
analyzed: grasate sṛjate ca eva sarvam viśvam carācaram  nābhi padmasya vai pṛṣṭe hṛd padmam tu adhas mukham  /
translated: It swallows and creates the entire universe, the moving and unmoving.🔽Behind the lotus of the navel, the lotus of the heart faces downward.

original: ubhābhyāṃ karṇikā madhye paraṃ tadvīkṣya putraka // //
analyzed: ubhābhyām karṇikā madhye param tat vīkṣya putraka
translated: In the middle of the two calyxes, O son, behold that supreme [reality].

original: p / kathaṃ me dṛśyate tāta tasya rūpasya gocaram /
analyzed: katham me dṛśyate tāta tasya rūpasya gocaram
translated: How is that object of the form of that [reality] seen by me, O father?

original: yaṃ dṛṣṭvāhaṃ gamiṣyāmi ajanma padamavyayam // //
analyzed: yam dṛṣṭvā aham gamiṣyāmi ajanma padam avyayam
translated: Seeing whom, I will attain the unborn, imperishable state.

original: sādhu sādhu mahāprājña yogayogeśvareśvara /
analyzed: sādhu sādhu mahā prājña yoga yoga īśvara īśvara
translated: Well done, well done, O greatly wise one, lord of lords of yoga and discipline,

original: yat tvayā coditaṃ praśnaṃ durvijñeyaṃ surorapi // //
analyzed: yat tvayā coditam praśnam durvijñeyam suroḥ api
translated: The question that has been asked by you, difficult to know even for the gods,

original: na brahmaṇā na sūryeṇa na candrena na viṣṇunā /
analyzed: na brahmaṇā na sūryeṇa na candrena na viṣṇunā
translated: Is not known by Brahma, the sun, the moon, Vishnu,

original: na tu devyā tvayā caiva yadabhya paripṛcchitam // //
analyzed: na tu devyā tvayā ca eva paripṛcchitam
translated: Or even by the goddess, what has been asked by you.

original: tat te haṃ kathayiṣyāmi guhādguhyataraṃ param /
analyzed: tat te ham kathayiṣyāmi guhāt guhyataram param
translated: I will tell you that, the supreme, more secret than the secret,

original: vikṣepa vacanaṃ rakṣeccharaṇāgatavatsvata // //
analyzed: vikṣepa vacanam rakṣet śaraṇa āgata vatsvata
translated: Protecting the scattered words, like one who has taken refuge in himself.

original: rājāmantrī varakṣyo yaṃ na deyaṃ yasya kasya cit /
analyzed: rājā amantrī varakṣyaḥ yam na deyam yasya kasya cit
translated: The king's minister should be protected, not to be given to anyone.

original: adīkṣitena dātavyamaśraddheyamanārjavo // //
analyzed: a dīkṣitena dātavyam aśraddheyam anārjavaḥ
translated: It should be given by one who is not initiated, it should not be given to one who is not faithful or honest.

original: ākule kūrahṛdaye durjane ca dāpayet /
analyzed: ākule kūra hṛdaye durjane ca dāpayet
translated: It should be given to one who is confused, hard-hearted, or of bad character.

original: dātavyaṃ dīkṣate putra gurudevāgnipūjake // //
analyzed: dātavyam dīkṣate putra guru deva agni pūjake  /
translated: O son, it should be given to one who is initiated, who worships the guru, gods, and fire.

original: p / śraddhadhāne jitakrodhe lobhamohaparāṅmukhe /
analyzed: a śraddhadhāne jita krodhe lobha moha parāṅmukhe
translated: To one who has faith, who has conquered anger, who is averse to greed and delusion.

original: parīkṣyate guruḥ śiṣyamabdāni dvādaśāni vai // //
analyzed: parīkṣyate guruḥ śiṣyam abdāni dvādaśāni vai
translated: The guru should examine the disciple for twelve years.

original: anena bhāvitaṃ viśvaṃ sarvameva carācaram // //
analyzed: anena bhāvitam viśvam sarvam eva carācaram
translated: By this, the entire universe, all that is moving and unmoving, is pervaded.

original: adyame janmasaphalaṃ adyame saphalaṃ śrutam /🔽adyame saphalā buddhiradyame saphalaṃ tapaḥ // //
analyzed: adyame janma saphalam adyame saphalam śrutam  adyame saphalā buddhiḥ adyame saphalam tapaḥ
translated: Today my birth is fruitful, today my learning is fruitful.🔽Today my intellect is fruitful, today my austerity is fruitful.

original: sa kṛtārthosmi vai hṛdya adya jātosmi vai punaḥ /
analyzed: sa kṛtārthaḥ asmi vai hṛdya adya jātaḥ asmi vai punar
translated: I am successful, O dear one, I am born again today.

original: muktosmi cā /dya vai tāta bhavasaṃsārabandhanāt // //
analyzed: muktaḥ asmi ca adya vai tāta bhava saṃsāra bandhanāt
translated: Today I am liberated, O father, from the bondage of worldly existence.

original: guhyaṃ jñānaṃ viditvā tu tṛptohaṃ sarvadā prabho /
analyzed: guhyam jñānam viditvā tu tṛptaḥ ūham sarvadā prabho
translated: Having known the secret knowledge, I am always satisfied, O Lord.

original: adhunā śrotumicchāmi praṇāpānau va
analyzed: adhunā śrotum icchāmi
translated: Now I wish to hear about the exhalation and inhalation,

original: p / kathaṃ sthitau //
analyzed: katham sthiti
translated: how they are situated.

original: śṛṇu vatsa mahāprājña yat tvayā codito hyaham /
analyzed: śṛṇu vatsa mahā prājña yat tvayā coditaḥ hi aham
translated: Listen, O son of great wisdom, to what you have urged me to speak.

original: tat tohaṃ kathayiṣyāmi prāṇāpānau yathā sthitau // //
analyzed: tat toham kathayiṣyāmi prāṇa apānau yathā sthitau
translated: I will now tell you how the exhalation and inhalation are situated.

original: prāṇādyā vāyavaḥ pañca ūrdhvabhāge vyavasthitāḥ /
analyzed: prāṇa ādyāḥ vāyavaḥ pañca ūrdhva bhāge vyavasthitāḥ
translated: The five winds beginning with prana are situated in the upper part.

original: teṣāṃ madhye pradhānau dvau prāṇāpānau prakīrtitau // //
analyzed: teṣām madhye pradhānau dvau prāṇa apānau prakīrtitau
translated: Among them, the two principal ones are declared to be prana and apana.

original: kandukanyāyamāśritya adha ūrdhvaṃ pravartate /
analyzed: kanduka nyāyam āśritya adhas ūrdhvam pravartate
translated: Relying on the principle of a ball, it moves below and above.

original: yogamārgeṣu sarveṣu gatireṣā pravartate // //
analyzed: yoga mārgeṣu sarveṣu gatiḥ eṣā pravartate
translated: In all the paths of yoga, this is the movement.

original: navānāṃ caiva vāyūnāṃ prāṇāpānau prakīrtitau /
analyzed: navānām ca eva vāyūnām prāṇa apānau prakīrtitau
translated: Of the nine winds, prana and apana are declared.

original: hṛtpadme nābhipadme tu dvādaśānte tathaiva ca // //
analyzed: hṛd padme nābhi padme tu dvādaśānte tathā eva ca
translated: In the lotus of the heart, in the lotus of the navel, and likewise at the end of the twelve.

original: viśate paramātmā vai prāṇāpāna gati sthitaḥ /
analyzed: viśate paramātmā vai prāṇa apāna gati sthitaḥ
translated: The supreme Self enters, abiding in the movement of prana and apana.

original: apānaḥ saṃharet prāṇaṃ prāṇopānasya vai tathā // //
analyzed: apānaḥ saṃharet prāṇam prāṇa upānasya vai tathā
translated: Apana withdraws prana, and likewise prana of apana.

original: pa / sthitaṃ teṣāṃ sṛjate saṃharatyasau /
analyzed: sthitam teṣām sṛjate saṃharati asau
translated: Relying on the principle of a ball, it moves below and above.

original: udayāsta manaṃ hyetan nānyaṃ manye śikhidhvaja // //🔽p / bāhyasaṃsthasya sūryasya nodayo vai nāstamayaḥ /
analyzed: udaya asta hi etat na anyam manye śikhidhvaja  a bāhya saṃsthasya sūryasya na udayaḥ vai na astamayaḥ
translated: I do not think of any other, O Shikhidhvaja.🔽The external sun has no rising or setting.

original: tapate satataṃ vatsa viśvaṃ diṅmārgavīkṣaṇe // //
analyzed: tapate satatam vatsa viśvam diś mārga vīkṣaṇe
translated: O child, it always shines, illuminating the directions and paths of the universe.

original: tasmāt sarvaprayatnena śarīrasthaṃ vicārayet /
analyzed: tasmāt sarva prayatnena śarīra stham vicārayet
translated: Therefore, with all effort, one should contemplate the Self residing in the body.

original: yaṃ jñātvā prāpyate mokṣo yena bhūyo na jāyate // //
analyzed: yam jñātvā prāpyate mokṣaḥ yena bhūyas na jāyate  /
translated: Knowing which, liberation is attained, by which one is not born again.

original: jñātumicchamyahaṃ deva udayāsta mayaṃ katham /
analyzed: jñātum icchami aham devaḥ udaya asta mayam katham
translated: O God, I wish to know how the rising and setting of the sun is done,

original: ahorātraṃ kṛtaṃ caiva saṅkrānti viṣvavad dvayam // //
analyzed: ahorātram kṛtam ca eva saṅkrānti viṣva vat dvayam
translated: The day and night are made, and the two solstices are in the directions.

original: ati priyopi me putra pṛcchase śobhanaṃ suta /
analyzed: ati priyā upi me putra pṛcchase śobhanam suta
translated: O son, even though you are very dear to me, you ask a splendid question.

original: yat tvayā coditaṃ praśnamanākhyaṃ kathayāmite // //
analyzed: yat tvayā coditam praśnam ana ākhyam kathaya amite
translated: I will tell you the secret that you have asked about.

original: yan mayoktaṃ paraṃ brahma hṛdisthaṃ taṃ ṣaḍānana /🔽tasya śaktirbhavedeṣā udayāsta manaṃ prati // //
analyzed: yat mayā uktam param brahma hṛdistham tam ṣaḍānana  tasya śaktiḥ bhavet eṣā udaya asta manam prati
translated: O Six-faced One, that supreme Brahman which I have said to be in the heart,🔽This is its power in relation to rising and setting.

original: ūrdhvamārge yadā jvālā vartate tasya tejasaḥ /
analyzed: ūrdhva mārge yadā jvālā vartate tasya tejasaḥ
translated: When the flame of that radiance moves upwards,

original: udayaṃ taṃ vijānī
analyzed: udayam tam vijānī
translated: Know that to be the rising of the sun.

original: p / aliṅgaṃ liṅgarūpeṇa avyaktaṃ vyaktagocaram // //
analyzed: aliṅgam liṅga rūpeṇa avyaktam vyakta gocaram   /
translated: The unmanifest, in the form of the manifest, in the form of the linga.

original: ākāśaṃ sambhavedvatsa yo vai śaktyā layaṃ gataḥ /
analyzed: ākāśam sambhavet vat sa yaḥ vai śaktyā layam gataḥ
translated: O child, the sky comes into existence, he who has merged into Shakti.

original: pṛthivyāpastathā tejo vāyurākāśa eva ca // //
analyzed: pṛthivī apaḥ tathā tejaḥ vāyuḥ ākāśaḥ eva ca
translated: Earth, water, fire, air, and space itself,

original: ete pañca mahābhūtā yatotpannā layaṃ hi tat /
analyzed: ete pañca mahābhūtāḥ yata utpannāḥ layam hi tat
translated: These five great elements, from which they have arisen, into that they dissolve.

original: ākāśaṃ grasate śaktiryathāgrastākhilaṃ jagat // //
analyzed: ākāśam grasate śaktiḥ yathā a grasta akhilam jagat
translated: Shakti swallows the sky, as if the entire world is swallowed.

original: sṛṣṭiṃ tu kurute sā tu śivājñā coditā guha /
analyzed: sṛṣṭim tu kurute sā tu śiva ājñā coditā guha
translated: But she creates the creation, impelled by Shiva's command, O Guha.

original: pralayaṃ sarvabhūtānāṃ mayā te kathitaṃ suta // //
analyzed: pralayam sarva bhūtānām mayā te kathitam suta
translated: O son, I have told you about the dissolution of all beings.

original: mayi coktaṃ śive nedaṃ pūrvaṃ tuṣṭena sarvadā /
analyzed: mayi ca uktam śive na idam pūrvam tuṣṭena sarvadā
translated: And this has not been told by me to anyone else before, O Shiva, but always to you, who are pleased with me.

original: bhūtotpatti layaṃ caiva mayājñātaṃ vibhāgaśaḥ /
analyzed: bhūta utpatti layam ca eva mayā ajñātam vibhāgaśaḥ
translated: The creation and dissolution of beings have been known by me in detail.

original: bhūyo vijñātumicchāmi /
analyzed: bhūyas vijñātum icchāmi
translated: I wish to know more.

original: page to missing
analyzed: page to missing
translated: Page missing

original: p / ākāraṃ brahmasaṃsthitam // //
analyzed: di
translated: The form of Brahman is established.

original: atiguhyatamaṃ praśnaṃ yat tvayā coditaṃ guha /
analyzed: ati guhyatamam praśnam yat tvayā coditam guha
translated: The question that has been asked by you, O Guha, is extremely secret.

original: tat sarvaṃ kathayiṣyāmi śṛṇuṣvā vahitaṃ tathā // //
analyzed: tat sarvam kathayiṣyāmi śṛṇuṣva vahitam tathā
translated: I shall tell you all that. Listen attentively.

original: śūnyaṃ śūnyaṃ punaḥ śūnyaṃ śūnyaṃ śūnyaṃ punaḥ punaḥ /
analyzed: śūnyam śūnyam punar śūnyam śūnyam śūnyam punar punar
translated: Empty, empty again, empty, empty, empty again and again.

original: śūnyācchūnyataraṃ śūnyaṃ tacchūnyaṃ śūnyameva ca // //
analyzed: śūnyāt śūnyataram śūnyam tat śūnyam śūnyam eva ca
translated: Emptier than empty, empty, that emptiness is empty itself.

original: śūnyaṃ śūnyaṃ tvayā proktamanena jñānatā mama /
analyzed: śūnyam śūnyam tvayā proktam anena jñāna tā mama
translated: Empty, empty has been said by you. By this I have become wise.

original: śūnyasyā śūnyatāṃ brūhi yadi tuṣṭosi me prabho // //
analyzed: śūnyasya śūnya tām brūhi yadi tuṣṭaḥ asi me prabho
translated: Tell me the emptiness of emptiness, if you are pleased with me, O Lord.

original: śūnyaṃ śūnyaṃ tu yo vetti śūnyaṃ śūnyaṃ tu yo bhavet /
analyzed: śūnyam śūnyam tu yaḥ vetti śūnyam śūnyam tu yaḥ bhavet
translated: He who knows emptiness as empty, and who becomes empty,

original: aśūnyaṃ taṃ vijānīyāt sarvaśūnyā layaṃ hitam // //
analyzed: a śūnyam tam vijānīyāt sarva śūnyāḥ layam hitam
translated: One should know him as non-empty, merged in all emptiness.

original: sarvabhūteṣu taṃ vatsa triśūnyaṃ hṛdisaṃsthitam /
analyzed: sarva bhūteṣu tam vatsa triśūnyam hṛdisaṃsthitam
translated: O child, that which is situated in the heart, consisting of three emptinesses, in all beings,

original: na tu jānanti taṃ śūnyamaśūnyā yena te kṛtāḥ // //
analyzed: na tu jānanti tam śūnyam a śūnyāḥ yena te kṛtāḥ
translated: But they do not know that emptiness by which they have been made non-empty.

original: śūnyabhūtaṃ śivaṃ jñeyaṃ śūnyabhūtā hi śaktayaḥ //
analyzed: śūnya bhūtam śivam jñeyam śūnya bhūtāḥ hi śaktayaḥ
translated: The empty should be known as auspicious, for the powers are indeed of empty nature.

original: p / aśūnyaṃ teṣvamīrūpaṃ sarvagaṃ cetanātmakam // //
analyzed: a śūnyam sarva gam cetanā ātmakam
translated: The non-empty is formless in them, all-pervading, and of the nature of consciousness.

original: na hi śūnyasya śūnyatvaṃ śūnyatvaṃ tasya bhāvanā /
analyzed: na hi śūnyasya śūnya tvam śūnya tvam tasya bhāvanā
translated: For emptiness is not the emptiness of the empty, its emptiness is the state of being empty.

original: vijñānaṃ jñāpakaṃ śūnyaṃ nirālambābalambhitam // //
analyzed: vijñānam jñāpakam śūnyam nirālamba abalambhitam
translated: Consciousness is the indicator of emptiness, which is without support and yet supported.

original: vibhutvena sthitaṃ śūnyaṃ ye nedaṃ pūritaṃ jagat /
analyzed: vibhu tvena sthitam śūnyam ye na idam pūritam jagat
translated: Emptiness abides by its all-pervasiveness, filling this world.

original: taṃ śūnyaṃ śūnyamityāhurvadanti jñānabuddhayaḥ // //
analyzed: tam śūnyam śūnyam iti āhuḥ vadanti jñāna buddhayaḥ
translated: They call that emptiness empty, and the wise declare it to be so.

original: śūnyasya śūnyatā nāsti aśūnyaṃ śūnyamucyate /🔽sṛṣṭipralaya rohitvā cchūnyasyāśūnyatāṃ viduḥ // //
analyzed: śūnyasya śūnyatā na asti a śūnyam śūnyam ucyate  sṛṣṭi pralaya śūnyasya a śūnyatām viduḥ
translated: Emptiness has no emptiness, the non-empty is said to be empty.🔽Knowing the non-emptiness of emptiness, they understand the creation and dissolution of the world.

original: śūnyāt sṛṣṭiḥ prasavati śūnye tu pralayaṃ punaḥ /
analyzed: śūnyāt sṛṣṭiḥ prasavati śūnye tu pralayam punar
translated: Creation proceeds from emptiness, and into emptiness it dissolves again.

original: tasmādaśūnyatā śūnye nirālambhāvalambhinam // //🔽nirālambhāvalambhitvaṃ śūnyatā yena siddhyati /
analyzed: tasmāt a śūnyatā śūnye nirālambha avalambhinam  nirālambha avalambhi tvam śūnyatā yena siddhi ati
translated: Therefore, emptiness is not empty, for the one who has attained the supportless support.

original: vijñānajñānayogena śūnyaṃ jñeyaṃ labheṣyasi // //
analyzed: vijñāna jñāna yogena śūnyam jñeyam labheṣyasi
translated: By the yoga of the knowledge of consciousness, one will attain the knowable emptiness, by which the state of being without support and yet supported is accomplished.

original: śūnyaṃtva śūnyaṃ jñātavyaṃ na hi śūnyosti kutra cit /
analyzed: śūnyam tva śūnyam jñātavyam na hi kutra cit
translated: Emptiness should be known as empty, for emptiness is nowhere.

original: p / teṣāṃ śūnyamidaṃ śūnyamajñānā yeṣu bhāvanā // //
analyzed: teṣām śūnyam idam śūnyam ajñānā yeṣu bhāvanā
translated: For them, this is empty, empty in what is imagined by the ignorant.

original: aśūnyaṃ sarvadā vatsa trailokyaṃ sa carācaram /
analyzed: a śūnyam sarvadā vatsa trailokyam sa carācaram
translated: O child, the three worlds, with their moving and unmoving beings, are never empty.

original: brahmādi stambhaparyantaṃ sarvaṃ śūnyena pūritam // //
analyzed: brahma ādi stambha paryantam sarvam śūnyena pūritam
translated: From Brahma down to a clump of grass, everything is filled with emptiness.

original: tacchūnyaṃ pūritā śaktyā avyaktā yā śivotthayā /
analyzed: tat śūnyam pūritā śaktyā avyaktā yā śiva utthayā
translated: That emptiness is filled with the unmanifest Shakti, which arises from Shiva.

original: yathā caitanya bhāvena bodhitaṃ bhuvana trayam // //
analyzed: yathā caitanya bhāvena bodhitam bhuvana trayam
translated: Just as the three worlds are awakened by the state of consciousness,

original: vastu śūnyaṃ na ta cchūnyaṃ śūnyamajñānaśūnyatā /
analyzed: vastu śūnyam na tat śūnyam śūnyam ajñāna śūnyatā
translated: The existent is not empty, emptiness is the emptiness of ignorance.

original: taṃ śūnyaṃ jñāna rūpeṇa jñeyaṃ śūnyaṃ na tadguha // //
analyzed: tam śūnyam jñāna rūpeṇa jñeyam śūnyam na tat guha
translated: That emptiness should be known in the form of knowledge, emptiness is not hidden.

original: jñeya śūnyo palabdhitvaṃ nirālambāvabodhanam /
translated: The emptiness of the knowable is the attainment of the realization of the objectless.

original: na punaḥ śūnya bhāvastu śūnyesmiṃstattvataḥ suta // //
analyzed: na punar śūnya bhāvaḥ tu śūnye smin tattvataḥ suta
translated: But in reality, O son, there is no state of emptiness in emptiness.

original: tamo bhūtaṃ jagatsarvaṃ pūrvamāsī cchikhidhvaja /
analyzed: tamaḥ bhūtam jagat sarvam pūrvam āsīt śikhidhvaja
translated: O Shikhidhwaja, the entire world was previously in a state of darkness,

original: naṣṭa sūryendu vātaughairgrahanakṣatra tārakaiḥ // //
analyzed: naṣṭa sūrya indu vāta oghaiḥ graha nakṣatra tārakaiḥ
translated: With the sun, moon, winds, planets, stars, and constellations lost.

original: apratarkamavijñeyaṃ diśāsu vidiśāsu ca /
analyzed: apratarkam avijñeyam diśāsu vidiśāsu ca
translated: It was beyond thought and knowledge, in all the directions and intermediate directions.

original: na cordhvaṃ naiva pātālaṃ mahābhūtaistu varjitam // //
analyzed: na ca ūrdhvam na eva pātālam mahābhūtaiḥ tu varjitam
translated: There was no above or below, devoid of the great elements.

original: p / vyaktiṃ na dṛśyate yatra avyaktaṃ sarvataḥ sthitam /
analyzed: vyaktim na dṛśyate yatra avyaktam sarvatas sthitam
translated: Where the manifest is not seen, the unmanifest exists everywhere.

original: tasmin kāle tayā śaktyā cidrūpāyā śivotthitā // //
analyzed: tasmin kāle tayā śaktyā cit rūpāyā śivā utthitā
translated: At that time, Śiva arose from that power, which is of the nature of consciousness.

original: turyasthāne layaṃ kṛtvā vavarṣa hyamṛtaṃ bahu /
analyzed: turyasthāne layam kṛtvā vavarṣa hi amṛtam bahu
translated: Having dissolved in the fourth state, he rained down much nectar.

original: bhūtasṛṣṭi hitārthāya plāvitaṃ cākhilaṃ jagat // //🔽tadā hyaṇḍaḥ samutpannaścāṣṭāṅgaḥ kanakopamaḥ /
analyzed: bhūta sṛṣṭi hita arthāya plāvitam ca akhilam jagat  tadā hi aṇḍaḥ samutpannaḥ ca aṣṭa aṅgaḥ kanaka upamaḥ
translated: For the sake of the welfare of the creation of beings, the entire world was flooded.🔽Then the egg arose, with eight parts, resembling gold.

original: kalpāntaṃ yāvadaṇḍaṃ tadaṇu rūpeṇasaṃsthitam // //
analyzed: kalpa antam yāvat aṇḍam tat aṇu rūpeṇa saṃsthitam
translated: Until the end of the kalpa, the egg remained in an atomic form.

original: sa tu vatsa dvidhā bhinno divaṃ bhūmiṃ tu nirmame /
analyzed: sa tu vatsa dvidhā bhinnaḥ divam bhūmim tu nirmame
translated: O child, it was divided into two, and he created heaven and earth.

original: aṣṭā śā vidiśaścāṣṭau madhye bījāṅkuraṃ padam // //
analyzed: aṣṭā vidiśaḥ ca aṣṭau madhye bīja aṅkuram padam
translated: The eight directions and the eight intermediate directions, in the middle the seed and the sprout -

original: cicchaktyā tu samudbhūtaṃ ye nedaṃ grathitaṃ jagat /
analyzed: cicchaktyā tu samudbhūtam ye nā idam grathitam jagat
translated: If this world were not created by the power of consciousness,

original: tasyāṅkurasya pṛṣṭhe tu mahāpadmaṃ sitaṃ śubham // //
analyzed: tasya aṅkurasya pṛṣṭhe tu mahā padmam sitam śubham
translated: Behind that sprout, there is a great white and auspicious lotus.

original: sahasradalapattrāḍhyaṃ karṇikākesarairyutam /
analyzed: sahasra dala pattra āḍhyam karṇikā kesaraiḥ yutam
translated: Rich with a thousand petals, along with the pericarp and filaments,

original: praṇavaṃ taṃ ca vijñeyaṃ padmaṃ padmadale kṣaṇam // //
analyzed: praṇavam tam ca vijñeyam padmam padma dale kṣaṇam
translated: That lotus should be known as the syllable Om, in the lotus petal for a moment.

original: p / tasya madhye samutpanno brahmāvedanidhirguha /
analyzed: tasya madhye samutpannaḥ
translated: In the middle of that, O Guha, Brahmā, the treasure of the Vedas, arose.

original: karṇikānte sthitaṃ vatsa sarvalokapitāmaham // //
analyzed: karṇikā ante sthitam vatsa sarva loka pitāmaham
translated: O child, situated at the end of the pericarp, the grandfather of all the worlds.

original: sṛjate sarvabhūtāni carāṇi hyacarāṇi tu /
analyzed: sṛjate sarva bhūtāni carāṇi hi acarāṇi tu
translated: He creates all beings, the moving and the unmoving.

original: tadā prajāpatirvatsa viśvakartā maheśvaraḥ // //
analyzed: tadā prajāpatiḥ vatsa viśvakartā maheśvaraḥ
translated: Then, O child, Prajapati, the creator of the universe, Maheshvara,

original: caturmukhaṃ caturbāhuṃ caturveda nidhiṃ prabhum /
analyzed: catur mukham catur bāhum catur veda nidhim prabhum
translated: Four-faced, four-armed, the lord, the repository of the four Vedas,

original: sūryakoṭi pratīkāśaṃ kalpāntāgni samaprabham // //
analyzed: pratīkāśam kalpa anta agni sama prabham
translated: Shining like a crore suns, having the luster of the fire at the end of a kalpa,

original: tena tejovabhāsena bhāsitaṃ bhuvanatrayam /
analyzed: tena tejaḥ vabhāsena bhāsitam bhuvanatrayam
translated: By the radiance of that splendor, the three worlds were illuminated.

original: vyaktībhūtaṃ tadāvatsa diśoṣṭau gaganaṃ kṣitiḥ // //
analyzed: vyaktībhūtam tadā avatsa diśā uṣṭau gaganam kṣitiḥ
translated: Then, O child, the eight directions, the sky and the earth became manifest.

original: kṣitibhūtaṃ sthitaṃ padmaṃ merubhutā hi karṇikā /
analyzed: kṣiti bhūtam sthitam padmam meru bhutā hi karṇikā
translated: The earth became the lotus, and the Meru mountain became the pericarp.

original: dalāṣṭakaṃ diśaścāṣṭau brahmapadmasya ṣaṇmukha // //
analyzed: dala aṣṭakam diśaḥ ca aṣṭau brahmapadmasya ṣaṇmukha
translated: O Six-faced one, the eight directions became the eight petals of Brahma's lotus.

original: caturdaśavidhaṃ vatsa bhūtasargaṃ carācaram /
analyzed: caturdaśavidham vatsa bhūta sargam carācaram
translated: O child, the fourteen kinds of creation, the moving and unmoving beings,

original: sarvaṃ praṇavasaṃbhūtaṃ cicchaktyā cetanodbhavam // //🔽p / kālāgni rudraparyantaṃ cicchaktyāṅkurasambhavam /
analyzed: sarvam praṇava saṃbhūtam cit śaktyā cetanā udbhavam
translated: All are born from the Pranava (Om), from the power of consciousness, from the origin of consciousness.🔽From the power of consciousness, it arises as the sprout, from the end of the Rudra of the fire of time.

original: tacca padmasthitaṃ vatsa amṛtodadhimadhyagam // //
analyzed: tat ca padma sthitam vatsa amṛta udadhi madhya gam
translated: O child, that is situated in the lotus, in the middle of the ocean of nectar.

original: taṃ dṛṣṭvā tu svayaṃ brahmā vismito hyantarātmanā /
analyzed: tam dṛṣṭvā tu svayam brahmā vismitaḥ hi antarātmanā
translated: Seeing him, Brahma himself was amazed in his inner self.

original: tadā tasyoditā buddhiryogamabhyamanaṃ prati // //
analyzed: tadā tasya uditā buddhiḥ yogam abhyamanam prati
translated: Then his intellect arose towards the practice of yoga.

original: tena yogaṃ samabhyastaṃ divyāyutasahasrakam /
analyzed: tena yogam samabhyastam divya ayuta sahasrakam
translated: For ten thousand divine years, he practiced yoga.

original: tasya yoga phalāvāptiścicchaktyā praṇave hṛtam // //
analyzed: tasya yoga phala avāptiḥ cicchaktyā praṇave hṛtam  /
translated: And he attained the fruits of yoga, which were taken away by the power of consciousness in the Pranava.

original: tena cotyāditaṃ sarvaṃ viśvaṃ hi sa carācaram /
analyzed: tena ca utyāditam sarvam viśvam hi sa carācaram
translated: And by him, the entire universe, with its moving and unmoving beings, was created.

original: brahmādi stambha paryantaṃ yāvat kālādi gocaram // //
analyzed: brahma ādi stambha paryantam yāvat kāla ādi gocaram  /
translated: From Brahma up to a pillar, and as far as the sphere of time and so on.

original: tasmāt sākāra bhutāni sarve brahmamayāguha /
analyzed: tasmāt sa ākāra bhutāni sarve
translated: Therefore, all these manifest forms are Brahman itself, O Guha.

original: sarvaṃ ca khalvidaṃ brahmasvatorthaṃ brahma vādinam // //
analyzed: sarvam ca khalu idam brahma svataḥ ṛtham brahma vādinam
translated: And indeed, all this is Brahman, the self-existent one, the Brahman-knower.

original: jñātvā bhūta hitaṃ vatsa ye sthitāste hyasambhavāḥ /
analyzed: jñātvā bhūta hitam vatsa ye sthitāḥ te hi asambhavāḥ
translated: Having known the welfare of all beings, O child, those who abide are indeed unborn.

original: sarveṣāṃ caiva bhūtānāṃ praṇavaṃ yoniśakti dhṛt // //
analyzed: sarveṣām ca eva bhūtānām praṇavam yoni śakti dhṛt
translated: And the Pranava is the source of power for all beings.

original: tasmād brahmasamutpannamādaupraṇava yoniṣu /
analyzed: tasmāt yoniṣu
translated: Therefore, in the beginning, Brahman was born from the womb of the Pranava.

original: p / praṇavena bhavet padmaṃ cicchaktyaṅkurasannibham // //
analyzed: bhavet
translated: The lotus is born from the Pranava, resembling the sprout of the power of consciousness.

original: tasmin madhyātsamutpannaḥ padmayonistaducyate /
analyzed: tasmin madhyāt samutpannaḥ padmayoniḥ tat ucyate
translated: From the middle of that, the lotus-born one arose, that is said.

original: praṇavaṃ yona jānāti bindunādendu bhūṣitam // //
analyzed: praṇavam jānāti bindu nāda indu
translated: One who does not know the Pranava, adorned with the dot and sound,

original: mātrārddhamātrasaṃyuktaṃ tena brahmavido viduḥ /
analyzed: mātrā arddha mātra saṃyuktam tena brahma vidaḥ viduḥ
translated: Conjoined with a mātrā and half a mātrā, by that the knowers of Brahman know.

original: arddhamātrāsamudbhutaṃ praṇavaṃ sarvadā guha // //
analyzed: arddha mātrā samudbhutam praṇavam sarvadā guha
translated: O Guha, the Praṇava, which is produced from half a mātrā, is always to be known.

original: nādāntāntarasaṃsthaṃ tu paraṃ brahmasanātanam /
analyzed: na adānta antara saṃstham tu param brahma sanātanam
translated: The eternal supreme Brahman, which is located within the end of the sound,

original: tasminneva layaṃ kuryāt tenaivaṃ brahmavādinaḥ // //
analyzed: tasmin eva layam kuryāt tena evam brahma vādinaḥ  /
translated: One should merge into that itself, thus the expounders of Brahman.

original: śivāntarasamudbhuta paraṃ brahmaśikhi dhvaja /
analyzed: śiva antara samudbhuta param brahma śikhi dhvaja
translated: O Śikhidhvaja, the supreme Brahman, which is produced within Śiva,

original: tairjñātamamṛtaṃ teṣāmajñānaṃ ca viṣaṃ bhavet // //
analyzed: taiḥ jñātam amṛtam teṣām ajñānam ca viṣam bhavet
translated: The nectar is known by them, and ignorance would be poison for them.

original: ardhamātrāṇi kharvāṃśaṃ tasyāṃśaḥ koṭiraṃśakam /
analyzed: ardha mātrāṇi kharva aṃśam tasya aṃśaḥ koṭiḥ aṃśakam
translated: The half mātrās, the kharva part, the koṭi part of that,

original: tasyāpi lakṣaso hyaṃśo yojānāti sa brahmavit // //
analyzed: tasya api lakṣasaḥ hi aṃśaḥ yaḥ jānāti sa brahma vid
translated: And the lakh part of that, he who knows that is a knower of Brahman.

original: p / brahmāṇḍā brahmaṇotpattiṃ mayā jñātaṃ mayā śrūtam /
analyzed: brahmāṇḍāḥ brahmaṇā utpattim mayā jñātam mayā śrūtam
translated: The creation of Brahmāṇḍa and Brahmā has been known and heard by me.

original: adhunā śrotumicchāmi strīpuṃsoścaiva sambhavam // //
analyzed: adhunā śrotum icchāmi strī puṃsoḥ ca eva sambhavam
translated: Now I wish to hear about the origin of women and men.

original: yat tvayā coditaṃ praśnaṃ durvijñeyaṃ surairapi /
analyzed: yat tvayā coditam praśnam durvijñeyam suraiḥ api
translated: The question that has been asked by you, which is difficult to know even by the gods,

original: tattehaṃ kathaṃyiṣyāmi rahasyaṃ praśnapūrvakam // //
analyzed: rahasyam praśna pūrvakam
translated: I will tell you that secret, along with the question.

original: yogamabhyasitaṃ pūrvaṃ sṛṣṭyarthaṃ padmayoninā /
analyzed: yogam abhyasitam pūrvam sṛṣṭi artham padmayoninā
translated: Yoga was practiced by the Lotus-born One in the past for the sake of creation,

original: tapaśca sumahattīrṇāṃ duṣkaraṃ cādbhutopamam // //
analyzed: tapaḥ ca su mahat tīrṇām duṣkaram ca adbhuta upamam
translated: And he performed a great austerity, which is difficult to do and is like a wonder.

original: tadā tuṣṭaḥ sa bhagavāñśivaḥ paramakāraṇaḥ /
analyzed: tadā tuṣṭaḥ sa bhagavān śivaḥ parama kāraṇaḥ
translated: Then the Blessed One Śiva, the supreme cause, was pleased.

original: paraṃ brahmaśivaṃ jñeyaṃ paraṃ sthānamanāmayam // //
analyzed: param brahmaśivam jñeyam param sthānam anāmayam
translated: The supreme Brahman, Śiva, should be known, the supreme place, the flawless one.

original: parāpara śivaṃ vatsa sarveṣāṃ parataḥ sthitam /
analyzed: parāpara śivam vatsa sarveṣām paratas sthitam
translated: O child, the supreme and inferior Śiva, situated beyond all,

original: tena tuṣṭena devena cicchaktyā cetanā guha // //
analyzed: tena tuṣṭena devena cicchaktyā cetanā guha
translated: By that pleased god, by the power of consciousness, O Guha,

original: gacchatvaṃ brahmaṇaḥ nārdhaṃ sṛṣṭisṛṣṭyartha kāraṇam /
analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ na ardham sṛṣṭi sṛṣṭi artha kāraṇam
translated: Go to half of Brahman, the cause of creation for the sake of creation.

original: p / ārādhito hyahaṃ tena bhaktyāparamayāyadā // //
analyzed: ārādhitaḥ hi aham tena bhaktyā aparamayā ayadā
translated: When I was worshipped by him with supreme devotion,

original: cicchaktyā coditaṃ deva pratyakṣaṃ tvaṃ kathaṃ vibho /
analyzed: cicchaktyā coditam deva pratyakṣam tvam katham vibho
translated: O god, urged by the power of consciousness, O lord, how can you be manifest?

original: tadādi dṛṣṭa pūrvoyamevaṃ padma tanurbhavet // //
analyzed: tad ādi tanuḥ bhavet
translated: That beginning was seen before, thus he would have a lotus body.

original: evaṃ matvā savai śaktiḥ śaktirūpeṇa saṃsthitā /
analyzed: evam matvā śaktiḥ śakti rūpeṇa saṃsthitā
translated: Considering thus, that power is established in the form of power.

original: sa tu viṣṇurvijānīyā cchaktirūpeṇa śakti dhṛt // //
analyzed: sa tu viṣṇuḥ vijānīyāt śakti rūpeṇa śakti dhṛt
translated: One should know that Viṣṇu is the holder of power in the form of power.

original: ahaṃ tu puruṣaḥ sākṣācchiva tejassamudbhavaḥ /
analyzed: aham tu puruṣaḥ sākṣāt śiva tejaḥ samudbhavaḥ
translated: I am indeed the Puruṣa, born from the splendor of Śiva.

original: ubhābhyāṃ bījarūpeṇa padmayonistṛtīyakaḥ // //
analyzed: ubhābhyām bīja rūpeṇa padmayoniḥ tṛtīyakaḥ
translated: The two, in the form of seeds, the third, the lotus-born one.

original: evaṃ hi trividhā sṛṣṭiḥ saṃbhutābhutajā guha /🔽praṇavaṃ tu bhavedeṣa a umakṣarayojitam // //
analyzed: evam hi trividhā sṛṣṭiḥ saṃbhuta abhuta jā guha  praṇavam tu bhavet eṣa a um akṣara yojitam
translated: Thus, O Guha, creation is threefold, born from existence and non-existence.🔽This is indeed the Praṇava, endowed with the syllables A, U, and M.

original: nādendu bindurete vai kalāmātrāstathaiva ca /
analyzed: nāda indu binduḥ ete vai kalā mātrāḥ tathā eva ca
translated: These are the Nāda, Indu, and Bindu, and also the Kalās (parts).

original: caturviṃśati tatvāni puruṣaṃ pañcaviṃśakam // //
analyzed: caturviṃśati tatvāni puruṣam pañcaviṃśakam
translated: The twenty-four principles and the Purusha as the twenty-fifth.

original: āyuḥ karma ca vittaṃ ca vidyānidhanameva ca /
analyzed: āyuḥ karma ca vittam ca vidyā nidhanam eva ca
translated: Life, action, wealth, learning and death,

original: anye ye kecicchārīrā vyaktāavyakta vāyavaḥ // //
analyzed: anye ye kecid śārīrāḥ vyakta avyakta vāyavaḥ
translated: and whatever other bodily manifestations there are, manifest or unmanifest, O Guha.

original: p / sarvaṃ samarasaṃ bhutvā cicchaktyāvyaktayā guha /
analyzed: sarvam samarasam bhutvā cicchaktyā avyaktayā guha
translated: Having tasted all that as of the same essence, by the unmanifest power of consciousness,

original: taṃ rasaṃ brahmamityāhurānandakaraṇaṃ param // //
analyzed: tam rasam brahmam iti āhuḥ ānanda karaṇam param
translated: that essence is called Brahman, the supreme cause of bliss.

original: śukraṃ taṃ tu vijānīyādamaratvaṃ kabho /tisaḥ /
analyzed: śukram tam tu vijānīyāt amara tvam kabhotisaḥ
translated: One should know that semen is immortality, O Kabhi.

original: sṛṣṭirūpeṇamartyānāmamaratve vyavasthitaḥ // //
analyzed: sṛṣṭi rūpeṇa martyānām amara tve vyavasthitaḥ
translated: It is established in immortality for mortals in the form of creation.

original: devānāmamaratvaṃ ca purātenaiva kalpitaḥ /
analyzed: devānām amara tvam ca purā tena eva kalpitaḥ
translated: And the immortality of the gods was also devised by him in the past.

original: caturdaśavidhivatsa bhūtasargaṃ carācaram // //🔽agre khagātmakaṃ sarvaṃ sṛṣṭabrahmādibhirguha /
analyzed: caturdaśa vidhivat sa bhūta sargam carācaram  agre khaga ātmakam sarvam sṛṣṭa brahma ādibhiḥ guha
translated: The fourteen kinds of creation, the moving and unmoving world,🔽all that is in the form of the sky, O Guha, was created by Brahma and others.

original: brahmatejassamutpannāvagnīṣomau śikhidhvaja // //
analyzed: brahma tejaḥ samutpannau agnīṣomau śikhidhvaja
translated: O Shikhadhvaja, Agni and Soma arose from the brilliance of Brahman.

original: tathā bījasya bījatvamanyathā tu nirarthakam /
analyzed: tathā bījasya bīja tvam anyathā tu nirarthakam
translated: Similarly, the seediness of the seed is meaningless otherwise.

original: evaṃ sarve samārambhāḥ sarvabījeṣu saṃsthitāḥ // //
analyzed: evam sarve samārambhāḥ sarva bījeṣu saṃsthitāḥ
translated: Thus all undertakings are based on all seeds.

original: śarīrasṛṣṭihetvarthaṃ cicchaktyā cetanātmakam /
analyzed: śarīra sṛṣṭi hetu artham cicchaktyā cetanā ātmakam
translated: For the sake of creating the body, by the power of consciousness, the conscious self,

original: yathānyagrodha bījānāṃ nyagrodhābhyantare sthitaḥ // //
analyzed: yathā nyagrodha bījānām nyagrodha abhyantare sthitaḥ
translated: Just as the seed of a banyan tree is situated inside the banyan tree itself,

original: p / tathā sarveṣu bhūteṣu cicchaktyā cetasaṃsthitam /
analyzed: tathā sarveṣu bhūteṣu cicchaktyā ceta saṃsthitam
translated: In the same way, the power of consciousness is situated in the consciousness of all beings.

original: sṛṣṭinyāsaṃ mayājñātaṃ daivikaṃ caiva mānuṣam /
analyzed: sṛṣṭi nyāsam mayā ajñātam daivikam ca eva mānuṣam
translated: I have understood the creation and assignment, both divine and human.

original: bhūyaśca paripṛcchāmi strīpuṃso sambhavo yathā //
analyzed: bhūyas ca paripṛcchāmi strī puṃsaḥ sambhavaḥ yathā
translated: Again I ask, how is the birth of women and men?

original: idaṃ guhyaṃ mahāguhyaṃ sarvaguhyeṣu vai guha /
analyzed: idam guhyam mahā guhyam sarva guhyeṣu vai guha
translated: This is the secret, the great secret, the secret among all secrets, O Guha.

original: yat tvayā coditaṃ praśnaṃ tat sarvaṃ śṛṇu ṣaṇmukha // //
analyzed: yat tvayā coditam praśnam tat sarvam śṛṇu ṣaṇmukha
translated: Listen to all that you have asked about, O Six-faced One.

original: prāktanaiḥ karmaleśeśca śubhaiścāpya śubhaistathā /
analyzed: prāktanaiḥ karma leśeḥ ca śubhaiḥ ca api a śubhaiḥ tathā
translated: Due to the influence of past deeds, both auspicious and inauspicious,

original: samutpadyanti saṃsāre yoni lakṣvāntareṣu ca // //
analyzed: samutpadyanti saṃsāre lakṣva antareṣu ca
translated: Beings are born in the various species within the cycle of birth and death.

original: śubhakartā śubhe yonau duṣkṛtī duṣkṛteṣu ca /
analyzed: śubha kartā śubhe yonau duṣkṛtī duṣkṛteṣu ca
translated: One who does good deeds is born in a good womb, and one who does bad deeds in bad ones.

original: evaṃ kartā ca karmabhyo bhuñjate vai śubhā śubham // //
analyzed: evam kartā ca karmabhyaḥ bhuñjate vai śubhā śubham
translated: Thus, the doer experiences good and bad fruits of his actions.

original: yadā yamaḥ sa ca bhaved yadā sṛṣṭiḥ pravartate /
analyzed: yadā yamaḥ sa ca bhavet yadā sṛṣṭiḥ pravartate
translated: When Yama is there and when creation begins to function,

original: p / ubhābhyāṃ tatra saṃyogādbhagaliṅgasamāgame // //
analyzed: ubhābhyām tatra saṃyogāt bhaga liṅga samāgame  /
translated: When there is union of the two, the union of the female organ and the male organ,

original: garbhaṃ sambhavate garbhe cicchaktyā śakticodite /
analyzed: garbham sambhavate garbhe cit śaktyā śakti codite
translated: The embryo is formed in the womb, impelled by the power of consciousness.

original: yonidvārasya vai pṛṣṭhe nābhipadmaṃ sthitaṃ guha // //
analyzed: yonidvārasya vai pṛṣṭhe nābhi padmam sthitam guha
translated: O Guha, the navel lotus is situated at the back of the door of the womb.

original: yadā vikasitaṃ strīṇāma tu kālastadā bhavet /
analyzed: yadā vikasitam strīṇāma tu kālaḥ tadā bhavet
translated: When it is expanded, then is the time for women.

original: rajaḥ pravartate hyasyāṃ divasāni tu ṣoḍaśa // //
analyzed: rajaḥ pravartate hi asyām divasāni tu ṣoḍaśa
translated: Menstrual blood flows in her for sixteen days.

original: ṛtukāle tu tat padma madhomārga mukhaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: ṛtukāle tu tat padma madhomārga mukham bhavet
translated: At the time of menstruation, that lotus becomes the path of honey.

original: tasmin bījaṃ yadā kṣiptamṛtukāle śikhidhvaja // //
analyzed: tasmin bījam yadā kṣiptam ṛtu kāle śikhidhvaja
translated: O Shikhadhvaja, when the seed is cast into it at the time of menstruation,

original: tadā tadrohate bījamanyathā rūparehitam /
analyzed: tadā tat rohate bījam anyathā rūpa rehitam
translated: then that seed grows. Otherwise, there is a change in form.

original: puṃset karṣa bhavet puṃsaḥ striyotkarṣe bhavet striyaḥ // //
analyzed: puṃsā id karṣa bhavet puṃsaḥ striyā utkarṣe bhavet striyaḥ
translated: If the male is superior, it becomes a male. If the female is superior, it becomes a female.

original: samena puṃsakaṃ jñeyamādhikye naiva kiñcana /
analyzed: samena puṃsakam jñeyam ādhikye nā eva kiñcana
translated: If they are equal, it should be known as a hermaphrodite. If there is excess, then nothing happens.

original: yugme yugānu yugme strī antakālena puṃsakam // //
analyzed: yugme yuga anu yugme strī anta kālena puṃsakam  /
translated: In a pair, if the female is in the middle, it becomes a female. If the male is in the middle, it becomes a male.

original: ṛtukāle hyati krānte bhūyaḥ padmaṃ samaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: ṛtu kāle hi ati krānte bhūyaḥ padmam samam bhavet
translated: If the time of menstruation is passed, the lotus becomes equal again.

original: p / tasya madhye sthitā vatsa piṅgalādaspṛtodbhavā // //
analyzed: tasya madhye sthitā vatsa piṅgalāda spṛta udbhavā
translated: O child, in the middle of that, arises Pingala, born from the unmanifest.

original: sā nanda yati sarveṣāṃ ratikāle śikhidhvaja /
analyzed: sā nanda yati sarveṣām rati kāle śikhidhvaja
translated: O Shikhadhvaja, she delights all at the time of sexual pleasure.

original: jāyate puruṣaścaivamānandayati sarvadā // //
analyzed: jāyate puruṣaḥ ca evam ānandayati sarvadā
translated: And a male is born, who always delights.

original: ubhābhyāṃ samayogena tadā bījaḥ prarohati /
analyzed: ubhābhyām sama yogena tadā bījaḥ prarohati
translated: Then the seed grows by the union of both.

original: purapraveśametaddhi amaratvaṃ ca vai bhavet // //🔽tadā putrāśca pautrāśca prapautrāśca na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: pura praveśam etat hi amara tvam ca vai bhavet  tadā putrāḥ ca pautrāḥ ca prapautrāḥ ca na saṃśayaḥ
translated: This is indeed the entry into the city and the attainment of immortality.🔽Then there will be sons, grandsons, and great-grandsons, there is no doubt.

original: jantavo gotra santānā amaratvaṃ tadā bhavet // //
analyzed: jantavaḥ santānāḥ amara tvam tadā bhavet
translated: Living beings, families, and lineages will attain immortality.

original: tasya padmasya madhye tu cicchaktiramṛtodbhavā /
analyzed: tasya padmasya madhye tu cicchaktiḥ amṛta udbhavā
translated: In the center of that lotus, O child, dwells the consciousness-power, born of nectar,

original: vasate satataṃ vatsa divasāni tu ṣoḍaśaḥ // //
analyzed: vasate satatam vatsa divasāni tu ṣoḍaśaḥ
translated: always for sixteen days.

original: tadā liṅga cyutaṃ bījaṃ tasmin sthāne prarohati /
analyzed: tadā liṅga cyutam bījam tasmin sthāne prarohati
translated: Then the seed, fallen from the linga, sprouts in that place.

original: tasya padmasya garbhoyaṃ garbhaśayyā śikhidhvaja // //
analyzed: tasya padmasya garbhā uyam garbhaśayyā śikhidhvaja
translated: O peacock-bannered one, this is the womb of that lotus.

original: padminī śaṅkha rūpeṇa garbhaśayyā sthitā guha /
analyzed: padminī śaṅkha rūpeṇa garbhaśayyā sthitā guha
translated: O Guha, the lotus-bed is situated in the form of a conch as the womb.

original: tasya madhye yadā kṣiptaṃ kṣiptaṃ bījevakalpayet // //
analyzed: tasya madhye yadā kṣiptam kṣiptam
translated: When it is placed in the middle, it should be considered as a seed.

original: p / anyathā tu abījeyamauṣadhaṃ kṣipitaṃ yathā //
analyzed: anyathā tu abījā iyam auṣadham kṣipitam yathā
translated: Otherwise, it is like a seedless medicine being thrown away.

original: sarvaṃ deva mayā jñātaṃ sarvaṃ tāta mayā śrūtam /
analyzed: sarvam deva mayā jñātam sarvam tāta mayā śrūtam
translated: O God, I have understood everything, O Father, I have heard everything.

original: adhunā śrotumicchāmi rajoretaḥ samudbhavam //
analyzed: adhunā śrotum icchāmi rajaḥ retaḥ samudbhavam
translated: Now I wish to hear about the origin of semen from menstrual blood.

original: atyanta kutsitaṃ putra yat tvayā paripṛcchitam /
analyzed: atyanta kutsitam putra yat tvayā paripṛcchitam
translated: O Son, what you have asked is extremely despicable.

original: duṣkṛtīnāṃ ca sarvāsāṃ garbhavāsaḥ prakīrtitaḥ // //
analyzed: duṣkṛtīnām ca sarvāsām garbha vāsaḥ prakīrtitaḥ
translated: The womb-residence is declared for all sinful acts.

original: kālāgni rudra paryantaṃ yāvadbrahmāṇḍagocaram /
translated: From the end of the Rudra of the fire of time up to the sphere of the universe,

original: sarvaṃ cicchaktinā vyāptaṃ śivājñā coditaṃ guha // //
analyzed: sarvam cicchaktinā vyāptam śiva ājñā coditam guha
translated: Everything is pervaded by the power of consciousness, impelled by Shiva's command, O Guha.

original: cicchakti saṃplutā bhūtāḥ sarveṣāmantare sthitāḥ /
analyzed: cicchakti saṃplutāḥ bhūtāḥ sarveṣām antare sthitāḥ
translated: The elements are all immersed in the power of consciousness, existing within all.

original: prarohaṃ kuru vṛddhiṃ ca anyathā tasya codanam // //
analyzed: praroham kuru vṛddhim ca anyathā tasya codanam  /
translated: Cause growth and increase, otherwise it is the impulse of that.

original: p / vyaktaṃ na dṛśyate tasya avyakta tvāt sṛjatyasau /
analyzed: vyaktam na dṛśyate tasya avyakta tvāt sṛjati asau
translated: The manifest is not seen of it, due to its unmanifest nature, it creates.

original: tasya bījaṃ kurutyantā tayā sṛṣṭaṃ carācaram // //
analyzed: tasya bījam kuruti antā tayā sṛṣṭam carācaram
translated: It makes the seed of that, by it the moving and unmoving creation is created.

original: carāṇāmacarāṇāṃ ca bhūtānāṃ śikhivāhana /🔽yosau yoniḥ sanidhanaṃ paramārthaṃ tu taṃ viduḥ // //
analyzed: carāṇām acarāṇām ca bhūtānām śikhivāhana  yaḥ asau yoniḥ sa nidhanam parama artham tu tam viduḥ
translated: Of the moving and unmoving beings, O peacock-vehicled one,🔽That which is the womb, that is the ultimate end, but they know that as the supreme truth.

original: paramārthaṃ tu taṃ jñeyaṃ yasya śaktirna lupyate /
analyzed: paramārtham tu tam jñeyam yasya śaktiḥ na lupyate
translated: But that supreme truth is to be known, whose power is not lost.

original: śaktirna lupyate cāsya śivayogā śikhidhvaja // //
analyzed: śaktiḥ na lupyate ca asya śiva yogā śikhidhvaja
translated: His power is not lost, O peacock-bannered one, that is the yoga of Shiva.

original: sarveṣāmeva bhūtānāṃ yonyaṇḍa svedajodbhijaḥ /
analyzed: sarveṣām eva bhūtānām yoni aṇḍa sveda ja udbhijaḥ
translated: The womb, egg, sweat, and sprout of all beings,

original: agnīṣomānilayutaṃ viśate parameśvaraḥ // //
analyzed: agnīṣoma anila yutam viśate parameśvaraḥ
translated: The supreme lord enters united with fire, sun, and wind.

original: utpattireṣā bhūtānāṃ prāṇāpānodayena tu /
analyzed: utpattiḥ eṣā bhūtānām prāṇa apāna udayena tu
translated: This is the origin of beings, by the arising of inhalation and exhalation.

original: astaṅgataistairnidhanaṃ dehe deheśvaro guha // //
analyzed: astaṅga taiḥ taiḥ nidhanam dehe deha īśvaraḥ guha
translated: By their setting, there is dissolution in the body, O lord of the body, O Guha.

original: ādau bhūtāḥ samutpannāḥ paścādaṇḍasya sambhavaḥ /
analyzed: ādau bhūtāḥ samutpannāḥ paścāt aṇḍasya sambhavaḥ
translated: First, the elements were born, then the origin of the egg.

original: tatoṅkuraṃ ca padmaṃ ca tatva brahmādanantaram // //
analyzed: tatas uṅkuram ca padmam ca tatva
translated: Then the sprout and the lotus, and after that, the truth and Brahma.

original: caturviṃśati tatvāni akṣatāni tu vai guha /
analyzed: caturviṃśati tatvāni akṣatāni tu vai guha
translated: O Guha, the twenty-four principles are indeed the seeds.

original: gāyatrī tu bhavet taistu mahādevāti nissṛtam // //
analyzed: gāyatrī tu bhavet taiḥ tu mahādeva ati nissṛtam
translated: The Gayatri is indeed born from them, emanating from Mahadeva.

original: p / te naiva nissṛtaṃ viśvaṃ karmayugmasamanvitam /
analyzed: te na eva nissṛtam viśvam karma yugma samanvitam
translated: The universe is indeed born from them, along with the pair of actions.

original: cicchakti saṃbhavaṃ sarvaṃ brahmāṇḍa kuharodaram // //
analyzed: cicchakti saṃbhavam sarvam brahmāṇḍa kuhara udaram
translated: The entire universe, the womb of the cavity of the cosmic egg, is born from the power of consciousness.

original: tasmād vai sarvadā vatsa cicchaktiḥ paramārthataḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt vai sarvadā vatsa cicchaktiḥ paramārthataḥ
translated: Therefore, O child, the power of consciousness is always the highest truth.

original: mayā sṛṣṭaṃ jagatsarvaṃ bhūtasargaṃ carācaram // //
analyzed: mayā sṛṣṭam jagat sarvam bhūta sargam carācaram
translated: By me, the entire universe and the creation of beings, moving and unmoving, is created.

original: strīrajo retasaṃ miśraṃ kalilaṃ māsamekataḥ /
analyzed: strī rajaḥ retasam miśram kalilam māsam ekatas
translated: The mixture of female blood and semen is the kalila for one month.

original: cicchaktyā cetanodbhūtaṃ dvitīye māsi budbudam // //
analyzed: cicchaktyā cetanā udbhūtam dvitīye māsi budbudam
translated: In the second month, the bud is born from the consciousness arising from the power of consciousness.

original: retoraktasamudbhūtaṃ tṛtīye māsi ṣaṇmukha /
analyzed: retaḥ rakta samudbhūtam tṛtīye māsi ṣaṇmukha
translated: O Six-faced one, in the third month, from the semen and blood,

original: cicchakti sambhavā hyata sarveṣāmantare sthitāḥ // //
analyzed: cicchakti sambhavāḥ sarveṣām antare sthitāḥ
translated: The powers of consciousness are indeed present within all.

original: prarohāṅkura vṛttiṃ ca sarveṣāṃ tasya cetanāḥ /
analyzed: praroha aṅkura vṛttim ca sarveṣām tasya cetanāḥ
translated: The powers of consciousness of all that have the nature of sprouts and shoots,

original: vyaktirna dṛśyate tasya avyakta tvāt sṛjatyasau // //
analyzed: vyaktiḥ na dṛśyate tasya avyakta tvāt sṛjati asau
translated: Their manifestation is not seen due to their unmanifest nature. He creates.

original: tasya bījāṅkurasyāntaṃ tena dṛṣṭaṃ carācaram /
analyzed: tasya bīja aṅkurasya antam tena dṛṣṭam carācaram
translated: By him, the seed-sprout, the end of the moving and unmoving world was seen.

original: carāṇā /macarāṇāṃ ca bhūtānāṃ śikhivāhana // //
analyzed: carāṇām acarāṇām ca bhūtānām śikhivāhana
translated: O peacock-vehicled one, of the moving and unmoving beings.

original: p / budbudhāṅkurasaṃlīnaṃ cicchaktiḥ sṛjateṅkuram /
translated: The power of consciousness merges into the seed-sprout and creates the sprout.

original: taṃ nālaṃ padmagarbhasya nābhinālaṃ prakīrtitam // //
analyzed: tam nālam padmagarbhasya nābhinālam prakīrtitam
translated: That stalk is declared to be the navel-stalk of the lotus-womb.

original: tatomāṃsāsthi saṃbhutistṛtīye māsi ṣaṇmukha /
analyzed: saṃbhutiḥ tṛtīye māsi ṣaṇmukha
translated: Then, O six-faced one, in the third month, the formation of flesh and bones takes place.

original: yathā bījāṅkuraṃ vatsa avyaktaṃ naiva dṛśyate // //
analyzed: yathā bīja aṅkuram vatsa avyaktam na eva dṛśyate
translated: Just as, O child, the seed-sprout is not seen as manifest,

original: caturthe māsi saṃprāpte jāyante vayavāṅkurāḥ /
analyzed: caturthe māsi saṃprāpte jāyante vayava aṅkurāḥ
translated: When the fourth month arrives, the sprouts of the limbs are born.

original: tadā vyaktaṃ bhavet kāyaṃ puruṣā kṛti saṃjñakam // //
analyzed: tadā vyaktam bhavet kāyam puruṣā kṛti saṃjñakam
translated: Then the manifest body, known as the male form, comes into being.

original: cicchaktyā cetanaṃ tasya jāyante stokamātrakam /
analyzed: cicchaktyā cetanam tasya jāyante stoka mātrakam
translated: By the power of consciousness, his consciousness is born in small measure.

original: majjāsthi snāyumedhaṃ ca māṃsaṃ rudirameva ca // //
analyzed: majja asthi snāyum edham ca māṃsam rudiram eva ca
translated: Marrow, bones, sinews, fat, flesh, and blood,

original: vātapittaṃ tathā śleṣmaṃ śukraṃ mūtra purīṣayoḥ /🔽sirānāḍī granthayaśca dvārāḥ kūrmāśca jālakāḥ // //
analyzed: vāta pittam tathā śleṣmam śukram mūtra purīṣayoḥ  sirā nāḍī granthayaḥ ca dvārāḥ kūrmāḥ ca jālakāḥ
translated: Wind, bile, and phlegm, semen, urine, and feces,🔽Veins, channels, knots, doors, and nets of ligaments,

original: tvacaṃ marmāṇi sandhīścalomanāḍyastathaiva ca /
analyzed: tvacam marmāṇi sandhīḥ ca loma nāḍyaḥ tathā eva ca
translated: Skin, vital parts, joints, and also hair and channels,

original: ete cānyepi ye keciccharīrotpatti kāraṇam // //
analyzed: ete ca anye api ye kecid śarīra utpatti kāraṇam
translated: These and others are the causes of the origin of the body.

original: p / sambhavanti ca sarve vai aṅgānyavayavāstathā dehasyā /
analyzed: sambhavanti ca sarve vai aṅgāni avayavāḥ tathā dehasyā
translated: And all the limbs and parts are possible in the body.

original: pañcame māsi samaye na khalomāni spandanam // //
analyzed: pañcame māsi samaye na khalomāni spandanam  /
translated: In the fifth month, at the proper time, the body hair, trembling,

original: śrottraśuktiśca śotrāṇāṃ dhātūnāṃ dhāturopaṇam /
analyzed: śrottra śuktiḥ ca śotrāṇām dhātūnām dhātu ropaṇam
translated: and the formation of the ear canals and the earlobes, and the implantation of the bodily elements,

original: vyaktatvaṃ sarvamaṅgānāṃ yathā yasya tu kalpitam // //
analyzed: vyakta tvam sarvam aṅgānām yathā yasya tu kalpitam  /
translated: The distinctness of all the limbs, as conceived by him,

original: cicchakti cetanavaśāt sampannāste śikhidhvaja /
analyzed: cicchakti cetana vaśāt sampannāḥ te śikhidhvaja
translated: The power of consciousness, O Shikhidhwaja, is accomplished by the power of consciousness.

original: ṣaṣṭhe māsi rasān sarvān yadā te mātṛ bhojanāt // //
analyzed: ṣaṣṭhe māsi rasān sarvān yadā te mātṛ bhojanāt
translated: In the sixth month, when all the bodily elements are obtained from the mother's food,

original: kṣuṭtṛṣṇā jāgranidrāśca śītoṣṇa mukhaduḥkhitāḥ /
analyzed: kṣuṣ tṛṣṇāḥ jāgra nidrāḥ ca śīta uṣṇa mukha duḥkhitāḥ
translated: Hunger, thirst, waking, sleeping, cold, heat, and facial pain,

original: cicchakti cetanorthe na cetanāṃ cetate tu yaḥ // //
analyzed: cicchakti cetanā arthe na cetanām cetate tu yaḥ
translated: The power of consciousness, when one who is conscious does not become conscious of consciousness,

original: saptame māsi saṃprāpte caitanyaṃ mānuṣopamam /
analyzed: saptame māsi saṃprāpte caitanyam mānuṣa upamam
translated: When, in the seventh month, consciousness becomes like that of a human being,

original: yadā prabudhyate cāgnirhyadisthaṃ tacca vai guha // //
analyzed: yadā prabudhyate ca agniḥ hi adi stham tat ca vai guha
translated: And when the fire, which is located in the navel, awakens, O Guha,

original: tadā sa sarvamakhilaṃ śarīre dyotayatyasau /
analyzed: tadā sa sarvam akhilam śarīre dyotayati asau
translated: Then it illuminates the entire body.

original: padmatrayaṃ prabuddhyeta hyannābhi mukhasaṃsthitam // //
analyzed: padma trayam hi at nābhi mukha saṃsthitam
translated: The three lotuses, located in the navel, mouth, and eyes, would awaken,

original: p / vāyavaśca pravartante prāṇādyā ye prakīrtitāḥ /
analyzed: vāyavaḥ ca pravartante prāṇa ādyāḥ ye prakīrtitāḥ
translated: And the winds, known as prana and others, begin to function.

original: liṅgadyānāḍayaḥ sarvā hṛtpadmadalasambhavāḥ // //
analyzed: sarvāḥ hṛd padma dala sambhavāḥ
translated: All the channels beginning with the linga are born from the petals of the lotus of the heart.

original: tānimāṃ pūritaṃ sarvaṃ tejorthena jarāyubhiḥ /
analyzed: tān imām pūritam sarvam tejaḥ ṛthena jarāyubhiḥ
translated: These fill the entire body with the essence of light through the amnion.

original: tairvyāptamakhilaṃ piṇḍaṃ lomāntaṃ yāvat ṣaṇmukha // //
analyzed: taiḥ vyāptam akhilam piṇḍam loma antam yāvat ṣaṇmukha
translated: O Six-faced one, that body is pervaded by them up to the tips of the hair.

original: nāḍi cakraṃ tu sarvaṃ vai vyāpitaṃ sarvarasmibhiḥ /
analyzed: cakram tu sarvam vai vyāpitam sarva rasmibhiḥ
translated: The entire network of channels is pervaded by all the rays.

original: yathā sūryodaye sarvaṃ rasmibhirvyāpitaṃ jagat // //
analyzed: yathā sūrya udaye sarvam rasmibhiḥ vyāpitam jagat
translated: Just as the world is pervaded by the rays at sunrise.

original: pāṇāgni sūryau nirṇītvā vyāpitaṃ dehamātmanaḥ /
analyzed: pāṇa agni sūryau nirṇītvā vyāpitam deham ātmanaḥ
translated: Having determined the fire in the hand and the sun, the body is pervaded by the self.

original: cicchakti cetanorthāṃya bahiḥ sūryaṃ śikhidhvaja // //
analyzed: cicchakti bahis sūryam śikhidhvaja
translated: O Shikhidvaja, the power of consciousness and the conscious entity pervade the external sun.

original: na tu tasyātmanāśaktiryāvaccicchakti coditā /
analyzed: na tu tasya ātmanā aśaktiḥ yāvaccicchakti coditā
translated: But there is no destruction of that self as long as the power of consciousness is impelled.

original: aṣṭamena tu māsena buddhirgarbhasya saṃbhavet // //
analyzed: aṣṭamena tu māsena buddhiḥ garbhasya saṃbhavet  /
translated: But in the eighth month, the embryo would have intellect.

original: yathāhaṅkāra doṣeṇa garbhavāsaṃ vasāmyaham /
analyzed: yathā ahaṅkāra doṣeṇa garbha vāsam vasāmi aham
translated: As I reside in the womb due to the fault of ego,

original: tamondhakāragahane sarvaduḥkhasamākule // //🔽p / svedamūtrapurīṣorthe vasārudhirasaṃyute /
analyzed: tamaḥ ndhakāra gahane sarva duḥkha samākule  sveda mūtra purīṣa ūrthe vasā rudhira saṃyute
translated: In the dense darkness of tamas, full of all miseries,🔽In the abode of sweat, urine and feces, mixed with fat and blood,

original: kaliśseṣmasaṅkīrṇe māṃsāsthisnāyu saṅkaṭe // //
analyzed: māṃsa asthi snāyu saṅkaṭe
translated: In the calamity of bile and phlegm, in the entanglement of flesh, bones and sinews,

original: ekaviṃśati ye proktā narakāśca bhayāvahāḥ /
analyzed: ekaviṃśati ye proktāḥ narakāḥ ca bhaya āvahāḥ
translated: The twenty-one terrifying hells that are mentioned,

original: teṣāṃ madhyānmahāghoraṃ narakaṃ kukṣi sambhavam // //
analyzed: teṣām madhyāt mahā ghoram narakam kukṣi sambhavam
translated: Among them, the most terrible hell is born from the womb.

original: candrārkarahitaṃ bhīmaṃ vāyvagni parivarjitam /
analyzed: candra arka rahitam bhīmam vāyu agni parivarjitam
translated: Devoid of the moon and sun, terrifying, devoid of wind and fire,

original: narakārṇavasaṃprakhyaṃ duḥkhakalloladussaham // //
analyzed: naraka arṇava saṃprakhyam duḥkha kallola dussaham
translated: Resembling an ocean of hell, unbearable with waves of suffering.
