original: ahaṃ jātaḥ kathaṃ putra kiṃ mayā duṣkṛtaṃ kṛtam /
analyzed: aham jātaḥ katham putra kim mayā duṣkṛtam kṛtam
translated: How was I born, O son? What evil deed was done by me?

original: evaṃ sañcintyamānasya cicchaktyā coditasya ca // //
analyzed: evam sañcintyamānasya cicchaktyā coditasya ca
translated: Thus reflecting, urged by the power of consciousness,

original: navame māsi samaye saṃprāpteṣu saveguha /
analyzed: navame māsi samaye saṃprāpteṣu
translated: In the ninth month, when the time has come, O Guha,

original: ata ūrddhvaṃ tu ye kecit garbhavāse vasanti ca // //
analyzed: atas ūrddhvam tu ye kecid garbha vāse vasanti ca
translated: But those who remain in the womb beyond that,

original: mahāpātakinaste vai upapātakinastu ye /
analyzed: mahāpātakinaḥ te vai upapātakinaḥ tu ye
translated: They are great sinners, and those who are minor sinners,

original: darśanaṃ daśame māsi sukṛtāni tu cintayet // //
analyzed: darśanam daśame māsi sukṛtāni tu cintayet
translated: The vision in the tenth month, one should think of good deeds.

original: p / yenāhaṃ santariṣyāmi yonidvārādbhayānakāt /
analyzed: yena aham santariṣyāmi yoni dvārāt bhayānakāt
translated: By which I shall cross the terrible door of the womb.

original: tadahaṃ tat kariṣyāmi yena bhuyo na jāyate // //
analyzed: tat aham tat kariṣyāmi yena bhuyaḥ na jāyate
translated: I shall do that by which I shall not be born again.

original: sukṛtāni hyaśeṣāṇi yāni vai kathitāni tu /
analyzed: su kṛtāni hi aśeṣāṇi yāni vai kathitāni tu
translated: All the good deeds that have been described,

original: vedeṣu sarvaśāstreṣu purāṇeṣu smṛtīṣu ca // //
analyzed: vedeṣu sarva śāstreṣu purāṇeṣu ca
translated: In the Vedas, in all the scriptures, in the Puranas, and in the Smritis,

original: tāni sarvān kariṣyāmi yathoktāni vidhānataḥ /
analyzed: tāni sarvān kariṣyāmi yathā uktāni vidhānataḥ
translated: I shall perform all of them as prescribed.

original: evaṃ sañcintya mānasya cicchaktyā prasavaṃ kṛtam // //🔽mahābhayaṃ tu garbhasya prasavaṃ tu śikhidhvaja /
analyzed: evam sañcintya mānasya cicchaktyā prasavam kṛtam  mahā bhayam tu garbhasya prasavam tu śikhidhvaja
translated: Thus, having thought in this way, the birth of the mind is brought about by the power of consciousness.🔽But the birth of the embryo is a great fear, O Peacock-bannered One.

original: atyanta bhayabhītā tu maṇḍa udbijitā guha // //
analyzed: atyanta bhaya bhītā tu maṇḍaḥ udbijitā guha
translated: And being extremely frightened, the embryo becomes agitated, O Guha.

original: hastapādaśarīreṇa svakena śikhivāhana /
analyzed: hasta pāda śarīreṇa svakena śikhivāhana
translated: With its own hands, feet, and body, O Peacock-vehicled One,

original: vidārya padmaṃ garbhasya yonidvāra mukhe gatam // //
analyzed: vidārya padmam garbhasya yoni dvāra mukhe gatam  /
translated: Having torn open the lotus of the womb, it enters the door of the vagina.

original: tadāmātā bhayaṃ prāptā maraṇāntika gocaram /
analyzed: tadā amātā bhayam prāptā maraṇa antika gocaram
translated: Then the mother experiences fear, approaching death.

original: p / vidārya sṛṣṭiṃ dvāreṇa mātuḥ sandeha kārakam // //
analyzed: vidārya sṛṣṭim dvāreṇa mātuḥ sandeha kārakam  /
translated: Having torn open the womb with the door, causing doubt,

original: nirgatya patate bhūmau nissaṃjñaṃ tu tadā bhavet /
analyzed: nirgatya patate bhūmau nissaṃjñam tu tadā bhavet
translated: Having emerged, it falls to the ground, then becomes unconscious.

original: na tasya sukṛte buddhirna ca duṣkṛta karmaṇi // //
analyzed: na tasya sukṛte buddhiḥ na ca duṣkṛta karmaṇi
translated: It has no understanding of good or bad deeds.

original: mohito māyayā vatsa cicchaktyā bālasaṃjñayā /
analyzed: mohitaḥ māyayā vatsa cicchaktyā bāla saṃjñayā
translated: O child, it is deluded by Maya, by the power of consciousness, with the notion of a child.

original: utpattireṣābhūtānāṃ yonijānāṃ śikhidhvaja // //
analyzed: utpattiḥ eṣā abhūtānām yoni jānām śikhidhvaja
translated: This is the birth of embodied beings born from a womb, O Peacock-bannered One.

original: tasmāt sarva prayatnena ajātapadamabhyaset //
analyzed: tasmāt sarva prayatnena ajāta padam abhyaset
translated: Therefore, with all effort, one should practice the unborn state.

original: na kiñcidapi taṃ deva yanmayānāvadhāritam /
analyzed: na kiñcid api tam deva yat mayā an avadhāritam
translated: O God, I have not understood anything at all.

original: tatrāpi saṃśayaṃ deva vartate dhātu saṅkṣayāt // //
analyzed: tatra api saṃśayam deva vartate dhātu saṅkṣayāt  /
translated: Even there, O God, doubt arises due to the exhaustion of the elements.

original: atyanta gahanaṃ praśnamapratyakṣamagocaram /
analyzed: atyanta gahanam praśnam apratyakṣam agocaram
translated: The question you have asked is extremely profound, imperceptible, and beyond the scope of ordinary understanding.

original: p / yat tvayā coditaṃ praśnaṃ putrasnehādvadāmite // //
analyzed: yat tvayā coditam praśnam putra snehāt vadāmi te
translated: But out of affection for my son, I will tell you the answer to the question you have posed.

original: pañcabhautika piṇḍasya cicchaktyā nirmitasya ca /
analyzed: pañcabhautika piṇḍasya cicchaktyā nirmitasya ca
translated: The body composed of the five elements, created by the power of consciousness,

original: yathā vai dhātu saṃkhyānamaṅgānāṃ ca śṛṇuṣvame // //
analyzed: yathā vai dhātu saṃkhyānam aṅgānām ca śṛṇuṣva ame
translated: Listen to the enumeration of its constituents and limbs.

original: ṣaḍrasāhāratṛptasya dhātusantarpitasya ca /
analyzed: ṣaṣ rasa āhāra tṛptasya dhātu santarpitasya ca
translated: The body nourished by food with six tastes, and satisfied with the nourishment of the elements,

original: rasaṃ sambhavate vatsa māsamekaṃ tu niṣphalā // //
analyzed: rasam sambhavate vatsa māsam ekam tu niṣphalā
translated: The rasa (nutrient fluid) develops for one month, but then becomes fruitless.

original: taṃ rasaṃ rasarūpeṇa cicchaktyā hyamṛtaṃ kṛtam /
analyzed: tam rasam rasa rūpeṇa cit śaktyā hi amṛtam kṛtam
translated: That rasa, in the form of rasa, is made immortal by the power of consciousness,

original: parāgni saṃbhavaṃ taṃ vai na sa śukro bhavatyasau // //
analyzed: parā agni saṃbhavam tam vai na sa śukraḥ bhavati asau
translated: Born from the supreme fire, it does not become semen.

original: sṛṣṭibījaṃ tu taṃ jñeyaṃ tataḥ sṛṣṭiḥ pravartate /🔽rasādraktaṃ tato māṃsaṃ māṃsānmedotha jāyate // //
analyzed: sṛṣṭi bījam tu tam jñeyam tatas sṛṣṭiḥ pravartate  rasāt raktam tatas māṃsam māṃsāt medaḥ atha jāyate
translated: It should be known as the seed of creation, from which creation proceeds.🔽 From rasa, blood arises; from blood, flesh; from flesh, fat is produced.

original: medasosthi tathā majjā majjā cchūkraṃ ca jāyate /
analyzed: medasaḥ usthi tathā majjā majjāt śūkram ca jāyate
translated: From fat, bone; from bone, marrow; and from marrow, semen is produced.

original: śukrāddhātūni sarvāṇi dhātubhyāṃ dehamānuṣam // //
analyzed: śukrāt dhātūni sarvāṇi dhātubhyām deha mānuṣam
translated: From semen, all the bodily constituents; from the constituents, the human body.

original: teṣāṃ santarpaṇaṃ tuṣṭi rasatarpaṇato vyayam /
analyzed: teṣām santarpaṇam tuṣṭi rasa tarpaṇataḥ vyayam
translated: The satisfaction of them is contentment; the expenditure is from the satisfaction of rasa.

original: evaṃ hi prathamaṃ tāvaccharīrotpatti kāraṇam // //
analyzed: evam hi prathamam tāvat śarīra utpatti kāraṇam
translated: Thus, this is the cause of the origin of the body, first of all.

original: p / anantaraṃ punarvatsa yathā bhavati tacchṛṇu /🔽vātaṃ pittaṃ tathā śleṣmaṃ dhātavaḥ parikīrtitāḥ // //
analyzed: anantaram punarvat sa yathā bhavati tat śṛṇu  vātam pittam tathā śleṣmam dhātavaḥ parikīrtitāḥ
translated: Now listen, O child, how it becomes again.🔽Wind, bile, phlegm, and the elements are declared.

original: viṇmūtra śukramajjā tu māṃsaṃ caivāṣṭamaṃ viduḥ /🔽śarīradhāraṇā hyete saṅkhyāsaṅkhyā kṛtāṃ guṇāḥ // //
analyzed: viṣ mūtra śukra majjā tu māṃsam ca eva aṣṭamam viduḥ  śarīra dhāraṇāḥ hi ete saṅkhyā saṅkhyā kṛtām guṇāḥ
translated: Feces, urine, semen, marrow, and flesh are known as the eighth.🔽These sustain the body, and the qualities are counted and enumerated.

original: dhātu sāmye sthitā dehe sarve te guṇakārakāḥ /
analyzed: dhātu sāmye sthitā dehe sarve te guṇakārakāḥ
translated: When the elements are in balance in the body, all of them are the causes of qualities.

original: tāsāṃ saṅkhyā bhavedeṣā kalpanā śikhivāhana // //
analyzed: tāsām saṅkhyā bhavet eṣā kalpanā śikhivāhana
translated: This is their enumeration, O carrier of the peacock's tail.

original: viparyayeṇa dhātūnāṃ na hi saṅkhyā bhavet guha /
analyzed: viparyayeṇa dhātūnām na hi saṅkhyā bhavet guha
translated: When the elements are in reverse, there is no enumeration, O Guha.

original: vāyu bhāve guṇā ye ca ye vāne yau dhvane tathā // //
analyzed: vāyu bhāve guṇāḥ ye ca ye vāne yau dhvane tathā
translated: The qualities that are in the wind element, and those that are in the fire element,

original: na tu madhya vayotīta samatvaṃ sarvadhātuṣu /
analyzed: na tu sama tvam sarva dhātuṣu
translated: but not in the middle age, there is equality in all the elements.

original: atorthā dhātu pūrvāye asaṅkhyeyāvilāguha // //
analyzed: atorthāḥ dhātu pūrva āye   /
translated: Therefore, O Guha, the elements are the foremost, their enumeration is endless.

original: sthito yo sau hṛdi hyagniḥ praṇavorthaḥ śikhidhvaja /
analyzed: sthitaḥ sau hṛdi hi agniḥ śikhidhvaja
translated: O peacock-bannered one, the fire that resides in the heart is the meaning of the syllable Om.

original: tena santarpite naiva dhātavastarpitā guha // //
analyzed: tena santarpite na eva dhātavaḥ tarpitāḥ guha
translated: When it is satisfied, the elements are satisfied, O Guha.

original: sa śṛṇoti sa vai paśyed yo rasān svādate ciram /
analyzed: sa śṛṇoti sa vai paśyet yaḥ rasān svādate ciram
translated: He who hears, he who sees, he who tastes the flavors for a long time,

original: p / sa tu gandha guṇasparśaṃ bhuñjate dehasaṃsthitaḥ // //
analyzed: sa tu gandha guṇa sparśam bhuñjate deha saṃsthitaḥ
translated: he who resides in the body, enjoys smell, quality, and touch.

original: tasya bhāvāt pralīyante sarve te dhātavaḥ sadā /
analyzed: tasya bhāvāt pralīyante sarve te dhātavaḥ sadā
translated: From its existence, all those elements always dissolve.

original: tasmād vai sarvadā vatsa sa kartāsevakāraṇam // //
analyzed: tasmāt vai sarvadā vatsa sa kartā aseva kāraṇam  /
translated: Therefore, O child, it is the creator and the cause of all actions.

original: yathā rasmi sahasrāṇi sūryāyattāni ṣaṇmukha /
analyzed: yathā rasmi sahasrāṇi sūrya āyattāni ṣaṇmukha
translated: Just as thousands of rays depend on the sun, O Six-faced One,

original: tathā sarvāṇi bhūtāni te jāyattāni sarvaśaḥ // //
analyzed: tathā sarvāṇi bhūtāni te jāyattāni sarvaśas
translated: in the same way, all beings are born from it in every way.

original: dātūtpattirmayā jñātā yathā tathyaṃ suvistaram /
analyzed: dātu utpattiḥ mayā jñātā yathā tathyam su vistaram
translated: The origin of the elements has been known by me as it truly is, in great detail.

original: sarveṣāmeva dhātūnāṃ raktaṃ tu prathamaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: sarveṣām eva dhātūnām raktam tu prathamam bhavet
translated: Of all the elements, blood is the first.

original: sa tu māṃsaṃ samāśritya saṃsthitaṃ sarvadehinām // //
analyzed: sa tu māṃsam samāśritya saṃsthitam sarva dehinām
translated: It exists in all embodied beings, depending on the flesh.

original: tasya majjā bhavedvatsa paladvātriṃśa saṃkhyayā /
analyzed: tasya majjā bhavet vatsa pala dvātriṃśa saṃkhyayā
translated: O child, its marrow is thirty-two pala in number.

original: p / māṃsaṃ peśīśatānyaṣṭau śataiketaiva cādhikaḥ // //
analyzed: māṃsam peśī śatāni aṣṭau ca adhikaḥ
translated: The flesh is eight hundred lumps, one hundred more than that.

original: payaḥ pītvā bhaved raktaṃ dviguṇaṃ taṃ śikhidhvaja /
analyzed: payaḥ pītvā bhavet raktam dviguṇam tam śikhidhvaja
translated: Having drunk milk, blood becomes twice that, O Peacock-bannered One.

original: pittasya tu palānyaṣṭau śleṣmarakta samāśritam // //
analyzed: pittasya tu palāni aṣṭau śleṣma rakta samāśritam
translated: There are eight palas of bile, and phlegm depends on blood.

original: raktasya hi samaṃ śleṣmaṃ tadvadvṛttistu ṣaṇmukha /
analyzed: raktasya hi samam śleṣmam tadvat vṛttiḥ tu ṣaṇmukha
translated: Phlegm is equal to blood, and its function is the same, O Six-faced One.

original: vasāmedaḥ pṛthaktvena ubhau viṃśatpalīnakau // //
analyzed: vasā medaḥ pṛthaktvena ubhau viṃśat palīnakau
translated: Fat and sweat are separate, each twenty palas.

original: śukraṃ pittaṃ samaṃ jñeyaṃmasthimajjāntareṣu ca /
analyzed: śukram pittam samam jñeyam asthi majja antareṣu ca
translated: Semen should be known as equal to bile, and in the intervals of bone and marrow.

original: vasādāhārapānāṃbhyāṃ viṇmūtraṃ jāyate punaḥ // //
analyzed: vasā dāhāra pāna āṃbhyām viṣ mūtram jāyate punar
translated: From the food and drink of fat, feces and urine are produced again.

original: tadā bhāvai hyasaṃkhyeyaṃ sthiratvaṃ teṣu naiva ca /
analyzed: tadā hi asaṃkhyeyam sthira tvam teṣu nā eva ca
translated: Then, by the elements, it is innumerable, but there is no stability in them.

original: raktaṃ pittaṃ tathā śleṣmaṃ śukraṃ majjā tu ṣaṇmukha // //
analyzed: raktam pittam tathā śleṣmam śukram majjā tu ṣaṇmukha
translated: Blood, bile, phlegm, semen, and marrow, O Six-faced One.

original: rasodbhavāni caitāni rasabhāvā tu naiva hi /
analyzed: rasa udbhavāni ca etāni rasa bhāvā tu nā eva hi
translated: These are produced from rasa, but rasa itself has no existence.

original: sarveṣāmeva dhātūnāṃ pittaṃ vai śleṣma bandhanam // //🔽yasmādrasodbhavāḥ sarve tadā teṣāṃ nibandhanam /
analyzed: sarveṣām eva dhātūnām pittam vai śleṣma bandhanam  yasmāt rasa udbhavāḥ sarve tadā teṣām nibandhanam
translated: Of all the dhatus, bile is the binding agent of phlegm.🔽Since all of them are produced from rasa, then that is their binding agent.

original: yasmādrasodbhavāḥ sarve tadā teṣāṃ nibandhanam // //
analyzed: yasmāt rasa udbhavāḥ sarve tadā teṣām nibandhanam
translated: Since all of them are produced from rasa, then that is their binding agent.

original: p / majjāyāṃ tu palāviṃśat sarvāsthyabhyantare sthitāḥ /
analyzed: majjāyām tu palā viṃśat sarva asthi abhyantare sthitāḥ
translated: In the marrow, there are twenty pala-s, located inside all the bones.

original: asthīnāṃ tu śatāṃ trīṇi ṣaṣṭhya sthiradhikāni ca // //
analyzed: asthīnām tu trīṇi ca
translated: There are three hundred bones, with sixty more.

original: tantrīṇāṃ caiva vijñeyaṃ śatamaṣṭādhikaṃ tathā /
analyzed: tantrīṇām ca eva vijñeyam śatam aṣṭa adhikam tathā
translated: And of the sinews, one should know there are one hundred and eight.

original: aṣṭottaraṃ carmaśataṃ sirāṇāṃ sapta vai śatam // //
analyzed: aṣṭa uttaram carma śatam sirāṇām sapta vai śatam
translated: There are one hundred and eight skins, and seven hundred veins.

original: tāśca rakta vahāḥ sarvā dehamācchādyasaṃsthitāḥ /
analyzed: tāḥ ca rakta vahāḥ sarvāḥ deham ācchādya saṃsthitāḥ
translated: And all of them carry blood, covering the body and remaining there.

original: granthīnāṃ tu śataṃ vatsa aṣṭātriṃśottaraṃ tathā // //
analyzed: granthīnām tu śatam vatsa aṣṭātriṃśa uttaram tathā
translated: There are one hundred and thirty-eight knots, O calf.

original: pradhānā granthayaḥ pañca yaiḥ kāryaṃ mokṣasādhane /
analyzed: pradhānāḥ granthayaḥ pañca yaiḥ kāryam mokṣa sādhane
translated: The five principal knots are the means for attaining liberation.

original: snāyu jālamasaṃkhyeyaṃ yairbaddhaṃ kāyapañjaram // //
analyzed: snāyu jālam asaṃkhyeyam yaiḥ baddham kāya pañjaram
translated: The innumerable network of sinews binds the cage of the body.

original: māṃsaṃ tu dhāryate taistu saṅkoca karaṇāni te /🔽catuṣṣaṣṭirbhavet kūrcaṃ tayoḥ snāyūṃśca sambhavet // //
analyzed: māṃsam tu dhāryate taiḥ tu saṅkoca karaṇāni te  catuḥṣaṣṭiḥ bhavet kūrcam tayoḥ snāyūn ca sambhavet  /
translated: The flesh is held by them, and they are the agents of contraction.🔽There are sixty-four curls, and from them arise the sinews.

original: sūcitātā bhavet ṣaṣṭiḥ snāyu sūtraistu yantritam /
analyzed: bhavet ṣaṣṭiḥ snāyu sūtraiḥ tu yantritam
translated: The sixty sinews are indicated, and the body is constructed with sinew threads.

original: tadā yantra mayaṃ sarvaṃ śarīraṃ mānuṣātmakam // //
analyzed: tadā yantra mayam sarvam śarīram mānuṣa ātmakam
translated: Then the entire body, which is of human nature, is a machine.

original: p / dvāsaptati sahasrāṇi nāḍīnāṃ parikīrtitam /
analyzed: dvāsaptati sahasrāṇi nāḍīnām parikīrtitam
translated: Seventy-two thousand channels are proclaimed.

original: tāstu vāyu vahāḥ sarvāssarvāstā mokṣadāḥ śubhāḥ // //
analyzed: tāḥ tu vāyu vahāḥ sarvāḥ sarvāḥ tāḥ mokṣa dāḥ śubhāḥ
translated: All of them carry wind, and all of them are auspicious givers of liberation.

original: tāsāṃ madhye pradhānaikā piṅgalā amṛtodbhavā /
analyzed: tāsām madhye pradhānā ekā piṅgalā amṛta udbhavā
translated: Among them, the principal one is Pingala, born of nectar.

original: tadudbhavāṇi sarvāṇi yathā prāṇodbhavānilāḥ // //
analyzed: tad udbhavāṇi sarvāṇi yathā prāṇa udbhava anilāḥ
translated: All of them arise from it, just as the winds arise from the vital force.

original: carmamekaṃ tu vikhyātaṃ roma cchannaṃ samantataḥ /
analyzed: carmam ekam tu vikhyātam roma channam samantataḥ
translated: The skin is known to be one, covered with hair all around.

original: tisraḥ koṭyo va koṭistu romasaṅkhyaḥ prakīrtitāḥ // //
analyzed: tisraḥ koṭyaḥ koṭiḥ tu roma saṅkhyaḥ prakīrtitāḥ
translated: Three and a half crores are proclaimed to be the number of hairs.

original: te ca nāḍi samudbhūtā yasmāt tejodbhavāni te /
analyzed: te ca samudbhūtāḥ yasmāt teja udbhavāni te
translated: And since they arise from the channels, they are born of the light.

original: te saṅkhye yā asaṅkhye yā ye tu dehāntare sthitā // //
analyzed: te saṅkhye yāḥ asaṅkhye yāḥ ye tu deha antare
translated: Those that are in the uncountable, and those that are in other bodies,

original: sarve tejaḥ samudbhūtā sarve te tejasaṃsthitāḥ /
analyzed: sarve sarve tejaḥ samudbhūtā sarve te teja saṃsthitāḥ
translated: all have arisen from fire, all abide in fire.

original: lomakrāmāni sarvāṇi dvārāṇi śikhivāhana // //
analyzed: loma krāmāni sarvāṇi dvārāṇi śikhivāhana
translated: All the pores of the body, O peacock-vehicled one, are the doors.

original: ajñānānnaiva dṛśyante dṛśyante jñāna cakṣuṣā /
analyzed: ajñānāt na eva dṛśyante dṛśyante jñāna cakṣuṣā
translated: They are not seen due to ignorance, but are seen by the eye of knowledge.

original: p / nakhānāṃ viṃśatiḥ proktā navadvārāṇi ṣaṇmukha // //
analyzed: nakhānām viṃśatiḥ proktā nava dvārāṇi ṣaṇmukha
translated: The nails are said to be twenty, and the doors are nine, O six-faced one.

original: evaṃ saṅkhyā samudbhūtā śarīreṣu śarīriṇām // //
analyzed: evam saṅkhyā samudbhūtā śarīreṣu śarīriṇām
translated: Thus the enumeration has arisen in the bodies of embodied beings.

original: avayavānāṃ tu sarveṣāṃ saṅkhyotpattirmayā śrūtā /
analyzed: avayavānām tu sarveṣām saṅkhyā utpattiḥ mayā śrūtā
translated: I have heard the enumeration of all the parts.

original: bhūyo vijñātu micchāmi brahmaveśma śarīrajām // //
analyzed: bhūyas vijñātum icchāmi brahma veśma śarīra jām
translated: I wish to know further the abode of Brahman born from the body.

original: sarve praśnā mayāproktā rahasyāni tu sarvasaḥ /
analyzed: sarve praśnāḥ mayā a proktāḥ rahasyāni tu sarvasas
translated: All the questions have been asked by me, and all the secrets.

original: yasmādbrahma mayaṃ dehamatrabrahma tu labhyate // //
analyzed: yasmāt brahma mayam deham atra brahma tu labhyate
translated: Since the Brahman-made body is obtained here, Brahman is obtained.

original: avayavāḥ pūrvamuktā mayā caivaṃ śikhidhvaja /
analyzed: avayavāḥ pūrvam uktāḥ mayā ca evam śikhidhvaja
translated: The parts have been previously mentioned by me, O peacock-bannered one.

original: yadyekona bhavet teṣāṃ tadā sarve hyapārthakāḥ // //
analyzed: yadi ekaḥ ūna bhavet teṣām tadā sarve hi apārthakāḥ
translated: If they were to be one less, then all would be useless.

original: prāktanānabhavantyete saṃhatādeha dhārakāḥ /
analyzed: ete saṃhatā deha dhārakāḥ
translated: These have been in the past, united, supporting the body.

original: p / ekaikaṃ ca tathā bhūtamutpannaṃ śakti coditam // //
analyzed: ekaikam ca tathā bhūtam utpannam coditam  /
translated: And each one is thus produced, impelled by power.

original: punareva tu te naiva yantritaṃ bhūta pañjaram /
analyzed: punar eva tu te na eva yantritam bhūta pañjaram
translated: But again, that machine-like assemblage of elements is not yours.

original: tasmād yantra mayaṃ sarvaṃ śarīraṃ mānuṣātmakam // //🔽gṛhakṛtyasamādṛśyamasthidā rucitaṃ śubham /
analyzed: tasmāt yantra mayam sarvam śarīram mānuṣa ātmakam  gṛha kṛtya samādṛśyam asthidā rucitam śubham
translated: Therefore, the entire body, which is the abode of the human soul, is full of machines.

original: māṃsarakta mṛdādigdhaṃ snāyu kīlaka kīlitam // //
analyzed: māṃsa rakta mṛd ādigdham snāyu kīlaka kīlitam
translated: The bones are like the foundation, the flesh and blood are like the plaster, and the sinews are like the nails.

original: lipte vai carma lepena navadvāropaśobhitam /
analyzed: lipte vai carma lepena nava dvāra upaśobhitam
translated: The skin is like the plaster, and it is adorned with nine doors.

original: ekona dhāryate stambhaṃ brahmāṇḍaṃ yena dhāryate // //
analyzed: dhāryate stambham brahmāṇḍam yena dhāryate
translated: It is supported by a single pillar, by which the universe is supported.

original: brahmaveśma sadāvatsa tasmin madhye paraṃ sthitam /
analyzed: brahmaveśma tasmin madhye param sthitam
translated: In the middle of that, the supreme Brahman resides, always present in the abode of Brahman.

original: brahmaṇo veśmano madhye vedamagni trayasya ca // //
analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ veśmanaḥ madhye vedam agni trayasya ca
translated: In the middle of the abode of Brahman, and of the three fires of the Vedas,

original: teṣāṃ homaṃ prakurvīta pratyahaṃ cāhitāgninā /
analyzed: teṣām homam prakurvīta pratyaham ca āhitāgninā
translated: One should perform their oblations daily, as one who has established the sacred fires.

original: ājyendha na tilairdarbhairdhūmairgandhaiḥ srajaiḥ śubhaiḥ // //
analyzed: ājya indha na tilaiḥ darbhaiḥ dhūmaiḥ gandhaiḥ srajaiḥ śubhaiḥ
translated: With ghee, fuel, sesame seeds, darbha grass, incense, and auspicious garlands,

original: na teṣāṃ tuṣṭipuṣṭirvāhutaistairjīvasaṃjñakaiḥ /
analyzed: na teṣām tuṣṭi puṣṭiḥ vā āhutaiḥ taiḥ jīva saṃjñakaiḥ
translated: Their satisfaction and nourishment are not by those offerings, which are called living beings.

original: tuṣyante tarpitāvatsa prāṇāpānāhutīṣu ca // //
analyzed: tuṣyante prāṇa apāna āhutīṣu ca
translated: They are satisfied and nourished by the offerings of inhalation and exhalation, as if satiated.

original: p / na teṣāṃ hūyate havyamajīvaṃ brahmasaṃbhavam /
analyzed: na teṣām hūyate havyam ajīvam brahma saṃbhavam
translated: No oblation is offered to them, which is unborn and arises from Brahman.

original: juhuyāt satataṃ vatsa prāṇāpānāvamṛtodbhavau // //
analyzed: juhuyāt satatam vatsa prāṇa apānau amṛta udbhavau  /
translated: One should always offer the oblations of inhalation and exhalation, which arise from immortality, O child.

original: turyasthānāmṛtaṃ vatsa vasudhārevasaṃsthitam /
analyzed: turya sthāna amṛtam vatsa vasudhā rāj iva saṃsthitam
translated: O child, the nectar of the fourth state exists like a stream of wealth.

original: sravate satataṃ vatsa prāṇāgnau tarpaṇaṃ prati // //
analyzed: sravate satatam vatsa prāṇa agnau tarpaṇam prati
translated: O child, it always flows towards the satisfaction of the fire of life.

original: agnayastena tṛpyanti ājyendha na nirarthakāḥ /
analyzed: agnayaḥ tena tṛpyanti ājya indha na nirarthakāḥ
translated: By that, the fires are satisfied, the useless sacrificial fires with ghee.

original: bāhyāgnītamupāsīta vidhidṛṣṭena karmaṇā // //
analyzed: bāhyāgnītam upāsīta vidhi dṛṣṭena karmaṇā
translated: One should attend to the external sacrificial fire with rites seen in the scriptures.

original: bhurbhuvaḥ svastapolokā dṛśyante tairhutākhilāḥ /
analyzed: bhuḥ bhuvaḥ svar tapolokāḥ dṛśyante taiḥ huta akhilāḥ
translated: The worlds Bhu, Bhuva, Sva, Tapa, and Satya are seen to be completely offered by them.

original: brahmavedirbhavedeṣā brahmaveśmasya madhyataḥ // //
analyzed: brahmavediḥ bhavet eṣā brahmaveśmasya madhyatas
translated: This would be the altar of Brahman in the middle of the abode of Brahman.

original: antarvedī tathātraiva suṣumṇā trāntare sthitā /
analyzed: antarvedī tathā atrā eva suṣumṇā sthitā
translated: And the inner altar is also here itself, with Susumna situated in the middle.

original: prayāgaṃ ca kurukṣettraṃ puṣkaraṃ naimiṣaṃ tathā // /
analyzed: prayāgam ca kurukṣettram puṣkaram naimiṣam tathā
translated: Prayaga, Kurukshetra, Pushkara, Naimisha,

original: vārāṇasī tathā gaṅgā kedāraṃ sindhu sāgaram /
analyzed: vārāṇasī tathā gaṅgā kedāram sindhu sāgaram
translated: Varanasi, Ganga, Kedara, Sindhu, and the ocean,

original: ete cānyepi ye kecit tīrthānyāyatanāni ca //
analyzed: ete ca anye api ye kecid tīrthāni āyatanāni ca
translated: and all these and whatever other sacred places and shrines there are,

original: p / sarve tiṣṭhanti brahmajña paramāgnau juhoti yaḥ /
analyzed: sarve tiṣṭhanti brahma jña parama agnau juhoti yaḥ
translated: all of them are present, O knower of Brahman, in the supreme fire into which one who offers oblations resides.

original: sarvaṃ sarveṣu bhūteṣu prakaṭaṃ saṃsthitaṃ guha //
analyzed: sarvam sarveṣu bhūteṣu prakaṭam saṃsthitam guha
translated: O Guha, everything is manifest and present in all beings.

original: ajñānānnaiva paśyanti paśyanti jñāna cakṣuṣā //
analyzed: ajñānāt na eva paśyanti paśyanti jñāna cakṣuṣā
translated: The ignorant do not see it at all, but the wise see it with the eye of knowledge.

original: brahmaveśma tathājyaṃ ca tvat prasādācchrutaṃ mayā /
analyzed: brahmaveśma tathā ājyam ca tvat prasādāt śrutam mayā
translated: I have heard about the abode of Brahman and the ghee through your grace.

original: adhunā śrotu micchāmi brahmabrahmapuresthitam //
analyzed: adhunā śrotum icchāmi
translated: Now I wish to hear about the one who resides in the city of Brahman, the Supreme Brahman.

original: sarvaṃ sarvaṃ mayākhyātaṃ yat tvayā pṛcchitaṃ guha /
analyzed: sarvam sarvam mayā ākhyātam yat tvayā pṛcchitam guha
translated: O Guha, I have told you everything that you have asked about.

original: ayaṃ praśno gurorvaktrādyadi jñāsyasi niścayāt //
analyzed: ayam praśnaḥ guroḥ vaktrāt yadi jñāsyasi niścayāt
translated: If you can definitely know this question from the mouth of the teacher,

original: rahasyaṃ sarva śāstreṣu vedādi sahiteṣu ca /
analyzed: rahasyam sarva śāstreṣu vedādi sahiteṣu ca
translated: The secret in all the scriptures, along with the Vedas and others,

original: siddhānte kula siddhānte avācyaṃ yat kathaṃ ca te // //
analyzed: siddhānte kula siddhānte avācyam yat katham ca te
translated: How can you speak of what is inexpressible in the conclusion of the Kula doctrine?

original: nityoditaṃ ca nityaṃ ca anityaṃ kalpanātmakam /
analyzed: nitya uditam ca nityam ca anityam kalpanā ātmakam
translated: The eternally manifest and the eternal are imagined to be impermanent.

original: p / yat tvayā coditaṃ vatsa ati snehādbadāmite // //
analyzed: yat tvayā coditam vatsa ati snehāt badāmi te
translated: O child, what has been asked by you out of great affection, I shall tell you.

original: yo sau hyadi sthitaḥ padmaḥ praṇavortthaḥ śikhidhvaja /
analyzed: sthitaḥ padmaḥ śikhidhvaja
translated: O peacock-bannered one, that lotus which has existed from the beginning is the meaning of the syllable Om.

original: tasya madhye paraṃ tejo yaḥ paśyati sa paśyati // //
analyzed: tasya madhye param tejaḥ yaḥ paśyati sa paśyati  /
translated: He who sees that supreme radiance in its center, he sees.

original: mahājvālā samākīrṇaṃ raśmibhiḥ parivāritam /
analyzed: mahā jvālā samākīrṇam raśmibhiḥ parivāritam
translated: Surrounded by great flames and encircled by rays,

original: asaṅkhyā bhāsurābhāsaṃ brahmaveśmasya dīpanam // //
analyzed: asaṅkhyā bhāsuḥ ābhāsam brahmaveśmasya dīpanam
translated: Illuminating the abode of Brahman with countless radiant lights.

original: taṃ ca paśyati yaḥ putra taṃ ca brahma vido viduḥ /
analyzed: tam ca paśyati yaḥ putra tam ca brahma vidaḥ viduḥ
translated: O son, he who sees that, the knowers of Brahman know him.

original: nadate satataṃ yasmāt tasmān nādamihocyate // //
analyzed: nadate satatam yasmāt tasmāt nādam iha ucyate  /
translated: Because it resounds continuously, therefore it is called Nada.

original: pravāhena sthitaṃ vatsa yathā nadyo jalāśayāḥ /
analyzed: pravāhena sthitam vatsa yathā nadyaḥ jalāśayāḥ
translated: O child, just as the water reservoirs are situated in the current of rivers,

original: abyucchinnaṃ ca taṃ nādaṃ nadate sarva dehinām // //
analyzed: abyucchinnam ca tam nādam nadate sarva dehinām
translated: And that sound resounds uninterruptedly to all embodied beings.

original: dehe dehe na cānyo vai ekaṃ vai sarvataḥ sthitam /
analyzed: dehe dehe na ca anyaḥ vai ekam vai sarvatas sthitam
translated: In every body, there is no other than that, it is one, present everywhere.

original: anacchaṃ kecidicchanti śūnyaṃ kecitva danti ca // //
analyzed: anaccham kecid icchanti śūnyam ca
translated: Some conceive it as non-existent, some as empty, and some as

original: mātrārdhamātraṃ kecicca nāsti nāstīti nāstikāḥ /
analyzed: mātrā ardha mātram kecid ca na asti na asti iti nāstikāḥ
translated: half a mātrā. The non-believers say it does not exist, it does not exist.

original: p / taṃ nādaṃ prakaṭaṃ yeṣāṃ teṣāṃ mokṣo dhruvaṃ guha // //
analyzed: tam nādam prakaṭam yeṣām teṣām mokṣaḥ dhruvam guha
translated: O Guha, for those who have made that sound manifest, liberation is certain.

original: dhūlibhedena te siddhaṃ siddhaṃ gurumukhācchubham /
analyzed: dhūli bhedena te siddham siddham guru mukhāt śubham
translated: The auspicious accomplishment is accomplished through the guru's mouth, by the distinction of dust.

original: tvāṃ viditvā mahāsenaṃ taṃ mokṣaṃ prāpsyase dhurvam // //
analyzed: tvām viditvā mahāsenam tam mokṣam prāpsyase dhurvam
translated: Having known you, Mahāsena, you will certainly attain that liberation.

original: dhruvaṃ bhavedbhavedvatsa dhruvarūpeṇasaṃsthitam /
analyzed: dhruvam bhavet bhavet vatsa dhruva rūpeṇa saṃsthitam
translated: O child, it would certainly be, it would be, existing in the form of Dhruva.

original: paramāgni samudbhūtaṃ taṃ nādaṃ nadate guha // //
analyzed: parama agni samudbhūtam tam nādam nadate guha
translated: That sound resounds, O Guha, arisen from the supreme fire.

original: tacca darśayate vastu sa gururgurureva ca /
analyzed: tat ca darśayate vastu sa guruḥ guruḥ eva ca
translated: And that object is shown, he is the guru, and he is the true guru.

original: daiśikastu sa vijñeyo mokṣo vai mokṣikastu saḥ // //
analyzed: daiśikaḥ tu sa vijñeyaḥ mokṣaḥ vai mokṣikaḥ tu saḥ
translated: He should be known as the guide, and liberation is indeed the liberator.

original: lakṣaṇaṃ śṛṇu nādasya yathātvaṃ lakṣayiṣyasi /
analyzed: lakṣaṇam śṛṇu nādasya yathā tvam lakṣayiṣyasi
translated: Listen to the characteristic of sound, by which you will perceive it.

original: yena vijñāta mātreṇa bhrānti jñānaṃ nivartate // //
analyzed: yena vijñāta mātreṇa bhrānti jñānam nivartate
translated: By merely knowing it, the knowledge of delusion ceases.

original: yathendhanapradīptegnau yathākṣobha cyutaṃ jale /
analyzed: yathā indhana pradīpta ignau yathā akṣobha cyutam jale
translated: Just as a fire burning with fuel, just as a sound in water that is not agitated,

original: yathā vātāhate vṛkṣe śabdoyaṃ śrūyate guha // //
analyzed: yathā vāta āhate vṛkṣe śabdaḥ ūyam śrūyate guha
translated: Or just as a sound is heard in a tree shaken by the wind, O Guha.

original: tathā śarīra brahmoyaṃ pratyakṣaṃ śṛṇu ṣaṇmukha /
analyzed: tathā brahmā ūyam pratyakṣam śṛṇu ṣaṇmukha
translated: So this Brahman is in the body, listen directly, O Six-faced One.

original: śṛṅgadhvani ninādena nadantaṃ yaḥ śṛṇoti vai // //
analyzed: śṛṅga dhvani ninādena nadantam yaḥ śṛṇoti vai
translated: One who hears the sound of the mountain roaring,

original: p / taṃ nādaṃ brahmamityāhuryaḥ śṛṇoti śṛṇoti saḥ /
analyzed: tam nādam brahmam iti āhuḥ yaḥ śṛṇoti śṛṇoti saḥ
translated: They call that sound Brahman, he who hears hears that.

original: na kiñcidapi taṃ vatsa yasya taṃ na hyadi sthitam // //
analyzed: na kiñcid api tam vatsa yasya tam na hi adi sthitam
translated: O child, that which is not anything at all, that is not established.

original: na tu jānanti taṃ mūḍhā jñāna vijñāna varjitāḥ /
analyzed: na tu jānanti tam mūḍhāḥ jñāna vijñāna varjitāḥ
translated: But the deluded ones who are devoid of knowledge and wisdom do not know that.

original: prakaṭaṃ jñāna cakṣurbhyāṃ paśyate śṛṇute tu saḥ // //
analyzed: prakaṭam jñāna cakṣurbhyām paśyate śṛṇute tu saḥ
translated: He sees and hears with the eyes of manifest knowledge.

original: tarjanī prāntasaṃruddhau karṇau dvaukārayedguha /
analyzed: tarjanī prānta saṃruddhau karṇau dvau kārayet guha
translated: O Guha, one should make the two ears obstructed by the tip of the index finger.

original: etena śrūyate nādaṃ na dantaṃ brahmasaṃbhavam // //
analyzed: etena śrūyate nādam na dantam brahma saṃbhavam
translated: By this, the sound of Brahman is heard, not the sound of the teeth.

original: evaṃ vai paramaṃ nādaṃ hṛdisthaṃ sarvadehinām /
analyzed: evam vai paramam nādam hṛdistham sarva dehinām
translated: Thus indeed, the supreme sound resides in the heart of all embodied beings.

original: brahmādi stambha paryantamākārā ye bhavanti vai // //🔽teṣāṃ hṛdi sthitaṃ vatsa guruvaktrāt tu labhyate /
analyzed: brahma ādi stambha paryantam ākārāḥ ye bhavanti vai  teṣām hṛdi sthitam vatsa guru vaktrāt tu labhyate
translated: From Brahman up to a pillar, whatever forms exist,🔽They reside in the heart, O child, and are obtained from the mouth of the guru.

original: gurūpadeśagamyoyaṃ yadi tuṣṭo vadatyasau // //
analyzed: guru upadeśa gamyā iyam yadi tuṣṭaḥ vadati asau
translated: If he is pleased and speaks, this is to be reached by the guru's instruction.

original: anyathā na tu siddhyeta kalpakoṭi śatairapi /
analyzed: anyathā na tu siddhyeta
translated: Otherwise, it would not be accomplished even in hundreds of millions of eons.

original: sa tṛptaḥ sa ca vai muktaḥ somṛtaṃ cāśnute dhruvam // //
analyzed: sa tṛptaḥ sa ca vai muktaḥ sa umṛtam ca aśnute dhruvam
translated: He is satisfied, he is liberated, and he certainly enjoys immortality.

original: p / yasyedaṃ viditaṃ brahma paraspara padānugam /
analyzed: yasya idam viditam brahma paraspara padānugam
translated: For one who knows this Brahman, which follows each other's words,

original: paraṃparagataṃ vatsa parātparataraṃ hitam // //
analyzed: paraṃpara gatam vatsa parātparataram hitam
translated: Which has come down through a series, O child, which is higher than the highest, and beneficial.

original: taṃ ca nādaṃ samākhyātaṃ yena vyāptaṃ carācaram /
analyzed: tam ca nādam samākhyātam yena vyāptam carācaram
translated: And that sound is declared, by which the moving and unmoving are pervaded,

original: brahmādi sarva bhūteṣu careṣu hyacareṣu ca // //
analyzed: brahmādi sarva bhūteṣu careṣu hi acareṣu ca
translated: In all beings beginning with Brahma, in the moving and unmoving.

original: hṛdisthaṃ nadate nādaṃ prāṇādyā vāyavekhilāḥ /
analyzed: hṛdistham nadate nādam prāṇa ādyāḥ vāyu vekhilāḥ
translated: The sound resounds in the heart, and all the vital airs beginning with prana,

original: vyāpāreṣu sa vai kartā samastavyastakeṣu ca // //
analyzed: vyāpāreṣu sa vai kartā samasta vyastakeṣu ca
translated: He is the agent in all the operations, both collectively and individually.

original: sa kartā sa hi vijñeyastvaṃ tarhya na gato guha /
analyzed: sa kartā sa hi vijñeyaḥ tvam tarhya na gataḥ guha
translated: He should be known as the agent, O Guha, you have not gone to him.

original: sarve ye kecid vyāpārāḥ sṛṣṭirādyāḥ kṣayāntikāḥ // //
analyzed: sarve ye kecid vyāpārāḥ sṛṣṭiḥ ādyāḥ kṣaya antikāḥ
translated: All the operations, beginning with creation and ending with destruction,

original: sa kartā caiva sarveṣā paraṃ brahma sadoditam /
analyzed: sa kartā ca eva sarveṣām param brahma sadā uditam
translated: He is the agent of all, the supreme Brahman, always manifest.

original: caturviṃśati tattvāni puruṣaḥ pañcaviṃśakaḥ // //
analyzed: caturviṃśati tattvāni puruṣaḥ pañcaviṃśakaḥ
translated: The twenty-four principles, and the Purusha is the twenty-fifth.

original: sarveṣāṃ sa hi kartā vai tadā yat tāni tāni tu /
analyzed: sarveṣām sa hi kartā vai tadā yat tāni tāni tu
translated: He is the agent of all those, when they are those.

original: p / sarvaṃ sarvaṃ mayā jñātaṃ sarvaṃ sarvaṃ mayā śrutam /
analyzed: sarvam sarvam mayā jñātam sarvam sarvam mayā śrutam
translated: Everything is known by me, everything is heard by me.

original: na punastāta kauleyaṃ khecarīṇāṃ mukhesthitam // //
analyzed: na punar tāta kauleyam khecarīṇām mukhe sthitam
translated: O son, this Kaula (teaching) is not present in the mouths of the sky-walkers.

original: mahājñānamidaṃ vatsa mahāvijñānameva ca /
analyzed: mahā jñānam idam vatsa mahā vijñānam eva ca
translated: This is the great knowledge, O child, and also the great wisdom,

original: yat tvayā coditaṃ praśnaṃ kaulaṃ khecari gocaram // //
analyzed: yat tvayā coditam praśnam kaulam khecari gocaram  /
translated: which you have asked about, the Kaula that is the domain of the sky-walkers.

original: putra snehāt kathiṣyāmi rahasyamadbhūtopamam /
analyzed: putra snehāt kathiṣyāmi rahasyamat bhūta upamam
translated: Out of affection for my son, I will tell you the secret that is like a miracle.

original: taṃ hi siddhyanti tāsāṃ vai tāstasmiṃstejasā guha // //
analyzed: tam hi tāsām vai tāḥ tasmin tejasā guha
translated: They are accomplished in that, O Guha, and they are energized by him.

original: sāmānyānāṃ tu martyānāṃ lokopahata cetasām /
analyzed: sāmānyānām tu martyānām loka upahata cetasām
translated: But for ordinary mortals whose minds are afflicted by worldly concerns,

original: kuvikalpagatānāṃ vai satyaṃ vatsa na siddhyati // //
analyzed: kuvikalpa gatānām vai satyam vatsa na siddhi ati
translated: and who are subject to false conceptualization, truth is not accomplished, O child.

original: jīvākhyamamṛtaṃ yacca hṛdākāśāntare sthitam /
analyzed: jīva ākhyam amṛtam yat ca hṛd ākāśa antare sthitam
translated: And that nectar called the individual soul which resides in the space of the heart,

original: pibanti rūpikāstaṃ tu nāḍimāśritya madhyamām // //
analyzed: pibanti rūpikāḥ tam tu nāḍim āśritya madhyamām
translated: the goddesses drink that by relying on the central channel.

original: taṃ pītvā tṛpti māyānti atorthaṃ taṃ pibanti hi /
analyzed: tam pītvā tṛpti mā āyānti atortham tam pibanti hi
translated: Having drunk that, they become satisfied, and for that reason they drink it.

original: devān pitṛstarpayanti kulanāḍyāṃsta saṃsthitāḥ // //
analyzed: devān pitṛḥ tarpayanti saṃsthitāḥ
translated: They offer libations to the gods and ancestors who reside in the Kula channel.

original: tāsāṃ mokṣaṃ śivenoktamanena vidhinā guha /
analyzed: tāsām mokṣam śivena uktam anena vidhinā guha
translated: The liberation of those goddesses has been spoken of by Shiva in this way, O Guha.

original: na punarhomahavanairyajñaiśca bahudakṣiṇaiḥ // //
analyzed: na punar homa havanaiḥ yajñaiḥ ca bahu dakṣiṇaiḥ
translated: Not again by oblations, sacrifices, or sacrifices with abundant gifts.

original: māṃsāsthi rudhiraṃ majjāṃ bhakṣayanti ca rūpikāḥ /
analyzed: māṃsa asthi rudhiram majjām bhakṣayanti ca rūpikāḥ
translated: The goddesses consume flesh, bones, blood, and marrow.

original: vivarte hyamṛtaṃ vatsa hṛdisthaṃ yatparaṃ padam // //
analyzed: vivarte hi amṛtam vatsa hṛdistham yat param padam
translated: O child, in the reversal, the nectar that is the supreme state located in the heart.

original: siddhisteṣāṃ tu te naiva tarpayitvā tu bhairavam /
analyzed: siddhiḥ teṣām tu te nā eva tarpayitvā tu bhairavam
translated: But they do not attain success if they do not offer libation to Bhairava.

original: bhairavastarpitaṃ tāsāṃ dharme ca paśuṃ prokṣaṇe // //
analyzed: bhairavaḥ tarpitam tāsām dharme ca paśum prokṣaṇe
translated: Bhairava is satisfied by their libation, and the animal is consecrated in the Dharma.

original: cicchaktiḥ paśavasteṣāṃ hṛnmadhyasaṃsthitā /
analyzed: cit śaktiḥ paśavaḥ teṣām hṛd madhya saṃsthitā
translated: The power of consciousness is the animals, located in the middle of the heart.

original: mokṣaśca nihitaṃ yajñe bhairavokteṣu sarvadā // //
analyzed: mokṣaḥ ca nihitam yajñe bhairava ukteṣu sarvadā
translated: And liberation is hidden in the sacrifice, always spoken by Bhairava.

original: pihitaṃ taṃ tu vijñeyamanyathā vada eva tu /
analyzed: pihitam tam tu vijñeyam anyathā vada eva tu
translated: That should be known as hidden, otherwise it is just spoken.

original: anena vidhinā vatsa hiṃsanti paśavo yadi // //
analyzed: anena vidhinā vatsa hiṃsanti paśavaḥ yadi
translated: O child, if animals are killed according to this method,

original: samuktaḥ paśunāsārdhaṃ mokṣa ityabhidhīyate /
analyzed: samuktaḥ paśunā sārdham mokṣaḥ iti abhidhīyate
translated: They are liberated along with the animal, and that is called liberation.

original: p / siddhyate mahatāṃ siddhiraṣṭasiddhisamanvitā // //
analyzed: siddhyate mahatām siddhiḥ aṣṭa siddhi samanvitā
translated: The great success endowed with the eight accomplishments is attained.

original: sāmānyānāṃ tu siddhīnāṃ koviśeṣosti śakti dhṛt /
analyzed: sāmānyānām tu siddhīnām kaḥ viśeṣaḥ asti śakti
translated: O Bearer of Power, what is the difference between the common accomplishments?

original: kasyedaṃ viditaṃ jñānaṃ jñeyaṃ vijñāna sammitam // //
analyzed: kasya idam viditam jñānam jñeyam vijñāna sammitam
translated: By whom is this knowledge known, which is to be known and equal to knowledge?

original: brahmādyāḥ paśavastasya paśoranyasya kā kathā /
analyzed: brahma ādyāḥ paśavaḥ tasya paśoḥ anyasya kā kathā
translated: Brahma and others are the animals of that animal, what to speak of other animals.

original: paśūnāṃ caiva sarveṣāmādikartā prajāpatiḥ // //
analyzed: paśūnām ca eva sarveṣām ādikartā prajāpatiḥ
translated: And Prajapati is the first creator of all animals.

original: sa eva prokṣito yasmāt tasmāt kaulodhikaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: saḥ eva prokṣitaḥ yasmāt tasmāt kaulodhikam bhavet
translated: Since he alone is consecrated, therefore it should be Kaula.

original: vedayajñeṣu paśavo hiṃsanti brāhmaṇottamāḥ // //
analyzed: veda yajñeṣu paśavaḥ hiṃsanti brāhmaṇa uttamāḥ
translated: In the Vedic sacrifices, the best of Brahmins kill animals.

original: bhairavīyeṣu sarveṣu puṃpaśuṃ hanti sādhakāḥ /
analyzed: bhairavīyeṣu sarveṣu puṃpaśum hanti sādhakāḥ
translated: In all the Bhairava sacrifices, the adepts kill the male animal.

original: sūkṣmapuryaṣṭakaṃ yacca bhūtānāṃ hṛdi saṃsthitam // //
analyzed: sūkṣma puryaṣṭakam yat ca bhūtānām hṛdi saṃsthitam
translated: And the subtle eight-fold body that resides in the hearts of beings,

original: taṃ paśuṃ hanti yoginyo hatvā siddhyanti siddhiṣu /🔽prāṇāpānodaye tasmin bindunāda layaṃ gatāḥ // //
analyzed: tam paśum hanti yoginyaḥ hatvā siddhyanti siddhiṣu  prāṇa apāna udaye tasmin bindu nāda layam gatāḥ
translated: that animal is killed by the yoginis, and by killing it, they attain success in their goals.🔽In the arising of the exhalation and inhalation, which have merged into the bindu and nada,

original: pibanti rūpikāstāstu paśuṃ hatvāśikhidhvaja /
analyzed: pibanti rūpikāḥ tāḥ tu paśum hatvā a śikhidhvaja
translated: those who drink the liquor, O Peacock-bannered One, by killing the animal.

original: gatireṣā hi caiteṣāṃ tadātmetaṃ labhanti hi // //
analyzed: gatiḥ eṣā hi ca eteṣām tad ātmā itam labhanti hi
translated: This is their way, and they attain that self.

original: p / jīvavyomāntaraṃ yacca bhūtānāṃ hṛdisaṃsthitam /
analyzed: jīva vyoma antaram yat ca bhūtānām hṛdisaṃsthitam
translated: And that which is within the space of the individual soul, which resides in the hearts of beings,

original: prāṇāpānapravāhena na viditvā pibanti hi // //
analyzed: prāṇa apāna pravāhena na viditvā pibanti hi
translated: without knowing it through the flow of exhalation and inhalation, they drink.

original: sadyo nirdhānadīrtā / vai mokṣakastu /
analyzed: sadyas nirdhāna dīrtā vai mokṣakaḥ tu
translated: The one who is immediately liberated is the one who is liberated.

original: pibanti yena siddhyarthaṃ vidhinā bhairavena tu /
analyzed: pibanti yena siddhi artham vidhinā bhairavena tu
translated: Those who drink for the sake of success by the method of Bhairava,

original: bhairavoktena vidhinā samyag yoga balena tu // //
analyzed: bhairava uktena vidhinā samyak yoga balena tu
translated: by the method spoken by Bhairava, with the power of proper yoga,

original: pibanti madirāṃ tu kṣīravatprakaṭaṃ guha /
analyzed: pibanti madirām tu kṣīra vat prakaṭam guha
translated: they drink the wine like milk, O Guha.

original: sa siddhaḥ sādhakaḥ sohi śeṣā vai madhyamāḥ smṛtāḥ // //
analyzed: sa siddhaḥ sādhakaḥ saḥ hi śeṣāḥ vai madhyamāḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: He is the successful adept, the rest are remembered as middling.

original: puṣpamātreṇa prāpyenaṃ bahūnāṃ yastu nirvapet /
analyzed: puṣpa mātreṇa prāpya enam bahūnām yaḥ tu nirvapet
translated: He who would offer this to many people with just a flower,

original: kṣīraṃ tu kurute madhyaṃ saṃśaye samupasthite // //
analyzed: kṣīram tu kurute madhyam saṃśaye samupasthite
translated: Milk is the middle, when doubt has arisen.

original: sa siddhaḥ sarvadā vatsa kṛṣṇaḥ śveta karo guha /
analyzed: sa siddhaḥ sarvadā vatsa kṛṣṇaḥ śveta karaḥ guha
translated: O child, he is always successful, Krishna, the white-maker, the secret one,

original: prāṇāpānāntara caronāḍi tritaya yāyinaḥ // //
translated: Moving between the exhaled and inhaled breath, traveling in the three channels,

original: taṃ pibanta mṛtaṃ divyaṃ paraṃ paramasiddhidam /
analyzed: tam pibanta mṛtam divyam param parama siddhi dam
translated: Drinking that divine nectar, the supreme bestower of perfection.

original: p / sauraṃmārgaṃ parityajya cāndraṃ mārgaṃ tathaiva ca // //
analyzed: sauram mārgam parityajya cāndram mārgam tathā eva ca
translated: Abandoning the solar path and the lunar path in the same way,

original: brahmamārga gamaṃ yasya taṃ pibaṃtya mṛtaṃ param //
analyzed: brahma mārga gamam yasya tam mṛtam param
translated: He whose path is the path of Brahman, they drink that supreme nectar.

original: vadame yadi tuṣṭosi iṣṭaṃ tathyaṃ hitaṃ vibho /
analyzed: vadame yadi tuṣṭaḥ asi iṣṭam tathyam hitam vibho
translated: If you are pleased, O Lord, tell me the truth, the desired, the beneficial,

original: yena vijñāta mātreṇa bhrānti jñānaṃ nivartate // //
analyzed: yena vijñāta mātreṇa bhrānti jñānam nivartate
translated: By merely knowing which, deluded knowledge ceases.

original: śṛṇu vatsa yathānyāyyaṃ sarvaprājñottamottama /
analyzed: śṛṇu vatsa yathānyāyyam sarva prājña uttama uttama
translated: Listen, O child, as it is proper, the best of all the wise,

original: yat tvayā coditaṃ praśnaṃ nissandigdhaṃ vadāmyaham // //
analyzed: yat tvayā coditam praśnam nissandigdham vadāmi aham
translated: I will tell you the question that you have asked, without doubt.

original: yā sā śaktiḥ parāsūkṣmā avyaktā yā śivorthayā /🔽saṃsthitā sarvabhūteṣu jagadurddhraṃ / yayākhilam // //
analyzed: yā sā śaktiḥ avyaktā yā  saṃsthitā sarva bhūteṣu jagat urddhram yayā akhilam
translated: That supreme, subtle power, the unmanifest one, by which Śiva,🔽The entire universe is upheld, in all beings,

original: brahmādi stambha paryantaṃ bhūtasargaṃ carācaram /
analyzed: brahma ādi stambha paryantam bhūta sargam carācaram
translated: From Brahmā to a stump, the creation of beings, moving and unmoving,

original: grasate sṛjate śaktiśśivājñā jñāpitā guha // //
analyzed: grasate sṛjate śaktiḥ śiva ājñā jñāpitā guha
translated: O Guha, the power, impelled by Shiva's command, devours and creates.

original: na punaḥ śaktirasmākaṃ satyaṃ satyaṃ śikhidhvaja /
analyzed: na punar śaktiḥ asmākam satyam satyam śikhidhvaja
translated: But, O Shikhidhvaja, the power is not destroyed. Truth, truth, I speak.

original: vayaṃ pitāmahaṃ viṣṇuṃ na bīndvanalameva ca // //
analyzed: vayam pitāmaham viṣṇum na bīndu analam eva ca
translated: We are not the grandfather, Vishnu, the drop, or the fire.

original: indrādyā devatāḥ sarve satvādyāśca maharṣayaḥ /
analyzed: indra ādyāḥ devatāḥ sarve satva ādyāḥ ca mahā ṛṣayaḥ
translated: Indra and all the other gods, and the great sages beginning with Satva,

original: bhūyo bhūyo hi jāyante bhūyo bhūyo mriyanti ca // //
analyzed: bhūyas bhūyas hi jāyante bhūyas bhūyas mriyanti ca
translated: Are born again and again, and die again and again.

original: na punaḥ śakti saṃhāro bhavatiha kadācana /🔽śaktirna lupyate sā vai paramādvaita vartinī // //
analyzed: na punar saṃhāraḥ bhavati ha kadācana  śaktiḥ na lupyate sā vai parama advaita vartinī
translated: But the withdrawal of power never happens at any time.🔽That power is not destroyed, abiding in the supreme non-dual state.

original: nityoditā tu sā sūkṣmā śivāmṛtasamudbhavā /
analyzed: nitya uditā tu sā sūkṣmā śiva amṛta samudbhavā
translated: It is ever-shining, subtle, born from Shiva's nectar.

original: yayāvyāptamidaṃ viśvaṃ bhūtasargaṃ carācaram // //
analyzed: yayā avyāptam idam viśvam bhūta sargam carācaram
translated: By which this universe, the creation of beings, moving and unmoving, is pervaded.

original: antargatā tu sā vatsa sarveṣāṃ hṛdi saṃsthitā /
analyzed: antargatā tu sā vatsa sarveṣām hṛdi saṃsthitā
translated: It is present within all, dwelling in the heart of all.

original: ekaikaṃ maṇimāśritya yathāviddhyanti vedhakāḥ // //
analyzed: ekaikam maṇim āśritya yathāvid hi anti vedhakāḥ
translated: Just as the piercers pierce the gems one by one,

original: mahābhūtāni vai tadvacchaktibodhena bodhitā /
analyzed: mahābhūtāni vai tadvat śakti bodhena bodhitā
translated: In the same way, the great elements are awakened by the awakening of power.

original: sūtraṃ tāsāṃ śivaṃ sākṣāt tena te grathitā guha // //
analyzed: sūtram tāsām śivam sākṣāt tena te grathitāḥ guha
translated: The thread of them is Shiva himself, by which they are strung, O Guha.

original: p / yairvyāptamakhilaṃ viśvaṃ brahmāṇḍāvadhi gocaram /
analyzed: yaiḥ vyāptam akhilam viśvam brahmāṇḍa avadhi gocaram
translated: By which the entire universe is pervaded up to the sphere of the cosmic egg,

original: mahābhūtāni sarvāṇi sarve cicchakti sambhavāḥ // //
analyzed: mahābhūtāni sarvāṇi sarve cicchakti sambhavāḥ
translated: All the great elements are born from the power of consciousness.

original: cicchaktiśśivasambhūtā avyaktāḥ sarvataḥ sthitāḥ /
analyzed: cit śaktiḥ śiva sambhūtā avyaktāḥ sarvatas sthitāḥ
translated: The power of consciousness is born from Shiva, unmanifest, and present everywhere.

original: na hi jānanti tāṃ mūḍhā mahāmāyā vimohitāḥ // //
analyzed: na hi jānanti tām mūḍhāḥ mahā māyāḥ vimohitāḥ
translated: The deluded ones, deluded by the great illusion, do not know it.

original: na kaścidapi taṃ bhūtaṃ yasya sā hṛdi na sthitā /
analyzed: na kaścid api tam bhūtam yasya sā hṛdi na sthitā
translated: No one has that element in his heart.

original: sthitā sā agni rūpeṇa sarvatra vāyunāśritā // //
analyzed: sthitā sā agni rūpeṇa sarvatra vāyunā āśritā
translated: It resides in the form of fire, supported by the wind everywhere.

original: te paśyanti hitāvatsa yeṣāṃ jñānaṃ munirmalam /
analyzed: te paśyanti hitā vat sa yeṣām jñānam muniḥ malam
translated: Those who have pure knowledge, they see it.

original: brahmaveśma bhaved dehaṃ jñānaṃ tatraiva dīpakam // //
analyzed: brahma veśma bhavet deham jñānam tatra eva dīpakam
translated: The body is the abode of Brahman, and knowledge is the lamp there.

original: taṃ prajvālya prapaśyanti yatkiñcidveśmamadhyagam /
analyzed: tam prajvālya prapaśyanti yat kiñcid veśma madhya gam
translated: Having kindled it, they see whatever is in the middle of the house.

original: taṃ dṛṣṭyā te gamiṣyanti ajanma padamavyayam // //
analyzed: tam dṛṣṭyā te gamiṣyanti ajanma padam avyayam
translated: Having seen it, they will attain the unborn, imperishable state.

original: ajā sā amalā sūkṣmā nityoditā sunirmalā /
analyzed: ajā sā amalā sūkṣmā nitya uditā su nirmalā
translated: That unborn, stainless, subtle, ever-shining, very pure,

original: saṃsthitā sarvabhūtānāṃ brahmādīnāṃ śikhidhvaja // //
analyzed: saṃsthitā sarva bhūtānām brahma ādīnām śikhidhvaja
translated: resides in all beings, O Shikhidhvaja, beginning with Brahma.

original: p / yairjñātāste vimuktā vai te baddhā yantra lakṣitāḥ /
analyzed: yaiḥ jñātāḥ te vimuktāḥ vai te baddhāḥ yantra lakṣitāḥ
translated: Those who have known it are liberated, they are bound, marked by the machine.

original: vayaṃ brahmādibhissārdhaṃ naiva muktāḥ śikhidhvaja // //
analyzed: vayam brahma ādibhiḥ sārdham na eva muktāḥ śikhidhvaja
translated: We, along with Brahma and others, are not liberated, O Shikhidhvaja.

original: tadā dhyānāvasakrā vai tasya dhyāna parāyaṇāḥ /
analyzed: tadā dhyānāvasakrā vai tasya dhyāna parāyaṇāḥ
translated: Then, absorbed in meditation, devoted to his meditation,

original: anyepi yoginaḥ sarve makṣamārgānu kāṅkṣiṇaḥ // //
analyzed: anye api yoginaḥ sarve makṣa mārga anu kāṅkṣiṇaḥ  /
translated: Other yogis also, all desiring the path of liberation,

original: yajanti vividhairyajñaistanmadhyāduditaṃ guha /
analyzed: yajanti vividhaiḥ yajñaiḥ tad madhyāt uditam guha
translated: Worship with various sacrifices, O Guha, arisen from that.

original: kāraṇaṃ tatra vai hyekaṃ yukti bhedaḥ pṛthak pṛthak // //
analyzed: kāraṇam tatra vai hi ekam yukti bhedaḥ pṛthak pṛthak
translated: There, the cause is indeed one, the division of reasoning is separate for each.

original: sātvikaṃ yeṣu vai yogaṃ teṣāṃ mokṣo bhaveddhruvam /
analyzed: sātvikam yeṣu vai yogam teṣām mokṣaḥ bhavet dhruvam
translated: In those where there is Sāttvika yoga, for them liberation is certainly attained.

original: rājasaṃ svargakāmānāṃ nārakaṃ tamasā vṛtam // //
analyzed: rājasam svarga kāmānām nārakam tamasā vṛtam
translated: The Rājasa is for those desiring heaven, the Tāmasa is enveloped in darkness leading to hell.

original: sātvikaṃ caiva tairyaṣṭaṃ tadā te mokṣa yāyinaḥ /
analyzed: sātvikam ca eva taiḥ yaṣṭam tadā te mokṣa yāyinaḥ
translated: And when they are worshipped with Sāttvika, then they go to liberation.

original: rājasaṃ mānuṣairvatsa svargā vāpti phalapradam // //
analyzed: rājasam mānuṣaiḥ vatsa svargāḥ phala pradam
translated: The Rājasa, O child, performed by humans, gives the fruit of attaining heaven.

original: tāmasaṃ tiryagyonisthairmūḍhairajñairapaṇḍitaiḥ /
analyzed: tāmasam tiryagyoni sthaiḥ mūḍhaiḥ ajñaiḥ apaṇḍitaiḥ
translated: The Tāmasa is performed by those born as animals, by the foolish, the ignorant, the unlearned.

original: tasmāt sarvaprayatnena sātvikaṃ yāgamārabhet // //
analyzed: tasmāt sarva prayatnena sātvikam yāgam ārabhet
translated: Therefore, with all effort, one should undertake the Sāttvika sacrifice.

original: rājasaṃ tāmasaṃ vatsa punarāvṛtti kārakam /
analyzed: rājasam tāmasam vatsa punarāvṛtti kārakam
translated: The Rājasa and Tāmasa, O child, cause rebirth.

original: p / sātvikaṃ mānasaṃ yāgaṃ tatra hiṃsā na vidyate // //
analyzed: sātvikam mānasam yāgam tatra hiṃsā na vidyate  /
translated: The mental sacrifice is Sāttvika, in it there is no violence.

original: rājasaṃ tāmasaṃ vatsa ubhautau hiṃsa pūrvakau /
analyzed: rājasam tāmasam vatsa ubhau tau hiṃsa pūrvakau
translated: The Rājasa and Tāmasa, O child, both have violence as a precursor.

original: mānase naiva yāgena ye yajanti sadāśivam // //
analyzed: mānase nā eva yāgena ye yajanti sadāśivam
translated: Those who always worship Sadāśiva with the mental sacrifice alone,

original: te muktāḥ sarvapāpebhyaḥ satyaṃ satyamupāsuta /
analyzed: te muktāḥ sarva pāpebhyaḥ satyam satyam upāsuta
translated: They are liberated from all sins, it is true, it is the truth, O disciple.

original: dravyaśuddhistu paramaṃ sambhāraṃ yeṣu krīyate // //
analyzed: dravya śuddhiḥ tu paramam sambhāram yeṣu krīyate
translated: The purification of substances is the supreme collection in which it is performed.

original: tāṃ vicāraya yatnena sātvikaṃ bhavate yadi /
analyzed: tām vicāraya yatnena sātvikam bhavate yadi
translated: Contemplate that carefully, if it becomes Sattva,

original: tadā taṃ dravya sambhāraṃ śuddho bhavati ṣaṇmukha // //
analyzed: tadā tam dravya sambhāram śuddhaḥ bhavati ṣaṇmukha
translated: then that collected substance becomes pure, O Six-faced One.

original: rājasaṃ tāmasaṃ dravyamaśuddhaṃ sarvadā gamaiḥ /
analyzed: rājasam tāmasam dravyam aśuddham sarvadā gamaiḥ
translated: Rajas and Tamas substances are always impure for the knowers of the Vedas.

original: yaṣṭaṃ hi nirmalaṃ tena pratyutatṛṇavadbhavet // //
analyzed: yaṣṭam hi nirmalam tena pratyuta tṛṇa vat bhavet
translated: When offered, it becomes like a straw, due to its impurity.

original: sātvikaṃ nāsti tad dravyaṃ triṣu lokeṣu sarvadā /
analyzed: sātvikam nā asti tat dravyam triṣu lokeṣu sarvadā
translated: There is no such substance that is always Sattva in the three worlds.

original: tadarthaṃ na vimuktāste ye yajanti sadā dhanaiḥ // //
analyzed: tad artham na vimuktāḥ te ye yajanti sadā dhanaiḥ
translated: Therefore, those who always worship with wealth are not liberated.

original: athavā sātvikaṃ cārthaṃ yadi labhet kathañcana /
analyzed: athavā sātvikam ca artham yadi labhet kathañcana
translated: Or, if one somehow obtains a Sattva substance,

original: p / tad deyaṃ devagurave vipre vā brahmavādine // //
analyzed: tat deyam deva gurave vipre vā brahma vādine  /
translated: that should be given to a deity, a Guru, or a Brahmin who speaks about Brahman.

original: anantaṃ ca asaṅkhyeyaṃ svalpamātre paśoditam /
analyzed: anantam ca asaṅkhyeyam su alpa mātre
translated: The infinite and innumerable are indicated in a small quantity of that.

original: akṣayyaṃ bhavate vatsa kalpakoṭi śatairapi // //
analyzed: akṣayyam bhavate vatsa kalpa koṭi śataiḥ api
translated: O child, it becomes inexhaustible even for hundreds of crores of kalpas.

original: sambhārārthaṃ na tad dravyaṃ prayuñjīta kadācana /
analyzed: sambhāra artham na tat dravyam prayuñjīta kadācana
translated: That substance should never be used for the purpose of collection.

original: saṃbhārā ye bahirkecit sarve cicchakti sambhavāḥ // //
analyzed: saṃbhārāḥ ye bahis kecid sarve cicchakti sambhavāḥ
translated: The collections that are external are all born from the power of consciousness.

original: teṣāṃ bādhā bhaved yasmāt tasmāt tāṃ parivarjayet /
analyzed: teṣām bādhā bhavet yasmāt tasmāt tām parivarjayet
translated: Since there would be obstruction to them, therefore one should avoid them.

original: sa jīvāni tu te sarve śivaṃ teṣāṃ hṛdi sthitam // //
analyzed: sa jīvāni tu te sarve śivam teṣām hṛdi sthitam
translated: All those living beings, that auspiciousness resides in their hearts.

original: sa jīvāni tu puṣpāṇi sa jīvāni phalāni ca /
analyzed: sa jīvāni tu puṣpāṇi sa jīvāni phalāni ca
translated: Those flowers are living, those fruits are living.

original: sa jīvāḥ paśavo jñeyāstarujātīnisarvaśaḥ // //
analyzed: sa jīvāḥ paśavaḥ jñeyāḥ taru jātīni sarvaśas
translated: Those animals should be known as living, and all the trees.

original: tāṃ tyaktvā yajasekastvaṃktayāgamaghasiddhimān /
analyzed: tām tyaktvā yajasekaḥ tu aṃkta yāgam agha siddhimān
translated: Having abandoned them, you worship, with that sacrifice you will attain success in destroying sin.

original: ye sthitāḥ phalasandho / vaśyākarṣaṇamāraṇaiḥ // //
analyzed: ye sthitāḥ phala sandho vaśyā ākarṣaṇa māraṇaiḥ   /
translated: Those who are engaged in the attainment of fruits, in subjugation, attraction, and killing,

original: te yajanti sa jīvaistu jīvaiścicchakti sambhavaiḥ /
analyzed: te yajanti sa jīvaiḥ tu jīvaiḥ cicchakti sambhavaiḥ
translated: They worship with living beings, with living beings born from the power of consciousness.

original: p / caturdaśavidhaṃ vatsa bhūtasargaṃ carācaram // //
analyzed: caturdaśavidham vatsa bhūta sargam carācaram
translated: O child, the fourteen kinds of creation of beings, the moving and unmoving,

original: sarvaṃ cicchaktisaṃbhūtaṃ taṃ hatvā naiva mucyate //
analyzed: sarvam cicchakti saṃbhūtam tam hatvā na eva mucyate
translated: All are born from the power of consciousness. By killing them, one is not liberated.

original: śaktyodayaṃ mayājñātaṃ dravyaśuddhivinirṇayam /
analyzed: śaktyā udayam mayā ajñātam dravya śuddhi vinirṇayam
translated: I have understood the arising of the power, the determination of the purification of substances.

original: adhunā śrotumicchāmi iṣṭamiṣṭoturottaram // //
analyzed: adhunā śrotum icchāmi
translated: Now I wish to hear the reply to the question asked by the worshipper.

original: mayātīrṇaṃ tapaścograṃ yugakalpānyanekaśaḥ /
analyzed: mayā ātīrṇam tapaḥ ca ugram yuga kalpāni anekaśas
translated: I have practiced severe austerities for many yugas and kalpas.

original: tadā sa tuṣṭo bhagavāñśivopyaśivahāparaḥ // //
analyzed: tadā sa tuṣṭaḥ bhagavān śivaḥ upi aśiva hā paraḥ
translated: Then the Blessed One Shiva, the destroyer of what is inauspicious, was pleased.

original: vadate vadame cādya tuṣṭohaṃ te umāpatiḥ /
analyzed: vadate ca adya tuṣṭaḥ ham te umāpatiḥ
translated: He said, Today I am pleased with you, O Uma's consort. I will grant you a boon.

original: ahiṃsā sarvabhūteṣu careṣu hyacareṣu ca // //
analyzed: ahiṃsā sarva bhūteṣu careṣu hi acareṣu ca
translated: Non-violence towards all beings, moving and unmoving.

original: etaddhi cāmṛtaṃ vatsa akṣaraṃ hyakṣaraṃ dhruvam /
analyzed: etat hi ca amṛtam vatsa akṣaram hi akṣaram dhruvam
translated: O child, this is the nectar, the imperishable, the eternal syllable.

original: hiṃsākṣaraṃ vijānīyāt tasmāt taṃ parivarjayet // //🔽atorthaṃ mānusaṃ yāgamakṣaraṃ hyamṛtaṃ guha /
analyzed: hiṃsā akṣaram vijānīyāt tasmāt tam parivarjayet  atortham mānusam yāgam akṣaram hi amṛtam guha
translated: One should know the syllable of violence, therefore one should avoid it.🔽For this purpose, O Guha, the human sacrifice is the imperishable nectar.

original: ye yajanti hitaṃ vatsa te muktā bhavabandhanāt // //
analyzed: ye yajanti hitam vatsa te muktāḥ bhava bandhanāt
translated: O child, those who worship it are liberated from the bondage of worldly existence.

original: vayaṃ bhogābhilāṣeṇa naivamuktāḥ śikhidhvaja /
analyzed: vayam bhoga abhilāṣeṇa nā evam uktāḥ śikhidhvaja
translated: We are not liberated by desiring enjoyments, O Shikhidhvaja.

original: ajñānādupadeśasya śivajñāna bahiṣkṛtaḥ // //
analyzed: ajñānāt upadeśasya śivajñāna bahiṣkṛtaḥ
translated: Excluded from the knowledge of Shiva due to ignorance of the teachings.

original: tadānu viditaṃ tattvaṃ mokṣamārgāvalambinam /
analyzed: tadā anu viditam tattvam mokṣa mārga avalambinam
translated: Then, having known the truth that relies on the path of liberation,

original: niṣprapañcaṃ paraṃ tatvamaparaṃ tu parāparam // //
analyzed: niṣprapañcam param tatvam aparam tu parāparam
translated: The highest truth is free from conceptual elaboration, but the lower one is both supreme and inferior.

original: niṣprapañcā parāśaktirniṣprapañcaḥ paraḥ śivaḥ /
analyzed: niṣprapañcā parāśaktiḥ niṣprapañcaḥ paraḥ śivaḥ
translated: The supreme power is free from conceptual elaboration, the supreme Shiva is free from conceptual elaboration.

original: tasya yāgaṃ ca kurvīta niṣprapañcaṃ hi mānusam // //
analyzed: tasya yāgam ca kurvīta niṣprapañcam hi mānusam
translated: One should perform his sacrifice, which is free from conceptual elaboration and human.

original: snānaṃ dhyānaṃ tathā pūjā japaṃ homaṃ tu pañcamam /
analyzed: snānam dhyānam tathā pūjā japam homam tu pañcamam
translated: Bath, meditation, worship, japa, and homa as the fifth,

original: manasai tāni kartavyaṃ vidhidṛṣṭena karmaṇā // //
analyzed: manasā tāni kartavyam vidhi dṛṣṭena karmaṇā
translated: These should be done mentally with rites seen in the scriptures.

original: iti śrī //
analyzed: iti śrī
translated: Thus ends the chapter on the human sacrifice.

original: snānādikaṃ tvayaivoktaṃ pūrvaṃ vai mānasaṃ vibho /
analyzed: snāna ādikam tvayā eva uktam pūrvam vai mānasam vibho
translated: O Lord, you have previously spoken of mental bath etc.

original: tadahaṃ śrotumicchāmi yathārthaṃ tadbravīhi me // //
analyzed: tat aham śrotum icchāmi yathārtham tat bravīhi me
translated: I wish to hear that, please tell me the truth about it.

original: śivatīrthaṃ sthitaṃ dehe sarvatīrthālāṃ hitam /
analyzed: śivatīrtham sthitam dehe hitam
translated: The auspicious tirtha of Shiva exists in the body, surpassing all other tirthas.

original: bhurloke tu bhuvo loke svarloke tu tathaiva ca // //
analyzed: bhurloke tu bhuvar loke svarloke tu tathā eva ca
translated: In the world of earth, in the world of Bhuva, and likewise in the world of heaven,

original: gaṅgādyāḥ saritaḥ sarvāḥ kṣīrodādyāśca sāgarāḥ /
analyzed: gaṅgā ādyāḥ saritaḥ sarvāḥ kṣīroda ādyāḥ ca sāgarāḥ
translated: all the rivers beginning with Ganga, and all the oceans beginning with the Milk Ocean,

original: sarve tiṣṭhanti tatraiva mānase tvakhilā guha // //
analyzed: sarve tiṣṭhanti tatra eva mānase tu akhilāḥ guha
translated: all of them exist there only, O Guha, in the mind.

original: hṛt puṇḍarīka madhyasthaṃ śivatīrthaṃ tu mānasam /
analyzed: hṛd puṇḍarīka madhya stham śivatīrtham tu mānasam
translated: The mental tirtha of Shiva is situated in the middle of the lotus of the heart.

original: tatrasthaṃ saṅgamaṃ vatsa śivaṃ nādātmakaṃ śubham // //
analyzed: tatrastham saṅgamam vatsa śivam nāda ātmakam śubham
translated: O child, the auspicious union of Shiva and Nada exists there.

original: agnīṣomīyagahanaṃ pāṇāpānajalāśayam /
analyzed: agnīṣomīya gahanam pāṇa apāna jalāśayam
translated: The deep connection between Agni and Soma is the abode of the waters of Prana and Apana.

original: pravāhaṃ tasya tīrthasya suṣumṇāḍyāntare sthitam // //
analyzed: pravāham tasya tīrthasya suṣumṇā āḍyā antare sthitam
translated: The flow of that tirtha is situated within the Suṣumnā nerve.

original: p / turyasthānāmṛtaughena plāvitaśca samantataḥ /
analyzed: turya sthāna amṛta oghena plāvitaḥ ca samantataḥ
translated: And it is flooded all around with the stream of nectar of the turiya state.

original: na cātra vighnā hiṃsanti duṣṭā ye vai carācare // //
analyzed: na ca atra vighnāḥ hiṃsanti duṣṭāḥ ye vai carācare
translated: And here the obstacles, the evil ones, do not harm the moving and unmoving.

original: tadā snānaṃ śubhaṃ tatra śivatīrthe ca mānase /
analyzed: tadā snānam śubham tatra śivatīrthe ca mānase
translated: Then the auspicious bath is there in the mental tirtha of Shiva.

original: nā cātra hiṃsā dṛśyeta na tu pītvā karaṃ tathā // //
analyzed: ca atra hiṃsā dṛśyeta na tu pītvā karam tathā
translated: And here no harm is seen, nor is any hand to be seen.

original: carācaresmin ye lokāḥ puṇyanyāyatanāni ca /
analyzed: carācare ismin ye lokāḥ puṇya nyāyatanāni ca
translated: And those worlds in this moving and unmoving, and the holy places of merit,

original: tepi tiṣṭanti cāteva ātmaśuddhyartha kāraṇam // //
analyzed: te api tiṣṭanti cātā iva ātma śuddhi artha kāraṇam
translated: they also exist there, for the sake of purifying the self.

original: bāhyatīrthāni sarvāṇi kalpanākalpitāni tu /
analyzed: bāhya tīrthāni sarvāṇi kalpanā kalpitāni tu
translated: All external holy places are imagined and conceptualized.

original: śivatīrthena tiṣṭhanti mānase aśivāpahe // //
analyzed: śiva tīrthena tiṣṭhanti mānase aśiva apahe  /
translated: They exist with the Shivatirtha, which removes the inauspiciousness in the mind.

original: kalpitā ye bahiṣkāni tīrthānyāyatanāni ca /
analyzed: kalpitāḥ ye bahiṣkāni tīrthāni āyatanāni ca
translated: The external holy places and temples that are imagined

original: uttaptāste sadā vighnairdivyabhaumāntarikṣagaiḥ // //
analyzed: uttaptāḥ te sadā vighnaiḥ divya bhauma āntarikṣa gaiḥ
translated: are always heated by obstacles from the divine, earthly, and aerial beings.

original: tasmāt te dūṣitā vatsa śivatīrthena kena cit /
analyzed: tasmāt te dūṣitāḥ vatsa śiva tīrthena kena cit
translated: Therefore, O child, they are defiled by someone with the Shivatirtha.

original: anorthādbāhyatīrthāni varjitāni sadā guha // //
analyzed: anorthāt bāhya tīrthāni varjitāni sadā guha
translated: O Guha, the external holy places are always avoided for the sake of non-meaning.

original: p / uccāṭane tu vighnānāṃ hiṃsā bhavati vai tadā /
analyzed: uccāṭane tu vighnānām hiṃsā bhavati vai tadā
translated: In the case of expulsion, there is harm to the obstacles then.

original: yasmād bādhā bhavet teṣāṃ tasmāt tāstu vivarjayet // //
analyzed: yasmāt bādhā bhavet teṣām tasmāt tāḥ tu vivarjayet
translated: Since there would be obstruction to them, therefore one should avoid them.

original: nirmalaṃ vighna rahitaṃ mohadaṃ tu aghāpaham /
analyzed: nirmalam vighna rahitam moha dam tu agha apaham
translated: Pure, free from obstacles, causing delusion, removing sin,

original: amṛtaṃ sravate nityaṃ piṅgalābhyantare sthitam // //🔽sauṣumṇā nanda gambhīraṃ turyā tu prāntagocaram /
analyzed: amṛtam sravate nityam piṅgala abhyantare sthitam  sauṣumṇā nanda gambhīram turyā tu prānta gocaram
translated: nectar always flows within Pingala.🔽The Suṣumnā is blissful, profound, and the fourth is the sphere of the end.

original: svarṇopalabdhi vimalaṃ sā nandaṃ nandaśītalam // //
analyzed: svarṇa upalabdhi vimalam sā nandam nanda śītalam
translated: The perception of gold is pure, that bliss is cool like the moon.

original: taṃ labdhā śivatīrthaṃ vai ātmano hṛdi saṃsthitam /
analyzed: tam labdhā śivatīrtham vai ātmanaḥ hṛdi saṃsthitam
translated: Having attained that Shivatirtha, which resides in one's own heart,

original: tasmin snānaṃ sadā kuryād vidhi dṛṣṭena karmaṇā // //
analyzed: tasmin snānam sadā kuryāt vidhi dṛṣṭena karmaṇā  /
translated: one should always bathe in it with the rites seen in the scriptures.

original: sandhyā tu vandayet tatra tarpayet pitṛ devatāḥ /
analyzed: sandhyā tu vandayet tatra tarpayet pitṛ devatāḥ
translated: One should worship the Sandhya there and offer libations to the ancestors and gods.

original: yat kiñciditi kartavyaṃ tat sarvaṃ mānasaṃ kuru // //
analyzed: yat kiñcid iti kartavyam tat sarvam mānasam kuru  /
translated: Whatever is to be done, one should do it all mentally.

original: athavā smaryate tīrthaṃ yat kiñcin manasepsitam /
analyzed: athavā smaryate tīrtham yat kiñcid manasā īpsitam
translated: Or, whatever sacred place is remembered, whatever is desired by the mind,

original: sarve tiṣṭhanti cātraiva ahiṃsā tu samarpitāḥ // //
analyzed: sarve tiṣṭhanti ca atra eva ahiṃsā tu samarpitāḥ
translated: All of them are present here, with non-violence offered.

original: p / vayaṃ brahmādibhiḥ sārdhaṃ śivatīrthāmbu sevanāt /
analyzed: vayam brahma ādibhiḥ sārdham śiva tīrtha ambu sevanāt
translated: We, along with Brahma and others, by serving the water of Shiva's tirtha,

original: etaddhi paramaṃ tīrthamayaṃ hi paramo japaḥ // //
analyzed: etat hi paramam tīrtham ayam hi paramaḥ japaḥ
translated: This is the supreme sacred place, this is the supreme mantra.

original: etaddhi paramaṃ snānaṃ tatra snānaṃ tu vai guha /
analyzed: etat hi paramam snānam tatra snānam tu vai guha
translated: This is the supreme bath, O Guha, the bath there.

original: bāhyatīrthāni tuṣṭāni mantrān bāhyāṃstu sarvaśaḥ // //
analyzed: bāhya tīrthāni tuṣṭāni mantrān bāhyān tu sarvaśas
translated: The external sacred places are satisfied, and all the external mantras.

original: mantrā hṛṣṭāni tuṣyanti anyathā jala eva saḥ /
analyzed: mantrā hṛṣṭāni tuṣyanti anyathā jala eva saḥ
translated: The mantras are satisfied when pleased, otherwise it is just water.

original: tīrtheṣu ye sthitāḥ keciddīnādyāḥ prāṇino guha // //
analyzed: tīrtheṣu ye sthitāḥ kecid dīna ādyāḥ prāṇinaḥ guha
translated: O Guha, those beings who are present in the sacred places, the poor and others,

original: atorthāstena muñcanti vijñāna rahitāstu ye /
analyzed: atorthāḥ tena muñcanti vijñāna rahitāḥ tu ye
translated: Therefore, they are released by that, but those who are devoid of knowledge.

original: śivatīrthaparijñānātsamyagyoga balena tu // //
analyzed: śiva tīrtha parijñānāt samyak yoga balena tu
translated: By the knowledge of Shiva's tirtha, by the power of perfect yoga,

original: snāto bhavati taṃ nityaṃ sādhakaḥ su samāhitaḥ /
analyzed: snātaḥ bhavati tam nityam sādhakaḥ su samāhitaḥ
translated: The practitioner, well concentrated, always becomes bathed in that.

original: na cātra hiṃsate kaścin na tilāndarbha eva ca // //
analyzed: na ca atra hiṃsate kaścid na tilān darbhe eva ca
translated: And here no one injures, nor sesame seeds or even darbha grass.

original: na tu rau /pya suvarṇe vā khaḍgā pātotha vā punaḥ /
analyzed: na tu raupya suvarṇe vā khaḍgā vā punar
translated: But in gold or in a sword, the fall is not the same.

original: smaraṇā cchivatīrthasya na kiñcidapi lupyate // //
analyzed: smaraṇāt śivatīrthasya na kiñcid api lupyate
translated: And by remembering the holy place of Shiva, nothing is lost at all.

original: p / śivatīrthaṃ mayā jñātaṃ tasmin sthāne yathoditam /
analyzed: śiva tīrtham mayā jñātam tasmin sthāne yathā uditam
translated: I have known the holy place of Shiva in that place as described.

original: bhūyo vijñātumicchāmi dhyānaṃ deheśvarātmakam // //
analyzed: bhūyas vijñātum icchāmi dhyānam deha īśvara ātmakam
translated: I wish to know again the meditation consisting of the body and the lord of the body.

original: sarvaṃ pratyakṣa vijñānaṃ mayā te prakaṭī kṛtam /
analyzed: sarvam pratyakṣa vijñānam mayā te prakaṭīkṛtam
translated: I have revealed to you all the direct knowledge.

original: pratyakṣaṃ ca parokṣaṃ ca adhunā darśayāmite // //
analyzed: pratyakṣam ca parokṣam ca adhunā darśayāmi te
translated: Now I will show you both the direct and the indirect.

original: śivatīrtha parijñānaṃ yairjñātaṃ hyātma darśibhiḥ /
analyzed: śiva tīrtha parijñānam yaiḥ jñātam hi ātma darśibhiḥ
translated: Those who have known the knowledge of the holy place of Shiva, the seers of the self,

original: taiḥ prāpyamakhilaṃ vatsa mokṣamārgaṃ na saṃśayaḥ // //
analyzed: taiḥ prāpyam akhilam vatsa mokṣa mārgam na saṃśayaḥ
translated: By them, O child, the entire path of liberation is attained, there is no doubt.

original: ātmajñāne sthitā ye vai ātmajñāścātma darśinaḥ /
analyzed: ātma jñāne sthitāḥ ye vai ātma jñāḥ ca ātma darśinaḥ
translated: Those who abide in the knowledge of the self, who know the self, who see the self,

original: taiḥ śuddhāḥ sarvadā vatsa yatra yatrāśrame sthitāḥ // //
analyzed: taiḥ śuddhāḥ sarvadā vatsa yatra yatra āśrame sthitāḥ  /
translated: They are always pure, O child, wherever they may be in the hermitage.

original: snāna śuddhirna teṣāṃ vai na mantraiśca prayojanam /
analyzed: snāna śuddhiḥ na teṣām vai na mantraiḥ ca prayojanam
translated: They have no need for purification by bathing, nor for mantras.

original: p / sa tu mantraṃ śivaṃ śāstraṃ kṣetraṃ hi paramaṃ tu saḥ // //
analyzed: sa tu mantram śivam śāstram kṣetram hi paramam tu saḥ
translated: But that is the mantra, that is the auspicious scripture, that is the highest holy place.

original: na tasya vighnā hiṃsanti ye kecidbhuvana traye /
analyzed: na tasya vighnāḥ hiṃsanti ye kecid bhuvana traye
translated: No obstacles can harm him, whatever they may be in the three worlds.

original: darśanādeva vai tasya naśyante ca diśo daśa // //
analyzed: darśanāt eva vai tasya naśyante ca diśaḥ daśa
translated: By merely seeing it, the ten directions are destroyed.

original: na diśo vidiśaścaiva na mudrā nāsanāni ca /
analyzed: na diśaḥ vidiśaḥ ca eva na mudrāḥ na āsanāni ca
translated: The directions and intermediate directions, the mudras, and the postures,

original: karaṇena tu saṃpaśyet samyag yoga balena tu // //
analyzed: karaṇena tu saṃpaśyet samyak yoga balena tu
translated: One should contemplate with the instrument, with the power of perfect yoga.

original: pūrakaṃ kumbhakaṃ caiva recakaṃ ca tṛtīyakam /
analyzed: pūrakam kumbhakam ca eva recakam ca tṛtīyakam
translated: Inhalation, retention, and exhalation as the third,

original: etad yathārthaṃ yuñjīta tato dhyānaṃ samārabhet // //
analyzed: etat yathārtham yuñjīta tatas dhyānam samārabhet
translated: One should practice this correctly, and then begin meditation.

original: dhyānenālokayedvatsa dehi sandeha varjitaḥ /
analyzed: dhyānena ālokayet vatsa dehi sandeha varjitaḥ
translated: One should contemplate with meditation, O child, being free from doubt.

original: taṃ vicāraya yatnena nāḍicakrodare sthitam // //
analyzed: tam vicāraya yatnena nāḍi cakra udare sthitam
translated: Contemplate that carefully, situated in the center of the cakra of nāḍīs.

original: dvāsaptati sahasrāṇi ārāṇāṃ tasya ṣaṇmukha /
analyzed: dvāsaptati sahasrāṇi ārāṇām tasya ṣaṇmukha
translated: O Six-faced One, he has seventy-two thousand spokes.

original: ekaika bhramataiṣā vai prāṇāpānāntara sthitā // //
analyzed: ekaika bhramata eṣā vai prāṇa apāna antara sthitā
translated: Each of them revolves, situated between prāṇa and apāna.

original: sarveṣāmeva vāyūnāṃ prāṇāpānau tu codakau /
analyzed: sarveṣām eva vāyūnām prāṇa apānau tu ca udakau
translated: Among all the winds, prāṇa and apāna are the movers.

original: p / prāṇaṃ teṣāṃ bhavet prāṇaṃ praṇamya tu paraṃ viduḥ // //
analyzed: prāṇam teṣām bhavet prāṇam praṇamya tu param viduḥ
translated: The prāṇa of those is the prāṇa; having bowed to that, they know the supreme.

original: tena te nāḍicakraṃ vai samastamavalokayet /🔽piṅgalā tu bhavennābhistasya cakrasya ṣaṇmukha // //
analyzed: tena te nāḍi cakram vai samastam avalokayet  piṅgalā tu bhavet nābhiḥ tasya cakrasya ṣaṇmukha
translated: By that, one should contemplate the entire cakra of nāḍīs.🔽O Six-faced One, the navel is the piṅgalā, of that cakra.

original: praṇavaṃ taṃ bhaveccakraṃ piṅgalā tasya vai śikhā /
analyzed: praṇavam tam bhavet cakram piṅgalā tasya vai śikhā
translated: The syllable OM is that cakra, and the piṅgalā is its flame.

original: taṃ jñātvā paśyate vatsa śivaṃ parama kāraṇam // //
analyzed: tam jñātvā paśyate vatsa śivam parama kāraṇam
translated: O child, having known that, one sees Shiva, the supreme cause.

original: jñānadīpaṃ prajajvālya dhyātvā jñānāgninā guha /
analyzed: jñāna dīpam prajajvālya dhyātvā jñāna agninā guha
translated: Having kindled the lamp of knowledge and contemplated with the fire of knowledge, O Guha,

original: tadā gamya sthitaṃ devaṃ piṅgalābhyantare sthitam // //
analyzed: tadā gamya sthitam devam piṅgala abhyantare sthitam
translated: then one sees the God who resides within the cave of the heart, situated within the inner space of the eyebrows.

original: hṛdguhā sā tu vijñeyā hṛnmadhye sā tu karṇikā /
