analyzed: hṛdguhā sā tu vijñeyā hṛd madhye sā tu karṇikā
translated: That cave of the heart should be known as the pericarp in the middle of the heart.

original: tasya madhye sthitaṃ devaṃ yaḥ paśyati sa paśyati // //
analyzed: tasya madhye sthitam devam yaḥ paśyati sa paśyati  /
translated: He who sees the God situated in its middle, he sees (the truth).

original: sūryendu vahni madhyasthaṃmalakṣaṃ lakṣa varjitam /
analyzed: lakṣa varjitam
translated: Situated in the middle of the sun, moon and fire, free from a hundred thousand (defects), free from a hundred thousand (good qualities),

original: kadambagolakākāraṃ sūryakoṭi samaprabham // //
analyzed: kadamba golaka ākāram sūrya koṭi sama prabham
translated: having the form of a globular Kadamba flower, having the radiance of a crore suns,

original: kalpāntā nalasaṅkāśaṃ duṣprekṣamakṛtātmabhiḥ /
analyzed: kalpa antāḥ nala saṅkāśam duṣprekṣam akṛtātmabhiḥ
translated: having the form of a flame at the end of a Kalpa, difficult to look at by those who have not controlled their minds,

original: p / anumānaṃ na vai tasya hetunā naiva dṛśyate // //
analyzed: anumānam na vai tasya hetunā na eva dṛśyate
translated: reasoning cannot be applied to Him, He is not seen by reason.

original: evaṃ dhyātvā tu taṃ devaṃ hṛdguhābhyantare sthitam /
analyzed: evam dhyātvā tu tam devam hṛd guhā abhyantare sthitam
translated: Having thus contemplated on that God situated in the cave of the heart,

original: tatastvā yatanaṃ gacchenmānusaṃ mānasena tu // //
analyzed: tatas tvā yatanam gacchet mānusam mānasena tu
translated: then one should go to the abode with the mental body.

original: dhyānaṃ dheyaṃ mayā jñātaṃ / naṃ ca jñeyameva ca /
analyzed: dhyānam dheyam mayā jñātam ca jñeyam eva ca
translated: The meditation has been taught by me, and also the knowable.

original: adhunā śrotumicchāmi hṛdguhyeśvara pūjanam // //
analyzed: adhunā śrotum icchāmi hṛd guhya īśvara pūjanam
translated: Now I wish to hear about the worship of the Lord of the Secret Cave of the Heart.

original: guhyāni yāni coktāni ādau / te śikhi vāhana /
analyzed: guhyāni yāni ca uktāni ādau te śikhi vāhana
translated: O Peacock-vehicled One, those secrets that were mentioned at the beginning,

original: idaṃ guhyaṃ tvayaivādya yanna kasyāpi bhāṣitam // //
analyzed: idam guhyam tvayā eva adya yat na kasya api bhāṣitam
translated: This secret has not been spoken to anyone else by you today.

original: ajñā ye ca anātmajña ye ca paṇḍita māvi / /
analyzed: ajñāḥ ye ca anātma jña ye ca paṇḍita
translated: Those who are ignorant and those who are not self-realized, and those who are wise,

original: caitanyaṃ / sa /rvabhūtānāṃ citsvabhāvena saṃsthitam /
analyzed: caitanyam sarva bhūtānām cit svabhāvena saṃsthitam
translated: The consciousness of all beings is established by the nature of consciousness.

original: p / sa cetanāni bhūtāni yasmāt tāneva mohayet // //
analyzed: sa cetanāni bhūtāni yasmāt tān eva mohayet
translated: And since that consciousness would delude those very beings,

original: cicchaktiṃ vindate vatsa mukhaduḥkhe śubhāśubhau /
analyzed: cit śaktim vindate vatsa mukha duḥkhe śubha aśubhau
translated: O child, one attains the power of consciousness, the auspicious and inauspicious in the suffering of the mouth.

original: śivātmā dṛṣṭa rūpeṇa sarvatraiva vyavasthitaḥ // //
analyzed: śiva ātmā dṛṣṭa rūpeṇa sarvatra eva vyavasthitaḥ
translated: The soul of Shiva is seen everywhere in the form of being established.

original: aśubhaṃ ca śubhaṃ caiva sukhaṃ duḥkhaṃ tathaiva ca /
analyzed: aśubham ca śubham ca eva sukham duḥkham tathā eva ca
translated: The supreme power experiences both the inauspicious and the auspicious, happiness and sorrow,🔽And the supreme here is without stain.

original: bhuñjate tu parāśaktiḥ paraṃ cātra alepakam // //🔽sākṣi bhūtaṃ ca taṃ vatsa pakṣayorubhayorapi /
analyzed: bhuñjate tu parā śaktiḥ param ca atra alepakam  sākṣi bhūtam ca tam vatsa pakṣayoḥ ubhayoḥ api
translated: And that, O child, is the witness of both sides.

original: evaṃ jñātvā ahiṃsāṃ vai sarvabhūteṣu kārayet // //
analyzed: evam jñātvā ahiṃsām vai sarva bhūteṣu kārayet
translated: Knowing this, one should practice non-violence towards all beings.

original: atorthaṃ mānasaṃ yāgaṃ kartavyaṃ mokṣayāyibhiḥ /
analyzed: atortham mānasam yāgam kartavyam mokṣa yāyibhiḥ
translated: For this purpose, the mental sacrifice should be performed by those seeking liberation,

original: hiṃsā yuktena yogena sambhāra bahulena ca // //
analyzed: hiṃsā yuktena yogena sambhāra bahulena ca
translated: With a yoga that is accompanied by violence and with many requisites.

original: ye yajanti hite baddhāḥ phalaṃ teṣāṃ triviṣṭapam /
analyzed: ye yajanti hite baddhāḥ phalam teṣām triviṣṭapam
translated: Those who are bound by attachment to the fruits of sacrifice, their reward is heaven.

original: amānāmnā tu yogena hiṃsā bhavati sarvadā // //
analyzed: amā anāmnā tu yogena hiṃsā bhavati sarvadā
translated: But by the yoga of non-attachment, violence always occurs.

original: punarāvartate bhūyo bhūyo bhūyaḥ kṣayaṃ gataḥ /
analyzed: punar āvartate bhūyas bhūyas bhūyas kṣayam gataḥ
translated: Again and again he returns, again and again he goes to destruction.

original: p / evaṃ jñātvā yajet sarvaṃ mānusaṃ yāgamuttamam // //
analyzed: evam jñātvā yajet sarvam mānusam yāgam uttamam
translated: Knowing this, one should worship everything, the supreme human sacrifice.

original: yasya sarvagataṃ bhāvaṃ yathātmani tathāpare /🔽samaṃ paśyati sarveṣāmahiṃsā procyate tu sā // //
analyzed: yasya sarva gatam bhāvam yathā ātmani tathā apare  samam paśyati sarveṣām ahiṃsā procyate tu sā
translated: One who sees the state of all as the same in oneself and others,🔽that is said to be non-violence.

original: yathātmani pare tadvatsamaṃ paśyati yo guha /
analyzed: yathā ātmani pare tadvat samam paśyati yaḥ guha
translated: O Guha, one who sees the same in oneself and others,

original: samuktaḥ prakṛterbandhācchive tiṣṭhati śāśvate // //
analyzed: samuktaḥ prakṛteḥ bandhāt śive tiṣṭhati śāśvate
translated: he is liberated from the bondage of Prakṛti and abides eternally in Śiva.

original: sāttvikaṃ bhāvametaddhi śivenoktaṃ hi mānasam /
analyzed: sāttvikam bhāvam etat hi śivena uktam hi mānasam
translated: This is the Sāttvika state, the mental state spoken of by Śiva.

original: antaḥ karṇādikaṃ vatsa yanmayoktaṃ hi darśane // //
analyzed: antar karṇa ādikam vatsa yat mayā uktam hi darśane
translated: O child, what has been said by me in the vision of the inner ear, etc.

original: teṣu bhūtānu hiṃsanti tasmāt taṃ hiṃsa pūrvakam /
analyzed: teṣu bhūtā anu hiṃsanti tasmāt tam hiṃsa pūrvakam
translated: In them, the elements harm each other, therefore that is preceded by harm.

original: antaḥkaraṇa vinyāsaṃ bhūtaśuddhyartha kāraṇam // //
analyzed: antaḥkaraṇa vinyāsam bhūtaśuddhi artha kāraṇam
translated: The arrangement of the inner organs is the cause for the purification of the elements.

original: krīyate sarvato vatsa vidhi dṛṣṭena karmaṇā /
analyzed: krīyate sarvatas vatsa vidhi dṛṣṭena karmaṇā
translated: O child, it is performed on all sides by the rite seen in the procedure.

original: kṛtvāntaḥ karaṇaṃ vatsa bhūtaśuddhiṃ tathaiva ca // //
analyzed: kṛtvā antar karaṇam vatsa bhūtaśuddhim tathā eva ca
translated: Having done the inner organ, O child, and likewise the purification of the elements,

original: tadā bhavati taṃ yogyaṃ sādhakaḥ śiva pūjane /
analyzed: tadā bhavati tam yogyam sādhakaḥ śiva pūjane
translated: then he becomes fit for the worshipper to worship Śiva.

original: p / ātmajñaṃ tu punarvatsa nityaśuddhaṃ sadā bhavet // //
analyzed: ātma jñam tu punar vatsa nitya śuddham sadā bhavet
translated: O child, one who knows the Self should always be pure.

original: nāsya śuddhiraśuddhirvā śodhanīyaṃ hi ketanam /
analyzed: na asya śuddhiḥ aśuddhiḥ vā śodhanīyam hi ketanam
translated: It has neither purity nor impurity, for the abode is to be purified.

original: nitya śuddhi hitaṃ bhūtvā na kiñcit sādhayatyasau // //
analyzed: nitya śuddhi hitam bhūtvā na kiñcid sādhayati asau  /
translated: Having become always pure, it does not accomplish anything.

original: vikalporthairmalairvatsa aśuddhaṃ taṃ ca tattvataḥ /
analyzed: vikalpa ūrthaiḥ malaiḥ vatsa aśuddham tam ca tattvataḥ
translated: O child, it is impure due to the impurities of objects and alternatives.

original: yasya śaktirbhavatyugrā yaḥ śodhayati vai param // //
analyzed: yasya śaktiḥ bhavati ugrā yaḥ śodhayati vai param
translated: He who has fierce power and purifies the supreme,

original: sa śodhayati sarveṣāṃ bhūtānāṃ ca samuddharet /
analyzed: sa śodhayati sarveṣām bhūtānām ca samuddharet
translated: he purifies all beings and liberates them.

original: atorthāt ketanaṃ vatsa ātmajñe niṣprayojanam // //
analyzed: atorthāt ketanam vatsaḥ ātma jñe niṣprayojanam
translated: Therefore, O child, the abode is purposeless in the knowledge of the Self.

original: sa eva bhogavānsākṣācchivaṃ parama kāraṇam /
analyzed: saḥ eva bhogavān sākṣāt śivam parama kāraṇam
translated: He alone is the experiencer, the manifest, and the supreme cause, Śiva.

original: sa eva paramaṃ dāma tatra śuddhyati te khilaṃ // //
analyzed: saḥ eva paramam dāma tatra śuddhi ati te khilam
translated: He alone is the supreme refuge, and there everything is purified.

original: ātmanenātmanā caiva yajate parameśvaram /
analyzed: ātmanena ātmanā ca eva yajate parameśvaram
translated: By oneself and by one's own Self, one worships the Supreme Lord,

original: yathoktena vidhānena samyg yoga balena tu // //
analyzed: yathā uktena vidhānena samygdh yoga balena tu
translated: by the prescribed method and by the power of perfect Yoga.

original: yajate mānasaṃ yāgaṃ manasā tu amīśvaram /
analyzed: yajate mānasam yāgam manasā tu
translated: One worships the mental sacrifice with the mind, the Supreme Lord,

original: p / yajante devatāssarve brahmādyāśca maharṣayaḥ // //🔽tadātvaṃ mānase naiva yāgena śikhivāhana /
analyzed: yajante devatāḥ sarve brahma ādyāḥ ca mahā ṛṣayaḥ    tadātvam mānase nā eva yāgena śikhivāhana
translated: and all the deities, Brahmā and the great sages, worship him.🔽At that time, O peacock-bannered one, in the mental sacrifice alone,

original: yogārthaṃ dravya sambhāraṃ taṃ hi cātraiva tiṣṭhati // //
analyzed: yoga artham tam hi ca atra eva tiṣṭhati
translated: the collection of substances for Yoga remains right there.

original: atha prārthayase kāmaṃ manasā manasepsitam /
analyzed: atha prārthayase kāmam manasā manasā īpsitam
translated: If you desire a boon in your mind, what you desire in your mind,

original: taṃ labhiṣyasi sarvaṃ vai mānase taṃ śikhidhvaja // //
analyzed: tam labhiṣyasi sarvam vai mānase tam śikhidhvaja
translated: you will obtain all that, O Shikhidhvaja, in your mind.

original: sākāraṃ yajate yastu nirākārotha vā punaḥ /
analyzed: sa ākāram yajate yaḥ tu vā punar
translated: He who worships with form or again without form,

original: ubhau tāvekadā vatsa yajatvaṃ yat tu rocate // //🔽nirlakṣaṃ nissvabhāvastaṃ sa lakṣaṃ pratimākṛtim /
analyzed: ubhau tau ekadā vatsa yajatvam yat tu rocate  / nirlakṣam nissvabhāvaḥ tam sa lakṣam pratimā ākṛtim
translated: both of them, O child, should worship at the same time, whatever is pleasing to you.

original: manasā citsvabhāvena sākārā kriyate kriyā // //
analyzed: manasā cit svabhāvena sa ākārā kriyate kriyā
translated: That which is without characteristics and without intrinsic nature, that form with characteristics is created by the mind with the nature of consciousness.

original: na caivā kṛtimānkaściccitsvabhāvonilaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: na bhavet
translated: And no one has a created form, the nature of consciousness would be like the wind.

original: tasmāt tvaṃ sarvadā vatsa nityaṃ śakti sthitaṃ yajet // //🔽citsaṃjñā citsamudbhutā bhutābhuteṣu saṃsthitā // //
analyzed: tasmāt tvam sarvadā vatsa nityam śakti sthitam yajet  cit saṃjñā cit samudbhutā bhuta abhuteṣu saṃsthitā
translated: Therefore, O child, you should always worship the eternal power that abides.🔽Consciousness is born from consciousness and abides in the elements and non-elements.

original: tattvāśca bhutā bhāvāni cicchaktyā bhyantare sthitāḥ /
analyzed: tattvāḥ ca bhutāḥ bhāvāni cicchaktyāḥ bhyantare sthitāḥ
translated: And the elements are the principles, abiding within consciousness by the power of consciousness.

original: saṃsthitāścivatattve rasadasarvagato vibhuḥ // //
analyzed: saṃsthitāḥ civa tattve rasada sarva gataḥ vibhuḥ
translated: And they abide in the principle of consciousness, the all-pervading lord who is the essence of rasa.

original: sarvamevaṃ hitaṃ vatsa hṛdisthaṃ prakaṭī kṛtam /
analyzed: sarvam evam hitam vatsa hṛdistham prakaṭīkṛtam
translated: All this, O child, is situated in the heart and made manifest.

original: taṃ hi pūjaya yatvena vidhidṛṣṭena karmaṇā // //
analyzed: tam hi pūjaya ya tvena vidhi dṛṣṭena karmaṇā
translated: Worship him with the rites seen in the scriptures.

original: na kaścidapitaṃ vatsa yasya taṃ na hṛdi sthitam /
analyzed: na kaścid apitam vatsa yasya tam na hṛdi sthitam
translated: No one, O child, has that which is not situated in the heart.

original: tasmāttaṃ pūjayedvatsa ahiṃsā kusumaiḥ śubhaiḥ // //
analyzed: tasmāt tam pūjayet vatsa ahiṃsā kusumaiḥ śubhaiḥ
translated: Therefore, O child, one should worship him with the flowers of non-violence.

original: hṛdisthaṃ tu punarvatsa sarvakāmaistu pūjayet /
analyzed: hṛdistham tu punarvatsa sarva kāmaiḥ tu pūjayet
translated: Again, O child, one should worship him in the heart with all desires.

original: dānāni yāni coktāni śivadharmekhilāni tu // //
analyzed: dānāni yāni ca uktāni śiva dharma ikhilāni tu
translated: All the gifts that have been mentioned in the entire Shivadharma,

original: tāni dattāni sarvāṇi bhavanti śikhivāhana /🔽sarvakāmāni vai tadvatmānasaṃ yāga muttamam // //
analyzed: tāni dattāni sarvāṇi bhavanti śikhivāhana  sarva kāmāni vai tadvat mānasam yāga muttamam
translated: Those are all given, O peacock-vehicled one.🔽In the same way, all desires are in the excellent self-sacrifice.

original: p / yāgaṃ tu paramaṃ hyetat sarvayāgottamottamam /
analyzed: yāgam tu paramam hi etat sarva yāga uttamottamam
translated: This is the supreme sacrifice, the best of all sacrifices.

original: iḍādayo yajed yastu rājasaṃ yāgamucyate // //
analyzed: iḍā ādayaḥ yajet yaḥ tu rājasam yāgam ucyate
translated: One who worships the Ida and other deities is said to perform the Rajasa sacrifice.

original: suṣumṇā tāmasaṃ / bhogaṃ / jñeyaṃ sātvikaṃ piṅgalodaye /
analyzed: suṣumṇā tāmasam bhogam jñeyam sātvikam piṅgalodaye
translated: The Susumna is the Tamasa. The rising of the Pingala is to be known as the Satvika enjoyment.

original: suṣumṇe tvāṃ parityajya piṅgalā nāḍisthaṃ yajet // //
analyzed: suṣumṇe tvām parityajya piṅgalā nāḍi stham yajet  /
translated: Abandoning you, O Susumna, one should worship the deity residing in the Pingala channel.

original: tāṃ vicāra yatnena brahmanāḍiśca ucyate /
analyzed: tām vicāra yatnena brahmanāḍiḥ ca ucyate
translated: One should carefully consider that, which is called the Brahma channel.

original: tasmin madhye sthitaṃ devaṃ taṃ nedaṃ pūjayet tu saḥ // //
analyzed: tasmin madhye sthitam devam tam na idam pūjayet tu saḥ  /
translated: One should not worship that deity residing in the middle of that.

original: yatkiñciditi kartavyaṃ tatsarvaṃ piṅgalodaye /
analyzed: yat kiñcid iti kartavyam tat sarvam piṅgala udaye
translated: Whatever is to be done, all that is in the rising of the Pingala.

original: turyodbhavati / sarvāṇi turyasthāne gatāni tu // //
analyzed: turyā udbhavati sarvāṇi turya sthāne gatāni tu
translated: When the fourth arises, all are gone to the place of the fourth.

original: cintayet sarvakāmāni anyathā hiṃsitāni tu /
analyzed: cintayet sarva kāmāni anyathā hiṃsitāni tu
translated: One should think of all desires, otherwise they are destroyed.

original: turyasthāne layaṃ kṛtvā hṛdhisthaṃ pūjayet sadā // //🔽yasya turye gatirnāsti hṛdisthaṃ tu kathaṃ yajet /
analyzed: turya sthāne layam kṛtvā hṛdhi stham pūjayet sadā  yasya turye gatiḥ nā asti hṛdistham tu katham yajet
translated: Having dissolved it in the fourth state, one should always worship it in the heart.🔽How can one worship what is in the heart if one has no access to the fourth state?

original: hṛdisthaṃ turyasaṃsthaṃ tu ubhau yo vetti tatvataḥ // //
analyzed: hṛdistham turya saṃstham tu ubhau yaḥ vetti tatvataḥ
translated: One who truly knows the fourth state as being in the heart,

original: p / ekataṃ bhūya eteṣāṃ sa pūjāṃ kartu marhati /
analyzed: bhūyas eteṣām sa pūjām kartu marhati
translated: He alone is worthy of performing the worship.

original: prāṇāpānāntarasthena śivena śikhivāhana // //
analyzed: prāṇa apāna antara sthena śivena śikhivāhana
translated: O child, the aspirant should unite with Śiva who is situated between the prāṇa and apāna breaths, O peacock-vehicled one.

original: yojayet sādhako vatsa sa vai sādhaka ucyate /
analyzed: yojayet sādhakaḥ vatsa sa vai sādhakaḥ ucyate
translated: He is called the aspirant.

original: prāṇāpānau tu sandigdhau rajastamasamanvitau // //
analyzed: prāṇa apānau tu sandigdhau rajaḥ tamaḥ samanvitau
translated: The prāṇa and apāna breaths are doubtful, endowed with rajas and tamas.

original: tasmāt tau varjayet vatsa yāgakāle tu sarvadā /
analyzed: tasmāt tau varjayet vatsa yāga kāle tu sarvadā
translated: Therefore, O child, one should always avoid them at the time of sacrifice.

original: sātvikaṃ saṅgamaṃ teṣāṃ tena kuryācchivārcanam // //
analyzed: sātvikam saṅgamam teṣām tena kuryāt śiva arcanam
translated: Their union should be of the sāttvika type, and by that one should perform Śiva's worship.

original: vahni pūjā tu te naiva anyathā na kṛtā bhavet /
analyzed: vahni pūjā tu te na eva anyathā na kṛtā bhavet
translated: The worship of the fire is not their own, otherwise it would not be done.

original: brahmādi stambha paryantaṃ trailokyaṃ sa carācaram // //
analyzed: brahma ādi stambha paryantam trailokyam sa carācaram
translated: From Brahmā to the pillar, the three worlds with their moving and unmoving beings,

original: ahiṃsā puṣpasekena pūjitaṃ taṃ sadā bhavet /
analyzed: ahiṃsā puṣpa sekena pūjitam tam sadā bhavet
translated: Would always be worshipped by him with the sprinkling of the flower of non-violence.

original: p / mānase naiva yāgena muktohaṃ sarvadā vibho // //
analyzed: mānase na eva yāgena muktaḥ aham sarvadā vibho
translated: O Lord, I am always liberated by the mental sacrifice alone.

original: tathāpi jñātu micchāmi japyaṃ vai sarvadā param // //
analyzed: tathā api jñātu m icchāmi japyam vai sarvadā param
translated: Nevertheless, I wish to know the supreme mantra to be always recited.

original: mānasaiścākṣaraughaiśca prāṇāpānau śikhidhvaja /
analyzed: mānasaiḥ ca akṣara oghaiḥ ca prāṇa apānau śikhidhvaja
translated: O Shikhidhvaja, the inhalation and exhalation of breath are the mental and verbal recitations.

original: rahasyaṃ caiva guhyaṃ ca japyaṃ japyottamottamam // //
analyzed: rahasyam ca eva guhyam ca japyam japya uttamottamam
translated: This is the secret, the mystery, the recitation, the best of recitations.

original: japyaṃ bahuvidhaṃ proktaṃ śivena paramātmanā /
analyzed: japyam bahuvidham proktam śivena paramātmanā
translated: The Supreme Self Shiva has spoken of many kinds of recitation.

original: na punarmānasaṃ japyaṃ mokṣamārgaphalapradam // //
analyzed: na punar mānasam japyam mokṣa mārga phala pradam
translated: But the mental recitation, which grants the fruits of the path to liberation, is not repeated.

original: mayi tuṣṭena nāthena ayaṃ mārgaḥ pradarśitaḥ /
analyzed: mayi tuṣṭena nāthena ayam mārgaḥ pradarśitaḥ
translated: This path has been shown by the Lord, who is pleased with me.

original: tadāhaṃ kathayiṣyāmi rahasyaṃ kṛttikā suta // //
analyzed: tadā aham kathayiṣyāmi rahasyam kṛttikā suta
translated: O son of Krittika, I will now tell you that secret.

original: sarveṣāmeva bhūtānāṃ hṛdisthaṃ yatparaṃ padam /
analyzed: sarveṣām eva bhūtānām hṛdistham yat param padam
translated: That supreme state which exists in the heart of all beings,

original: sa tu saṅkhyā yate japyaṃ japaṃ tu kurute tu saḥ // //
analyzed: sa tu saṅkhyā yate japyam japam tu kurute tu saḥ  /
translated: He who counts that and performs the recitation, he indeed performs the recitation.

original: ajñānā naiva budhyante jñānavijñāna varjitāḥ /
analyzed: ajñānāḥ na eva budhyante jñāna vijñāna varjitāḥ
translated: Those devoid of knowledge and wisdom do not understand it.

original: p / pratyahaṃ pratyahaṃ vatsa japasaṅkhyaṃ karoti saḥ // //
analyzed: pratyaham pratyaham vatsa japa saṅkhyam karoti saḥ  /
translated: O child, he performs the recitation daily, daily.

original: abyucchinna prabandhena maṇibhiḥ paramaiḥ śubhaiḥ /
analyzed: abyucchinna prabandhena maṇibhiḥ paramaiḥ śubhaiḥ
translated: With an unbroken continuity, with the supreme, auspicious gems,

original: sūrya cicchaktirityāhustasmiṃste kathitā guha // //🔽akṣasūtra paraṃ hyetadyogināṃ tattva cintakaḥ /
analyzed: sūrya cit śaktiḥ iti āhuḥ tasmin te kathitāḥ guha  akṣasūtra param hi etat yoginām tattva cintakaḥ
translated: They call it the power of the sun. O Guha, they are told in that.🔽This is the supreme rosary for yogis who contemplate the truth,

original: ye sthitā phalasandhāne vaśyākarṣaṇamāraṇe // //
analyzed: ye sthitā phala sandhāne vaśyā ākarṣaṇa māraṇe
translated: For those who are established in the attainment of fruits, in controlling, attracting, and killing.

original: japaṃ teṣāṃ tu mantraiśca akṣasūtrairanekaśaḥ /
analyzed: japam teṣām tu mantraiḥ ca akṣasūtraiḥ anekaśas
translated: Reciting their mantras with many rosaries,

original: punarātma vide vatsa mantra tantraiḥ prayojanam // //
analyzed: punarātma vide vatsa mantra tantraiḥ prayojanam
translated: But for those who know the Self, O child, there is no purpose in mantras or tantras.

original: prayojanaṃ bhavet teṣāmātmajñānena kevalam /
analyzed: prayojanam bhavet teṣām ātma jñānena kevalam
translated: For them, there is only a purpose in the knowledge of the Self.

original: taṃ viditvā mahāsena mantratantrāṃstyajedguha // //
analyzed: tam viditvā mahāsena mantra tantrān tyajet guha
translated: Having known that, O Mahasena, one should abandon mantras and tantras, O Guha.

original: athavā saṅkhyayā kāryaṃ mānasesmiñjape guha /
analyzed: athavā saṅkhyayā kāryam mānase smin jape guha
translated: Or, if one must perform the mental recitation by counting, O Guha,

original: tatohaṃ kathayiṣyāmi yathā bhavati tacchṛṇu // //
analyzed: tatas ham kathayiṣyāmi yathā bhavati tat śṛṇu  /
translated: then I will tell you how it is, listen to that.

original: ṣaṭkatāni sahasra /🔽p / ahorātrāntare japyaṃ kurute satataṃ śivaḥ /
analyzed: ṣaṭkatāni  ahorātra antare japyam kurute satatam śivaḥ
translated: Six thousand times🔽day and night, Shiva always recites.

original: śivajapyaṃ bhavedeṣa śivaṃ hyaśiva kāriṇam // //
analyzed: śiva japyam bhavet eṣa śivam hi aśiva kāriṇam
translated: This is Shiva's recitation, which brings auspiciousness to the inauspicious.🔽Prana draws up apana,

original: prāṇaśca karṣate pānamapānaḥ prāṇameva ca /
analyzed: prāṇaḥ ca karṣate pānam apānaḥ prāṇam eva ca
translated: and apana draws up prana.

original: ubhau cākarṣayedyastu sa japaṃ kurute guha // //
analyzed: ubhau ca ākarṣayet yaḥ tu sa japam kurute guha
translated: One who draws up both, O Guha, performs japa.

original: hṛtsthānād dvādaśāntaṃ tu dvādaśāntāt punarhṛdi /
analyzed: hṛd sthānāt dvādaśāntam tu dvādaśāntāt punar hṛdi
translated: From the location of the heart up to the end of the twelve, and from the end of the twelve back to the heart,

original: evāṃ gamāgamaṃ jñeyaṃ taṃ japaṃ brahmaśāśvatam // //
analyzed: evām gama āgamam jñeyam tam japam brahma śāśvatam
translated: this coming and going should be known as the japa of the eternal Brahman.

original: viditaṃ mānasaṃ japyamakṣasūtraṃ tathaiva ca /
analyzed: viditam mānasam japyam akṣasūtram tathā eva ca
translated: The mental recitation and the rosary are known in the same way.

original: agnikāryaṃ ca metātatatvamācakṣva vai prabho // //
analyzed: agni kāryam ca mā ita atata tvam ācakṣva vai prabho
translated: Now tell me about the fire ritual and the truth, O Lord.

original: mayājñānāmṛtaṃ vatsa snehāt te prakaṭī kṛtam /
analyzed: mayā ajñāna amṛtam vatsa snehāt te prakaṭī kṛtam
translated: O child, I have revealed to you the nectar of knowledge out of affection.

original: bhūyopi kathayiṣyāmi agnikāryaṃ tu mānasam // //🔽p / carācarāṇāṃ bhūtānāṃ sarveṣāṃ śikhivāhana /
analyzed: bhūyas api kathayiṣyāmi agni kāryam tu mānasam  cara acarāṇām bhūtānām sarveṣām śikhivāhana
translated: I will tell you again about the mental fire ritual.🔽O peacock-vehicled one, the supreme radiance that resides in the hearts of all beings, moving and unmoving,

original: hṛdisthaṃ paramaṃ tejo na tu jānanti mohitāḥ // //🔽ādityastapate tasya tejasā tasya vai guha /
analyzed: hṛdistham paramam tejaḥ na tu jānanti mohitāḥ  ādityaḥ tapate tasya tejasā tasya vai guha
translated: the deluded ones do not know.🔽The sun shines with its radiance, O Guha.

original: jvalanasya tu tat tejaḥ pūrṇamindustathaiva ca // //🔽tarhyupāsītavidhivadagnī yaḥ śikhivāhana /
analyzed: jvalanasya tu tat tejaḥ pūrṇam induḥ tathā eva ca  tarhi upāsīta vidhivat agnī yaḥ śikhivāhana
translated: The radiance of the fire is complete, as well as the moon.🔽Then one should duly worship the fires, O peacock-vehicled one.

original: bāhyegnīnāṃ hutaṃ havyaṃ hiṃsanti guhyakādayaḥ // //
analyzed: bāhya ignīnām hutam havyam hiṃsanti guhyaka ādayaḥ
translated: The offerings made to the external fires are harmed by the Guhyakas and others.

original: mantra doṣāśca doṣāśca aśubhairvādayā bhavet /
analyzed: mantra doṣāḥ ca doṣāḥ ca aśubhaiḥ vādayā bhavet
translated: And the faults of mantras and faults would arise from inauspicious acts.

original: tadā te lupyate vatsa bāhyāgniṣu hutaṃ haviḥ // //
analyzed: tadā te lupyate vatsa bāhyāgniṣu hutam haviḥ  /
translated: Then, O child, the oblation offered in the external fires is destroyed by them.

original: idhmādi dravyasaṃbhāraṃ sarvaṃ cicchakti saṃbhavam /
analyzed: idhma ādi dravya saṃbhāram sarvam cicchakti saṃbhavam
translated: The entire collection of materials like kindling arises from the power of consciousness.

analyzed: yadā atra hūyate yasmāt tasmāt tam hiṃsa pūrvakam
translated: Since it is offered here from that, therefore it is preceded by harm.

original: ahiṃsā pūrvakaṃ vatsa svadehe hyagni pūjanam /
analyzed: ahiṃsā pūrvakam vatsa sva dehe hi agni pūjanam
translated: O child, the worship of the fire in one's own body is preceded by non-violence.

original: śivāgnirvaibhavatyeṣa śivamaśivahāriṇam // //
analyzed: śiva agniḥ vaibhavatī eṣa śivam aśiva hāriṇam  /
translated: This auspicious fire shines, the auspicious remover of inauspiciousness.

original: p / garbhādānādi saṃskārairna hi tatra prayojanam /
analyzed: garbhādāna ādi saṃskāraiḥ na hi tatra prayojanam
translated: O Skanda, there is no purpose in the sacraments beginning with the Garbhadhana (consecration of the embryo) in that (case).

original: na hi kuṇḍaṃ nu vaḥ kāryaṃ mekhalairvātha yoninā // //
analyzed: na hi kuṇḍam nu vaḥ kāryam mekhalaiḥ vā atha yoninā
translated: The sacrificial pit should not be made, nor the altar, nor the womb.

original: kāryamevaṃ hi vai cātra vidhināśikhi vāhana /
analyzed: kāryam evam hi vai ca atra vidhinā aśikhi vāhana
translated: O Skanda, the rite should be performed here in this way according to the rules.

translated: O child, I have shown you the three sacrificial pits and fires in order.

translated: One should perform their oblations with rites seen in the rules.🔽Relying on the Suṣumnā channel, one should perform the northern solstice.

analyzed: dakṣiṇāgnim tatas juhyāt nābhikuṇḍe sthite guha
translated: Then, O Guha, one should offer the Dakṣiṇāgni in the sacrificial pit of the navel.

analyzed: iḍā nāḍī udayam kṛtvā kuryāt vai dakṣiṇāyanam
translated: Having made the rising of the Iḍā channel, one should perform the southern solstice.

analyzed: tadā ca āhavanīya ugniḥ mukha kuṇḍe sthitaḥ guha
translated: Then, O Guha, the Ahavaniya fire is located in the sacrificial pit of the mouth.

analyzed: tasmin kāle yajet yaḥ tu tat sarvam ca akṣayam bhavet
translated: Whatever one worships at that time becomes imperishable.

analyzed: siddhi ante sarva kāmāni manasā ca īpsitāni ca
translated: All desires are fulfilled, even those wished for in the mind.

analyzed: prāṇa ādyāḥ vāyavaḥ pañca homayet tu yathākramam
translated: One should offer the five vital airs, beginning with Prāṇa, in order.

analyzed: taiḥ hutaiḥ sarvam akhilam viśvam santarpitam bhavet
translated: By offering them, the entire universe becomes satisfied.

analyzed: amṛtam bhavate vatsa amṛtam taṃtu tiṣṭhati

analyzed: tadā tat akhilam viśvam tṛptam bhavati ca apare

analyzed: prāṇa apāna antara stham tu yaiḥ jñātam
translated: Those who know what is between Prāṇa and Apāna, O peacock-crested one,
